data.et: You who have completely vanquished hosts of kings several times, propitiated (your) ancestors with the waters in the form of the blood of kings, control your wrath that has no adversary. What is your concern, Oh Parakurama , with this (child) Rama ?”

data.v: अजीगणद्दशरथं न वाक्यं यदा स दर्पेण तदा कुमारः । धनुर्व्यकार्क्षीद्गुरु-बाण-गर्भं लोकानलावीद्विजितांश्च तस्य ॥
data.et: When, through haughtiness, he did not take heed of Dasaratha's words, the prince drew fully the bow, having a strong arrow (fixed) in it and shattered the (spiritual) world won by him (through penance).

data.v: जिते नृपाऽरौ सुमनीभवन्ति शब्दायमानान्य-शनैर्-शङ्कम् । वृद्धस्य राज्ञो ऽनुमते बलानि जगाहिरे ऽनेक-मुखानि मार्गान् ॥
data.et: The adversary of the kings having been vanquished, the troops, feeling delighted in their minds, shouting aloud dauntlessly, facing diversely, plunged into the roads with the permission of the old King.

data.v: अथ पुरु-जव-योगान्नेदयद्दूर-संस्थं दवयदति-रयेण प्राप्तमुर्वी-विभागम् । क्लम-रहितमचेतन्नीरजीकारित-क्ष्मां बलमुपहित-शोभां तूर्णमायादयोध्याम् ॥
data.et: Afterwards bringing far of places near by re . sorting to great speed, and leaving far of the stretches of the earth that had been reached, by their excessive speed, the army, free from fatigue, quickly and unknowingly reached Ayodhya wherein the grounds had been cleared of dust and decorations arranged.

data.v: वधेन संख्ये पिशिताऽशनानां क्षत्राऽन्तकस्या ऽभिभवेन चैव ।आढ्यंभविष्णुर्यशसा कुमारः प्रियंभविष्णुर्न स यस्य नाऽऽसीत् ॥
data.et: There was none to whom prince (Rama), becoming eminent in fame through the killing of the demons in battle and defeating the destroyer of kings (Parasurama), did not endear himself.

data.v: ततः सुचेतीकृत-पौर-भृत्यो "राज्ये ऽभिषेक्ष्ये सुतमित्य-नीचैः ।आघोषयन्भूमि-पतिः समस्तं भूयोऽपि लोकं सुमनीचकार ॥
data.et: Loudly announcing thusI shall coronate my son (as) the king," King (Dasaratha) who had (previously also) pleased the minds of the citizens and servants, now, once again made the minds of the people joyous.

data.v: आदिक्षदादीप्त-कृशानु-कल्पं सिंहासनं तस्य स-पाद-पीठम् । सन्तप्त-चामीकर-वल्गु-वज्रं विभाग-विन्यस्त-महार्घ-रत्नम् ॥
data.et: And (he) ordered for him (Rama), along with a foot- rest, a throne resembling blazing fire (in resplendence), having beautiful diamonds, charming like molten gold and having highly valuable jewels studded on (its) parts.

data.v: प्रास्थापयत्पूग-कृतान्स्व-पोषं पृष्टान्प्रयत्नाद्दृढ-गात्र-बन्धान् । स-भर्म-कुम्भान्पुरुषान्समन्तात्पत्काषिणस्तीर्थ-जलाऽर्थमाशु ॥
data.et: And, for holy waters, he got hurriedly dispatched all around, men who were formed into groups and who were fostered with effort on his own riches, whose limbs had a firm build, who were walking on foot and had golden potes.

data.v: उक्षान्प्रचक्रुर्नगरस्य मार्गान्ध्वजान्बबन्धुर्मुमुचुः ख-धूपान् । दिशश्च पुष्पैश्चकरुर्विचित्रै- रर्थेषु राज्ञा निपुणा नियुक्ताः ॥
data.et: Experts appointed by the king on various assignments got the city roads properly sprinkled, hoisted banners, fumigated the sky with frankincense and strewed the quarters with multi coloured flowers.

data.v: मातामहाऽऽवासमुपेयिवांसं मोहाद-पृष्ट्वा भरतं तदानीम् । तत्केकयी सोढुम-शक्नुवाना ववार रामस्य वन-प्रयाणम् ॥
data.et: Unable to tolerate that, Kekayi, through infatuation, without consulting Bharata who had at that time gone to his maternal grandfather's residence, chose (a boon, being Rama's departure to the forest

data.v: कर्णे-जपैराहित-राज्य-लोभा स्त्रैणेन नीता विकृतिं लघिम्ना । राम-प्रवासे व्यमृशन्न दोषं जनाऽपवादं स-नरेन्द्र-मृत्युम् ॥
data.et: Greed for the kingdom, introduced into her by secret tale-bearers, and driven to perversity by womanish meanness, she did not think of the guilt of censure from the people, together with the death of the king (inherent) in the banishment of Rama.

data.v: वसूनि देशांश्च निवर्तयिष्यन्रामं नृपः संगिरमाण एव । तया ऽवजज्ञे भरताऽभिशेको विषाद-शङ्कुश्च मतौ निचख्ने ॥
data.et: The desire for the retention (lit, return) of Rama by promising (her) riches and regions by the king was ignored by her and the dart of grief (in the form of) the coronation of Bharata was implanted into his heart.

data.v: ततः प्रविव्राजयिषुः कुमार- मादिक्षदस्या ऽभिगमं वनाय । सौमित्रि-सीताऽनुचरस्य राजा सुमन्त्र-नेत्रेण रथेन शोचन् ॥
data.et: Then, willing to send Rama into exile, the bewailing king ordered his despatch to the forest, with Laksmana and Sita as his followers, in a chariot having Sumantra for its driver.

data.v: केचिन्निनिन्दुर्नृपम-प्रशान्तं विचुक्रुशुः केचन साऽस्रमुच्चैः ।ऊचुस्तथा ऽन्ये भरतस्य मायां धिक्केकयीमित्यपरो जगाद ॥
data.et: Some censured the listless king, some lamented aloud with tears, others talked about the fraud of Bharata, (while) still another said, "Fie upon Kekay."

data.v: "गतो वनं श्वो भवितेति रामः" शोकेन देहे जनता ऽतिमात्रम् । धीरास्तु तत्र च्युत-मन्यवो ऽन्ये दधुः कुमाराऽनुगमे मनांसि ॥
data.et: To the forest tomorrow will Rama be gone." Thus some people chafed (lit. burnt) beyond limit through grief, while other courageous ones, who gave up grief, set their minds to follow the prince.

data.v: प्रस्थास्यमानावुपसेदुषस्तौ शोशुच्यमानानिदमूचतुस्तान् । "किं शोचतेहा ऽभ्युदये बता ऽस्मान्नियोग-लाभेन पितुः कृताऽर्थान् ॥
data.et: About to set out, the two (Rama and Laksmapa) spoke to those that were lamenting continuously. Coming near (they consoled) them thus : "Oh ! how strange ! Why do you , in this good fortune, lament for us who are content to receive our father's command.

data.v: असृष्ट यो यश्च भयेष्वरक्षीद्यः सर्वदा ऽस्मानपुषत्स्व-पोषम् । महोपकारस्य किमस्ति तस्य तुच्छेन यानेन वनस्य मोक्षः ॥
data.et: ‘‘Is reciprocation of our heavy obligation to him who begot us, always protected us in calamities and nourished us on his own wealth, (possible) by (our) worthless departure to the forest ?

data.v: विद्युत्-प्रणाशं स वरं प्रनष्टो यद्वोर्ध्व-शोषं तृण-वद्विशुष्कः ।अर्थे दुरापे किमुत प्रवासे न शासने ऽवास्थित यो गुरूणाम् ॥
data.et: He had better perish like a lightning flash or get parched up standing erect, (he) who did not abide by the command of his father regarding even an object hard to be secured. What then of (mere) exile ?

data.v: पौरा ! निवर्तध्वमिति न्यगादीत् "तातस्य शोकाऽपनुदा भवेत । मा दर्शताऽन्यं भरतं च मत्तो" निवर्तयेत्याह रथं स्म सूतम् ॥
data.et: Return, citizens, said (Rama). Be the removers of father's grief ; and do not look upon Bharata as different from me.” “‘Turn the chariot (towards the forest), thus he addressed the charioteer.

data.v: ज्ञात्वेङ्गितैर्गत्वरतां जनाना- मेकां शयित्वा रजनीं स-पौरः । रक्षन्वने-वास-कृताद्भयात्तान्प्रातश्छलेना ऽपजगाम रामः ॥
data.et: Having known, from their indicative jestures, the intention of the people to accompany him and having slept in the company of the citizens for one night, (thus) protecting them from the dangers caused by residence in a forest, Rama left at dawn, by (resorting to) a trick.

data.v: अस्राक्षुरस्रं करुणं रुवन्तो मुहुर्मुहुर्न्यश्वसिषुः कपोष्णम् । हा राम ! हा कष्टमिति ब्रुन्वतः पराङ्-मुखैस्ते न्यवृतन्मनोभिः ॥
data.et: Wailing piteously, they (the citizens) shed tears, repeatedly heaved hot sighs (and) saying, ‘‘Alas, Oh Rama ! Alas !, " they returned (to Ayodhya) with reluctant minds.

data.v: सूतो ऽपि गङ्गा-सलिलैः पवित्वा सहाऽऽश्वमात्मानमनल्प-मन्युः । स-सीतयो राघवयोरधीयन्श्वसन्कदुष्णं पुरमाविवेश ॥
data.et: Having cleaned himself and the horses with the waters of the Gangas, the charioteer, too, whose grief was not the less, entered the city regretfully remembering the two descendants of Raghu and Sita and heaving hot sighs.

data.v: प्रतीय सा पूर्ददृशे जनेन द्यौर्भानु-शीतांशु-विनाकृतेव । राजन्य-नक्षत्र-समन्विता ऽपि शोकाऽन्धकार-क्षत-सर्व-चेष्टा ॥
data.et: On returning, was seen by the people the city resembling the sky bereft of the Sun and the Moon, devoid of all activity due to the darkness of grief, though endowed with stars in the form of warriors.

data.v: विलोक्य रामेण विना सुमन्त्र- मच्योष्ट सत्वान्नृ-पतिश्च्युताऽऽशः । मधूनि नैषीद्व्यलिपन्न गन्धैर्मनो-रमे न व्यवसिष्ट वस्त्रे ॥
data.et: On seeing Sumantra without Rama, the king whose hope was gone, swerved from his (natural) courage. He desired not for wines, did not anoint (himself) with scented unguents and did not put on attractive garments.

data.v: आसिष्ट नैकत्र शुचा व्यरंसीत्कृताऽकृतेभ्यः क्षिति-पाल-भाग्-भ्यः । स चन्दनोशीर-मृणाल-दिग्धः शोका-ग्निना ऽगाद्द्यु-निवास-भूयम् ॥
data.et: He would not sit at one place, and through grief, (he) became indifferent to the royal tasks, whether done or undone; (though) anointed with sandalkhus and lotusstalk (juice), he passed away into the state of the heaven-dwellers.

data.v: विचुक्रुशुर्भूमि-पतेर्महिष्यः केशांल्लुलुञ्चुः स्व-वपूंषि जघ्नुः । विभूषणान्युन्मुमुचुः क्षमाया पेतुर्बभञ्जुर्वलयानि चैव ॥
data.et: The Queens of the king wailed aloud, tore off (their) hair, struck (their) bodies, pulled off (their) ornaments, fell on the ground and even broke their bracelets.

data.v: ताः सान्त्वयन्ती भरत-प्रतीक्षा तं बन्धु-ता न्यक्षिपदाशु तैले । दूतांश्च राजाऽऽत्मजमानिनीषून्प्रास्थापयन्मन्त्रि-मतेन यूनः ॥
data.et: Consoling them and waiting for Bharata, the kinsmen hastily placed him (Dasaratha) in oil and, desirous of fetching the son of the Kingdespatched, with the consent of the ministers, young messengers.

data.v: "सुप्तो नभस्तः पतितं निरीक्षां- चक्रे विवस्वन्तमधः स्फुरन्तम्" ।आख्यद्वसन्मातृ-कुले सखिभ्यः पश्यन्प्रमादं भरतो ऽपि राज्ञः ॥
data.et: Living in his maternal abodeBharata also saw, ( while ) asleep, the sun fallen from the sky and shooting downwards; sensing danger to the King, he told (so) to his friends.

data.v: अशिश्रवन्नात्ययिकं तमेत्य दूता यदा ऽर्थं प्रयियासयन्तः ।आंहिष्ट जाताऽञ्जिहिषस्तदा ऽसा- वुत्कण्ठमानो भरतो गुरूणाम् ॥
data.et: When, having arrived and desirous of making him start, the messengers did not communicate to him the disastrous fact, Bharata, in whom the desire to start was born, departed, anxiously remembering (bis) elders

data.v: बन्धूनशाङ्किष्ट समाकुलुत्वा- दासेदुषः स्नेह-वशादपायम् । गोमायु-सारङ्ग-गणाश्च सम्यङ्ना ऽयासिषुर्भीममरासिषुश्च ॥
data.et: Being distressed on account of the influence of affection, he suspected his kinsmen to have fallen into calamity; herds of deer and jackals did not cross him auspiciously but yelled horridly.

data.v: स प्रोषिवानेत्य पुरं प्रवेक्ष्यन्शुश्राव घोषं न जनौघ-जन्यम् ।आकर्णयामास न वेद-नादान्न चोपलेभे वणिजां पणाऽयान् ॥
data.et: Having reached (Ayodhya), he who had stayed away for long and (was nowentering the city, did not hear any commotion emanating from the streams of people. Nor did he hear the chanting of the Vedasand he did not perceive any profit to (or mutual enquiries amongst) the traders.

data.v: चक्रन्दुरुच्चैर्नृ-पतिं समेत्य तं मातरो ऽभ्यर्णमुपागताऽस्राः । पुरोहिताऽमात्य-मुखाश्च योधा विवृद्ध-मन्यु-प्रतिपूर्ण-मन्या ॥
data.et: Having joined him who had sat down, the mothers and the warriors headed by the priests and ministers, to whom tears had come and whose veins in the nape had swollen through intensified grief, wept aloud for the King

data.v: दिदृक्षमाणः परितः स-सीतं रामं यदा नैक्षत लक्ष्मणं च । रोरुद्यमानः स तदाऽभ्यपृच्छद्यथावदाख्यन्नथ वृत्तमस्मै ॥
data.et: When, desirous of seeing Rama along with Sita and Laksmana, he did not see them around, then, weeping incessantly he enquired of them ; thereupon they narrated to him the happening just) as it had taken place.

data.v: आबद्ध-भीम-भ्रुकुटी-विभङ्गः शेश्वीयमानाऽरुण-रौद्र-नेत्रः ।उच्चैरुपालब्ध स केकयीं च शोके मुहुश्चाविरतं न्यमाङ्क्षीत् ॥
data.et: He, whose eyebrows were knit in a terrific frown and whose red and fierce eyes were extremely swollen, loudly abused Kekayi again and again, and plunged into continuous grief.

data.v: नृपाऽऽत्मजौ चिक्लिशतुः स-सीतौ ममार राजा वि-धवा भवत्यः । शोच्या वयं भूर-नृपा लघुत्वं केकय्युपज्ञं बत बह्वनर्थम् ॥
data.et: The two princes, accompanied by Sita have suffered; the King has expired; you (are) widows; we (are) pitiable ; the earth (is) kingless; alas, the first mean (strategy) of Kekayi has entailed manifold disasters."

data.v: नैतन्मतं मत्कमिति ब्रुवाणः सहस्र-शो ऽसौ शपथानशप्यत् ।उद्वाश्यमानः पितरं स-रामं लुठ्यन्स-शोको भुवि रोरुदा-वान् ॥
data.et: "This idea is not mine." Thus saying he (Bharata) swore thousands of oaths; loudly crying for his father and Rama, and wallowing on the ground he wept and wept (continuously)

data.v: तं सुस्थयन्तः सचिवा नरेन्द्रं दिधक्षयन्तः समुदूहुरारात् ।अन्त्याऽऽहुतिं हावयितुं स-विप्राश्चिचीषयन्तोऽध्वर-पात्र-जातम् ॥
data.et: Putting him at ease, desirous of cremating the King and intent upon collecting the various utensils for having the last oblation offered, the ministers, together with the brahmins, had (the king's body) carried not very far.

data.v: उदक्षिपन्पट्ट-दुकूल-केतू- नवादयन्वेणु-मृदङ्ग-कांस्यम् । कम्बूंश्च तारानधमन्समन्तात्तथाऽऽनयन्कुङ्कुम-चन्दनानि ॥
data.et: They hoisted banners of silken cloth, played on flutes, drums and bell-metal gongs, blew high-pitched conchs and also scattered saffron and sandalwood all around

data.v: श्रोत्राऽक्षि-नासा-वदनं स-रुक्मं कृत्वाऽजिने प्राक्-शिरसं निधाय । सञ्चित्य पात्राणि यथा-विधान- मृत्विग्जुहाव ज्वलितं चिताऽग्निम् ॥
data.et: Having made his (Dasaratha's) ears, eyes, nose and mouth full of gold, having laid him head eastwards on a deer skin, and having arranged the utensils according to relevant rites, the chief officiating priest offered oblations in the ignited funeral fire

data.v: कृतेषु पिण्डोदक-सञ्चयेषु हित्वाऽभिषेकं प्रकृतं प्रजाभिः । प्रत्यानिनीषुर्विनयेन रामं प्रायादरण्यं भरतः स-पौरः ॥
data.et: When the oblations of rice-balls and water (had been offered), and the collection of bones had been doneBharata desirous of bringing Rama back, proceeded in humility, along with the citizens, to the forest, after setting aside the coronation suggested by the subjects.

data.v: शीघ्रायमाणैः ककुभोऽश्नुवानैर्जनैर-पन्थानमुपेत्य सृप्तैः । शोकाद-भूषैरपि भूश्चकासा- ञ्चकार नागेन्द्र-रथाऽश्व-मिश्रैः ॥
data.et: The earth began to glitter with people proceeding hastily, pervading the quarters, trailing along after spilling over to non-roads, mingled with big elephants, chariots and horses though (they were) void of ornamens on account of mourning.

data.v: उच्चिक्यिरे पुष्प-फलं वनानि सस्नुः पित्न्पिप्रियुरापगासु ।आरेटुरित्वा पुलिनान्यशङ्कं छायां समाश्रित्य विशश्रमुश्च ॥
data.et: They (the peopleplucked flowers and fruits from the forests, took bath and propitiated the manes in the rivers and going fearlessly to the sandy banksconversed (among themselves) and rested, taking shelter in the shadow.

data.v: संप्राप्य तीरं तमसाऽऽपगाया गङ्गाऽम्बु-सम्पर्क-विशुद्धि-भाजः । विगाहितुं यामुनमब्मु पुण्यं ययुर्निरुद्ध-श्रमवृत्तयस्ते ॥
data.et: Having reached the bank of the Tamasa river that had attained special purity through contact with the waters of the Ganges, theyin whom the advent of fatigue had been checked, went ahead to take a dip in the sacred water of the Ganges

data.v: ईयुर्भरद्वाज-मुनेर्निकेतं यस्मिन्विशश्राम समेत्य रामः । च्युताऽशनायः फलवद्-विभूत्या व्य्स्यन्नुदन्यां शिशिरैः पयोभिः ॥
data.et: (They) went to the hermitage of Bharadwaja to which Rama had gone and rested. And, with (their) hunger removed through the luxuriance of fruit-trees, they quenched (their) thirst with the cool water.

data.v: वाचं-यमान्स्थण्डिल-शायिनश्च युयुक्षमाणाननिशं मुमुक्षून् ।अध्यापयन्तं विनयात्प्रणेमुः पद्गा भरद्वाज-मुनिः स-शिष्यं ॥
data.et: Walking on foot, they bowed to sage Bharadwaja and his pupils, with modesty, Bharadwaja who was teaching, day and night, those that controlled their speech, slept on bare ground, desired to practise yoga and wished for salvation

data.v: आतिथ्यमेभ्यः परिनिर्विवप्सोः कल्प-द्रुमा योग-बलेन फेलुः । धाम-प्रथिम्नो म्रदिमाऽन्वितानि वासांसि च द्राघिम-वन्त्युदूहुः ॥
data.et: Through the power of concentrated meditation of that reservoir of lustre who was desirous of offering hospitality to them, the wish-yielding trees bore fruit and produced clothes possessing softness and length.

data.v: आज्ञां प्रतीषुर्विनयादुपास्थुर्जगुः सरागं ननृतुः स-हावम् । स-विभ्रमं नेमुरुदारमुचुस्तिलोत्तमाऽऽद्या वनिताश्च तस्मिन् ॥
data.et: And, there, Tilottama and other damsels accepted his orders, humbly waited upon him, sang in musical melodies, danced with jesticulations, bowed gracefully and spoke courteously.

data.v: वस्त्राऽन्न-पानं शयनं च नाना कृत्वाऽवकाशे रुचि-संप्रक्wxल्क़्क़्प्तम् । तान्प्रीति-मानाह मुनिस्ततः स्म "निवध्वमाध्वं पिबताऽत्त शेध्वम् ॥
data.et: Having kept ready, at various places, clothes, food, drinks and bedstastefully arranged, the delighted sage then told then, ‘‘War, eat, drink and sleep."

data.v: ते भुक्तवन्तः सु-सुखं वसित्वा वासांस्युषित्वा रजनीं प्रभाते । द्रुतं समध्वा रथ-वाजि-नागैर्मन्दाकिनीं रम्य-वनां समीयुः ॥
data.et: They ate with delight; having put on the garments and stayed overnight, taking hastily to the road by chariots, horses and elephants, at day-break, they reached the Ganges having charming woods (on its banks)

data.v: वैखानसेभ्यः श्रुत-राम-वार्तास्ततो विशिञ्जान-पतक्त्रि-सङ्घम् ।अभ्रं-लिहाऽग्रं रवि-मार्ग-भङ्गमानंहिरे ऽद्रिं प्रति चित्र-कूटम् ॥
data.et: Having heard the news about Rama from the hermits, they thence proceeded towards the Citrakuta mountain which had flocks of chirping birds, whose summit scratched the sky, (constituting, as it were) an obstacle on the path of the sun.

data.v: दृष्ट्वोर्णुवानान्ककुभो बलौघान्वितत्य शार्ङ्गं कवचं पिनह्य । तस्थौ सिसंग्रामयिषुः शितेषुः सौमित्रिरक्षि-भ्रुवमुज्जिहानः ॥
data.et: On seeing the streams of army fooding the quarters, having stretched his bow and put on his armour, the son of Sumitra who had sharp arrows and who was desirous of fighting stood (ready), raising his eyes and eyebrows.

data.v: शुक्लोत्तरासङ्ग-भृतो वि-शस्त्रान्पादैः शनैरापततः प्र-मन्यून् ।औहिष्ट तान्वीत-विरुद्ध-बुद्धीन्विवन्दिषून्दाशरथिः स्व-वर्ग्यान् ॥
data.et: The son of Dasaratha (Rama) inferred these (armies) that bore white upper garments, ( carrying ) no weapons , approaching slowly on foot and were full of grief, to be his own partisans, devoid of adverse motives and desirous of saluting (him).

data.v: स-मूल-काषं चकषू रुदन्तो रामाऽन्तिकं बृंहित-मन्यु-वेगाः ।आवेदयन्तः क्षिति-पालमुच्चैः- कारं मृतं राम-वियोग-शोकात् ॥
data.et: Weeping, with the tempo of their grief accelerated, and reporting vociferously that the King was dead an account of the grief of separation from Rama, they scratched the ground around Rama so that they (seemed to have) dug (the earth) to its very roots.

data.v: चिरं रुदित्वा करुणं स-शब्दं गोत्राऽभिधायं सरितं समेत्य । मध्ये-जलाद्राघव-लक्ष्मणाभ्यां प्रत्तं जलं द्व्यञ्जलमन्तिकेऽपाम् ॥
data.et: Having wept for long, piteously and loudly, and (then) having gone to the river and (dipped) in the midstream, water was offered, near the waters, by Rama and Laksmana (in oblation) with the cavity of the joined palms, after uttering (Dasaratha's) name.

data.v: "अरण्य-याने सु-करे पिता मा प्रायुङ्क्त राज्ये बत दुष्-करे त्वाम् । मा गाः शुचं वीर ! भरं वहा ऽमुम्"आभाषि रामेण वचः कनीयान् ॥
data.et: Father ordained me for going to the forest which was easy to do. Alas, he appointed you for administration which is difficult to carry on . Oh courageous one, do not attain grief ; bear this burden." The younger brother (Bharata) was addressed by Rama with these words.

data.v: "कृती श्रुती वृद्ध-मतेषु धीमांस्त्वं पैतृकं चेद्वचनं न कुर्याः । विच्छिद्यमाने ऽपि कुले परस्य पुंसः कथं स्यादिह पुत्र-काम्या ॥
data.et: Accustomed to listening to and acting upon the ideas of the elders and possessed of intelligence, if you do not carry out the paternal order, how then would there arise in this world the desire in any other person, for a son even if the family were to become extinct ?

data.v: अस्माकमुक्तं बहु मन्यसे चेद्यदीशिषे त्वं न मयि स्थिते च । जिह्रेष्य-तिष्ठन्यदि तात-वाक्ये जहीहि शङ्कां व्रज शाधि पृथ्वीम्।" ॥
data.et: If you regard our opinion highly, if you do not (wish to prevail while I exist, if you are ashamed of not abiding by the father's words, then give up fear, go back and rule the earth,’” (said Rama )

data.v: "वृद्धौरसां राज्य-धुरां प्रवोढुं कथं कनीयानहमुत्सहेय । मा मां प्रयुक्थाः कुल-कीर्ति-लोपे" प्राह स्म रामं भरतोऽपि धर्य्मम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘How could I, the younger, dare to bear the yoke of the kingdom, fit to be borne by the eldest, legitimate son ? Do not ordain me for the destruction of the family reputation." To Rama, Bharata too spoke (these) dutiful (words).

data.v: "ऊर्जस्-वलं हस्ति-तुरङ्गमेतदमूनि रत्नानि च राज-भाञ्जि । राजन्यकं चैतदहं क्षितीन्द्रस्त्वयि स्थिते स्यामिति शान्तमैतत्।" ॥
data.et: ‘‘These mighty troops of elephants and horses, these jewels worthy of a king and this host of warriors (to be mine) and I to become the king while you are alive, this (view) has to stop" (added he.

data.v: इति निगदितवन्तं राघवस्तं जगाद "व्रज भरत ! गृहीत्वा पादुके त्वं मदीये । च्युत-निखिल-विशङ्कः पूज्यमानो जनौघैः सकल-भुवन-राज्यं कारया ऽस्मन्-मतेन" ॥
data.et: To him who spoke thus, Rama said, "You return, taking with you my sandals. Freed from all doubts and being respected by streams of people, carry on the administration of the whole world at our behest.'

data.v: निवृत्ते भरते धी-मानत्रे रामस्तपो-वनम् । प्रपेदे पूजितस्तस्मिन्दण्डकारण्यमीयिवान् ॥
data.et: When Bharata had gone back, the wise Rama repaired to the penance-grove of Atri. (After having been) honoured there, he went to the Dandaka forest.

data.v: अटाट्यमानो ऽरण्यानीं स-सीतः सह-लक्ष्मणः । बलाद्बुभुक्षुणोत्क्षिप्य जह्रे भीमेन रक्षसा ॥
data.et: Wandering extensively through that vast forest, along with Sita and Laksmana, Rama, having been picked up, was carried away by a ferocious hungry demon.

data.v: अवाक्-शिरसमुत्-पादं कृतान्तेना ऽपि दुर्-दमम् । भङ्क्त्वा भुजौ विराधाऽऽख्यं तं तौ भुवि निचख्नतुः ॥
data.et: Having broken his arms, the two (Rama and Laksmana) buried in the ground, that (demon), whose name was Viradha, whose head was downwards and feet lifted up, and who was difficult to be subdued even by the God of Death (Yama).

data.v: आंहिषातां रघु-व्याघ्रौ शरभङ्गाऽऽश्रमं ततः ।अध्यासितं श्रिया ब्राह्म्या शरण्यं शरणैषिणाम् ॥
data.et: Thereafter, the two best of Raghus proceeded to the hermitage of Sarabhaiga, which was the abode of Vedic (i.e., spiritual) glory and the refuge for those who desired shelter.

data.v: पुरो रामस्य जुहवाञ्चकार ज्वलने वपुः । शरभङ्गः प्रदिश्याऽऽरात्सुतीक्ष्ण-मुनिः-केतनम् ॥
data.et: Having pointed out the nearby resort of sage Sutikspa, Sarabhaiga, sacrificed his body in fire, in the presence of Rama.

data.v: "यूयं समैष्यथेत्यस्मि न्नासिष्महि वयं वने । दृष्टाः स्थ स्वस्ति वो यामः स्व-पुण्य-विजितां गतिम्" ॥
data.et: (At the time of sacrificing himself, Sarabhanga said to Rama) : ‘‘We resided in this forest (expecting) that you would arrive; (now) you have been seen; farewell to you ; we depart to the status earned by our own religious merit."

data.v: तस्मिन्कृशानु-साद्-भूते सुतीक्ष्ण-मुनि-सन्निधौ ।उवास पर्ण-शालायां भ्रमन्ननिशमाऽऽश्रमान् ॥
data.et: When the (sage Sarabhaiga) had been reduced to ashes by fire, (Rama) lived day and night in a cottage of leaves in the neighbourhood of sage Sutiksna.

data.v: वनेषु वासतेयेषु निवसन्पर्ण-संस्तरः । शय्योत्थायं मृगान्विध्यन्नातिथेयो विचक्रमे ॥
data.et: Residing in habitable forests, that hospitable (Rama) having a bed of leaves, after getting out of the bed wandered about shooting wild beasts.

data.v: ऋग्-यजुषमधीयानान्सामान्यांश्च समर्चयन् । बुभुजे देव-सात्-कृत्वा शूल्यमुख्यं च हेम-वान् ॥
data.et: Paying homage to sages that were reciting *ks and yajes and those who were experts in the samans, Rama performing (daily) sacrifices, ate after offering to the Gods meat cooked on a spit and in a pan.

data.v: वसानस्तन्त्रक-निभे सर्वाङ्गीणे तरु-त्वचौ । काण्डीरः खाड्गकः शार्ङ्गी रक्षन्विप्रांस्तनुत्र-वान् ॥
data.et: Wearing a pair of bark-garments that resembled new unbleached pieces of cloth and which covered the whole body, wielding a sword, bow and arrows, wearing an armour and protecting the brahmins,

data.v: हित्वाऽऽशितङ्गवीनानि फलैर्येष्वाशितम्भवम् । तेष्वसौ दन्दशूकाऽरिर्वनेश्वानभ्र निर्-भयः ॥
data.et: —that dauntless enemy of the beasts of prey, shifted to forests that could provide satiety with fruit, after having deserted woodlands that were already grazed by the cattle.

data.v: व्रातीन-व्याल-दीप्राऽस्त्रः सुत्वनः परिपूजयन् । पर्षद्वलान्महा-ब्रह्मैराट नैकटिकाऽऽश्रमान् ॥
data.et: Along with excellent brahmins (he, whose missiles blazed against the savage beasts that killed the labourers, wandered to the neighbouring hermitages (graced) with an assembly of Vedic scholars, paying homage to the performers of Soma sacrifices.

data.v: परेद्यव्यद्य पूर्वेद्युरन्येद्युश्चाऽपि चिन्तयन् । वृद्धि-क्षयौ मुनीन्द्राणां प्रियं-भावुक-तामगात् ॥
data.et: Thinking about the prosperity and adversity of excellent sages, for tomorrow, today, yesterday and (all) other days too, (he) came to be dear (to them).

data.v: आ-तिष्ठद्-गु जपन्सन्ध्या प्रक्रान्तामायतीगवम् । प्रातस्तरां पतत्रिभ्यः प्रबुद्धः प्रणमन्रविम् ॥
data.et: (He) who got up at dawn earlier than the birds, recited (the gayatri mantra being the prayer to the dawn bowing to the sun from the time of the arrival of the cows for milking (in the stable) till they had been milked.

data.v: ददृशे पर्ण-शालायां राक्षस्या ऽभीकया ऽथ सः । भार्योढं तमवज्ञाय तस्थे सौमित्रयेऽसकौ ॥
data.et: Then he was seen in the leaf-cottage by a voluptuous demoness. Disregarding him, who had married a wife, that contemptible (demoness) waited covetingly upon Laksmana.

data.v: दधाना वलि-भं मध्यं कर्ण-जाह-विलोचना । वाक-त्वचेनाऽति-सर्वेण चन्द्र-लेखेव पक्षतौ ॥
data.et: Bearing a waist having folds, her eyes stretching upto the root of the ears, with her voice and skin surpassing everything else, and resembling the crescent of the moon at the beginning of the (bright) fortnight,

data.v: सु-पाद्द्वि-रद्-नासोरूर्मृदु-पाणि-तलाऽङ्गुलिः । प्रथिमानं दधानेन जघनेन घनेन सा ॥
data.et: -shewhose legs were well-shaped, whose thighs resembled the trunk of the elephant, whose palms and fingers were delicate and whose solid buttocks possessed massiveness.

data.v: उन्-नसं दधती वक्त्रं शुद्ध-दल्-लोल-कुण्डलम् । कुर्वाणा पश्यतः शंयून्स्रग्विणी सु-हसाऽऽनना ॥
data.et: –(she stood) carrying a face with a prominent nose, clean teeth and dangling ear-rings, wearing a chaplet, with a sweet smile on her face and causing the onlookers to feel delighted.

data.v: प्राप्य चञ्चूर्यमाणा पतीयन्ती रघूत्तमम् ।अनुका प्रार्थयाञ्चक्रे प्रिया-कर्तुं प्रियं-वदा ॥
data.et: Having approached (Laksmana), the best of Raghus, that sweetspeaking, lustful one, frolicking in an abominable manner, praised him (thus), towards making him favourable (to her).

data.v: "सौमित्रे ! मामुपायंस्थाः कम्रामिच्छुर्वशं-वदाम् । त्वद्-भोगीनां सह-चरीम-शङ्कः पुरुषाऽऽयुषम्।" ॥
data.et: ‘‘Oh son of Sumitra, desirable and fearless, accept me, for your wife, me who am pining (for you), (who am) at your command, good for pleasure and a (willing) partner for the duration of a man's life.'

data.v: तामुवाच स-"गौष्ठीने वने स्त्री-पुंस-भीषणे ।अ-सूर्यं-पश्य-रूपा त्वं किम-भीरुररार्यसे ॥
data.et: He told her, In (this) forest (which was once) the site of a cowpen, (but now) terrific for women and men, why do you, fearless and having a form unseen (even) by the sun, wander wantonly ?

data.v: मानुषानभिलष्यन्ती रोचिष्णुर्दिव्य-धर्मिणी । त्वमप्सरायमाणेह स्व-तन्त्रा कथमञ्चसि ॥
data.et: Pining for human males , shining, possessing divine . characteristics, appearing like a celestial damsel and self-willed, how (is it that you wander about ?

data.v: उग्रं-पश्याऽऽकुलो ऽरण्ये शालीन-त्व-विवर्जिता । कामुक-प्रार्थना-पट्वी पतिवत्नी कथं न वा ॥
data.et: Or, how (is it that) in this forest, infested with ferocious animals, you, devoid of modesty, and adept in soliciting a lover, are not having a husband ?

data.v: राघवं पर्ण-शालायामिच्छा ऽनुरहसं पतिम् । यः स्वामी मम कान्ता-वानौपकर्णिक-लोचनः ॥
data.et: In the cottage of leaves, solicit Rama in privacy, for your husband, Rama who is my master, who has a wife and whose eyes stretch upto the ears,

data.v: वपुश्चान्दनिकं यस्य कार्णवेष्टकिकं मुखम् । संग्रामे सर्व-कर्मीणौ पाणी यस्यौपजानुकौ ॥
data.et: —'and whose body is perfumed with sandal, whose ears are adorned with ear-rings, and whose arms, are adepts in all activity in the battle, and reach upto (his) knees;

data.v: बद्धो दुर्-बल-रक्षाऽर्थमसिर्येनोपनीविकः । यश्चापमाश्मन-प्रख्यं सेषुं धत्तेऽन्य-दुर्-वहम् ॥
data.et: -"who has fastened, near the knot of his garment, a sword for the protection of the weak and who wields with an arrow, a bow (as hard) as granite and difficult to be wielded by another ;

data.v: जेता यज्ञ-द्रुहां संख्ये धर्म-सन्तान-सूर्वने । प्राप्य दार-गवानां यः मुनीनाम-भयं सदा" ॥
data.et: “‘‘the vanquisher, in battle, of the enemies of sacrifice, the propagator, in the forest, of a series of righteous acts , on approaching whom (there is) freedom for ever from fear for the sages, (their) wives and cattle."

data.v: ततो वावृत्यमाना ऽसौ राम-शालां न्यविक्षत । "मामुपायंस्त रामे"ति वदन्ती साऽऽदरं वचः ॥
data.et: Then, desirous of choosing (Rama) as her husband, she entered the cottage of Rama, respectfully, uttering the words, Rama, marry me."

data.v: "अ-स्त्रीको ऽसावहं स्त्री-मान्स पुष्यति-तरां तव । पतिर्"इत्यब्रवीद्रामस्"तमेव व्रज मा मुचः।" ॥
data.et: He (Laksmana, is) without a wife, I am with (my) wife. He is a worthier husband for you , said Rama. ‘‘Go to him only, do not leave (him)."

data.v: लक्ष्मणं ऽसा वृषस्यन्ती महोक्षं गौरिवा ऽगमत् । मन्मथाऽऽयुध-सम्पात-व्यथ्यमान-मतिः पुनः ॥
data.et: She whose mind was being tortured by the stroke of the weapon of Cupid again went to Laksmana, longing for sexual intercourse, like a cow (approaching) a stud bull.

data.v: तस्याः सासद्यमानाया लोलूया-वान्रघूत्तमः ।असिं कौक्षेयमुद्यम्य चकाराऽप-नसं मुखम् ॥
data.et: Having lifted the sword from his side, Laksmana keenly desirous of cutting, rendered the face of (Surpapakha), who was approaching hideously, devoid of the nose.

data.v: "अहं शूर्प-णखा नाम्ना नूनं ना ऽज्ञायिषि त्वया । दण्डो ऽयं क्षेत्रियो येन मय्यपाती"ति सा ऽब्रवीत् ॥
data.et: (She shouted), ‘I have, indeed, not been recognised by you as Sarpanakha by name, since this irremediable physical punishment (injury) has been inflicted upon me.

data.v: पर्यशाप्सीद्दिवि-ष्ठा ऽसौ संदर्श्य भय-दं वपुः ।अपिस्फवच्च बन्धूनां निनङ्क्षुर्विक्रमं मुहुः ॥
data.et: Having revealed her fearful form, she, standing in the sky, lamented loudlyand (as if) desirous of being destroyed, (she) repeatedly proclaimed the valour of (her) brothers.

data.v: खर-दूषणयोर्भ्रात्रोः पर्यदेविष्ट सा पुरः । विजिग्राहयिषू रामं दण्डकारण्य-वासिनोः ॥
data.et: Desirous of making them pick up a quarrel with Rama and Laksmana (who were ) dwelling in the forest, she wailed aloud in front of her brothers, Khara and Dusana

data.v: "कृते सौभागिनेयस्य भरतस्य विवासितौ । पित्रा दौर्भागिनेयौ यौ पश्यतं चेष्टितं तयोः ॥
data.et: You two behold the action of those two sons of unfortunate wives, who were sent into exile by their father for the sake of Bharata, the son of the fortunate wife.

data.v: मम रावण-नाथाया भगिन्या युवयोः पुनः ।अयं तापसकाद्ध्वंसः क्षमध्वं यदि वः क्षमम् ॥
data.et: May you tolerate, if it is tolerable to you, this deformity (inflicted) by the contemptible ascetic, upon me having Ravana as her protector and moreover the sister of you two,

data.v: अ-संस्कृत्रिम-संव्यानावनुप्त्रिम-फलाशिनौ ।अ-भृत्रिम-परीवारौ पर्यभूतां तथापि माम्।" ॥
data.et: The two who wear unfinished (unknit) clothing, eat uncultivated fruits and do not have any retinue nourished (by them), have nevertheless, humiliated me"

data.v: "श्वःश्रेयसमवाप्तासि" भ्रातृभ्यां प्रत्यभाणि सा । प्राणिवस्तव मानाऽर्थं व्रजाऽऽश्वसिहि मा रुदः ॥
data.et: You shall attain your own well-being,” (thus) she was replied to by her two brothers. *We two breathe (i.e., live) for the sake of your honour. Depart, take courage, do not weep."

data.v: जक्षिमो ऽनपराधेऽपि नरान्नक्तं-दिवं वयम् । कुतस्-त्यं भीरु ! यत्तेभ्यो द्रुह्यद्भ्यो ऽपि क्षमामहे।" ॥
data.et: We devour human beings day and night, even in the absence of any wrong (done to us). Whence come, Oh timid one, that we would tolerate those two bearing ill-will towards you."

data.v: तौ चतुर्दश-साहस्रबलौ निर्ययतुस्ततः । पारश्वधिक-धानुष्क-शाक्तिक-प्रासिकाऽन्वितौ ॥
data.et: Then the two, who had an army of fourteen thousand and were equipped with axes, bows, missiles and spearheads marched out.

data.v: अथ सम्पततो भीमान्विशिखै राम-लक्ष्मणौ । बहु-मूर्ध्नो द्वि-मूर्धांश्च त्रि-मूर्धाश्चा ऽहतां मृधे ॥
data.et: Later, in the battle, Rama and Laksmana killed, with (their) arrows, the terrific, assaulting (demons) who had many heads, two heads and three heads.

data.v: तैर्वृक्ण-रुग्ण-सम्भुग्न-क्षुण्ण-भिन्न-विपन्न-कैः। । निमग्नोद्विग्न-संह्रीणैः पप्रे दीनैश्च मेदिनी ॥
data.et: The earth was covered (all over) by those miserable ones (who were) shattered, twisted, crushed, pierced and disabled (and who felt) depressed, frightened and ashamed.

data.v: के-चिद्वेपथुमासेदुरन्ये दवथुमुत्तमम् । स-रक्तं वमथुं केचिद्भ्राजथुं न च के-चन ॥
data.et: Some attained (experienced) tremor, others extreme agony, a few (began) vomitting blood, but none (attained) splendour.

data.v: मृगयुमिव मृगो ऽथ दक्षिणेर्मा दिशमिव दाह-वतीं मरावुदन्यन् । रघु-तनयमुपाययौ त्रि-मूर्धो विशभृदिवोग्र-मुखं पतत्रि-राजम् ॥
data.et: Thereafter, (as if ) like a deer hurt in its right side approaching the hunter, like one thirsty in the desert running in the direction of a forest confiagration, like a snake running towards the lord of birds (Garuda) with his ferocious beak, the three headed demon (Trisiras) approached the scion of Raghus.

data.v: शित-विशिख-निकृत्तकृत्स्न-वक्त्रः क्षिति-भृदिव क्षिति-कम्प-कीर्ण-शृङ्गः । भयमुपनिदधे स राक्षसानाम-खिल-कुल-क्षय-पूर्व-लिङ्ग-तुल्यः ॥
data.et: (A moment later), Trisiras was standing there with all his heads cut off by sharp arrows, like a mountain whose peaks had been broken off by an earthquake, and as a warning about the imminent annihilation of the entire race and (as such) instilled terror in the demons.

data.v: निराकरिष्णू वर्तिष्णू वर्धिष्णू परतो रणम् ।उत्पतिष्णू सहिष्णू च चेरतुः खर-दूषणौ ॥
data.et: Desirous of annihilating (the enemy, staying put, growing (in strength), jumping up and bearing (the attack), Khara and Dusana stalked all over the battlefield.

data.v: तौ खड्ग-मुसल-प्रास-चक्र-बाण-गदा-करौ ।अकार्ष्टामायुध-च्छायं रजः-सन्तमसे रणे ॥
data.et: The two, who had swords, clubs, spearheads, discuses, arrows and maces in their hands, spread a thick shadow of weapons on the battlefield that was strewn over by the darkness produced by dust.

data.v: अथ तीक्ष्णाऽऽयसैर्बानैरधि-मर्म रघूत्तमौ । व्याधं व्याधम-मूढौ तौ यम-साच्-चक्रतुर्द्विषौ ॥
data.et: Then piercing again and again (their) vitals with arrows having sharpened tips of steel, the two alert and excellent of Raghus made over the two enemies to Yama (the God of Death).

data.v: हत-बन्धुर्जगामा ऽसौ ततः शूर्प-णखा वनात् । पारे-समुद्रं लङ्कायां वसन्तं रावणां पतिम् ॥
data.et: Surpanakha, whose brothers had been slain, then fled from the forest to (her) protector Ravana residing in Lanka across the occan.

data.v: संप्राप्य राक्षस-सभं चक्रन्द क्रोध-विह्वला । नाम-ग्राममरोदीत्सा भ्रातरौ रावणाऽन्तिके ॥
data.et: Having reached the assembly of the demons, she, who was agitated by wrath, wailed aloud. (Standing) by the side

data.v: "दण्डकानध्यवात्तां यौ वीर ! रक्षः-प्रकाण्डकौ । नृभ्यां संख्येऽकृशातां तौ स-भृत्यौ भूमि-वर्ध्नौ ॥
data.et: Oh warrior, the two excellent demons who dwelt in the Dandaka forestsalong with (their) servants, have been turned into corpses, in battle, by two human beings.

data.v: विग्रहस्तव शक्रेण बृहस्पति-पुरोधसा । सार्धं कुमार-सेनान्या शून्यश्चाऽसीति को नयः ॥
data.et: ‘‘You (took up) the cudgels against Indra who had Brhaspati for his priest and Kumara (Sadanana) for his commander. And, what ( sort of ) policy (is) this that you are disspirited (now) ?

data.v: यद्यहं नाथ ! ना ऽयास्यं वि-नासा हत-बान्धवा । ना ऽज्ञास्यस्त्वमिदं सर्वं प्रमाद्यंश्चार-दुर्-बलः ॥
data.et: ‘‘Oh Lord, if I, whose nose has been cut off and whose brothers have been killed, had not come over (here), you would not have known that all, weak in espionage and inattentive (that you are).

data.v: करिष्यमाणं विज्ञेयं कार्यं किं नु कृतं परैः ।अपकारे कृते ऽप्यज्ञो विजिगीषुर्न वा भवान् ॥
data.et: ‘(Even) the task that will be achieved by the enemies (in the future) should be known (by a king); what then of that which has (already been done ? Ignorant, even when a harm ( is done ), is it (possible) that you are not (at all) intent on victory ?

data.v: वृतस्त्वं पात्रे-समितैः खट्वाऽऽरूढः प्रमाद-वान् । पान-शौण्डः श्रियं नेता ना ऽत्यन्तीन-त्वमुन्मनाः ॥
data.et: Surrounded by parasites, ascending (others' ) beds, a bantering hard drunkard and listless (that) you (are), (your) royal riches will not stay with you for all times,

data.v: अध्वरेष्वग्निचित्वत्सु सोमसुत्वत आश्रमान् ।अत्तुं महेन्द्रियं भागमेति दुश्च्यवनो ऽधुना ॥
data.et: NowIndra visits the hermitages of Soma sacrificers for partaking of the portion offered to Mahendra in sacrifices which are attended upon by fireworshippers.

data.v: आमिक्षीयं दधि-क्षीरं पुरोडाश्यं तथौषधम् । हविर्हैयङ्गवीनं च नाऽप्युपघ्नन्ति राक्षसाः ॥
data.et: The demons also do not destroy the milk and curds for amakathe (rice ) plant for (preparing the parodata, the oblation material and the fresh ghee.

data.v: युव-जानिर्धनुश्-पाणिर्भूमि-ष्ठः ख-विचारिणः । रामो यज्ञ-द्रुहो हन्ति काल-कल्प-शिलीमुखः ॥
data.et: Rama who has a young wife, (and holds) a bow in (his) hand kills, standing on the ground, the sacrifice-hating (demons) with death-like arrows

data.v: मांसान्योष्ठाऽवलोप्यानि साधनीयानि देवताः ।अश्नन्ति रामाद्रक्षांसि बिभ्यश्रुवते दिशः ॥
data.et: The deities eat lumps of (soft) meat meant as material (for sacrifice) and can be cut with the (the mere) lips ; the demons, afraid of Rama, eat the quarters (i.e., empty space) !

data.v: कुरु बुद्धिं कुशाऽग्रियामनुकामीन-तां त्यज । लक्ष्मीं परम्परीणां त्वं पुत्र-पौत्रीण-तां नय ॥
data.et: Make (your) intellect as sharp as the tip of the kuka grass; give up wantonness ; render your hereditary riches accessible to your sons and grandsons.

data.v: सहाय-वन्त उद्युक्ता बहवो निपुणाश्च याम् । श्रियमाशासते लोलां तां हस्ते-कृत्य मा श्वसीः ॥
data.et: Do not rest idle having brought within (your) hands the fickle riches which many energetic and expert (kings) possessing aids covet.

data.v: लक्ष्मीः पुं-योगमाशंसुः कुलटेव कुतूहलात् ।अन्तिके ऽपि स्थिता पत्युश्छलेनाऽन्यं निरीक्षते ॥
data.et: Riches (Laksmi) though seated in the vicinity of her husband looks at another (man) under (some) pretext, like a prostitute, desirous of union with him, out of curiosity.

data.v: योषिद्-वृन्दारिका तस्य दयिता हंस-गामिनी । दूर्वा-काण्डमिव श्यामा न्यग्रोध-परिमण्डला ॥
data.et: (Rama's) beloved wife is the most virtuous of young women, walking (gracefully) like a swan, slender like the stalk of dirva grass, and having a (broad) girth like that of a banyan tree.

data.v: नाऽऽस्यं पश्यति यस्तस्या निंस्ते दन्त-च्छदं न वा । संशृणोति न चोक्तानि मिथ्याऽऽसौ निहितेन्द्रियः ॥
data.et: He who neither beholds her face, nor kisses her lip, nor hears her remarks is endowed with senses in vain.

data.v: सारो ऽसाविन्द्रियाऽर्थानां यस्या ऽसौ तस्य नन्दथुः । तल्पे कान्ताऽन्तरैः सार्धं मन्ये ऽहं धिङ्निमज्जथुम् ॥
data.et: She is the (very) essence of the objects of the senses; happiness is (only) his to whom she belongs ; plunging into the bed with any other lovely lady is, I think, despicable.

data.v: न तं पश्यामि यस्या ऽसौ भवेन्नोदेजया मतेः । त्रैलोक्येनाऽपि विन्दस्त्वं तां क्रीत्वा सुकृती भव ॥
data.et: I do not behold anyone to whose mind she would not be an agitator; be blessed by acquiring her at the cost of even the three worlds.

data.v: नैवेन्द्राणी न रुद्राणी न मानवी न रोहिणी । वरुणानी न ना ऽग्नायी तस्याः सीमन्तिनी समा।" ॥
data.et: Not even Saci, nor Parvati, nor Satarupa, nor Rohini, nor the wife of Varuna, nor the spouse of Agni is as attractive as she.”

data.v: प्रत्यूचे राक्षसेन्द्रस्ताम् "आश्वसिहि बिभेषि किम् । त्यज नक्तञ्चरि ! क्षोभं वाचाटे ! रावणो ह्यहम् ॥
data.et: (Ravana), the lord of the demons replied to her, Be reassured; why do you fear ? Oh demoness, discard agitation, for, oh garrulous woman, I am (after all) Ravana.

data.v: मामुपास्त दिदृक्षा-वान्याष्टीक-व्याहतो हरिः ।आज्ञा-लाभोन्मुखो दूरात्काक्षेणा ऽनादरेक्षितः ॥
data.et: Desiring to see me, Indra (though) repelled by (my) cane-bearer (door-keeper) and looked at disrespectfully with an evil eye, from a distance(still) waits upon me

data.v: विरुग्णो-दग्र-घाराऽग्नः कुलिशो मम वक्षसि ।अ-भिन्नं शत-धा ऽऽत्मानं मन्यते बलिनं बली ॥
data.et: ‘‘The mighty thunderbolt, the edge of whose sharp blade was blunted on my chest, regards itself powerful (in as much as it was) not broken into a hundred fragments.

data.v: कृत्वा लङ्काद्रुमाऽऽलानमहमैरावतं गजम् । बन्धने ऽनुपयोगि-त्वान्नतं तृण-वदत्यजम् ॥
data.et: Having made the Airavata elephant to have a tree in Lanka as its tying post, did I not discard it like a blade of grass, on account of its being useless in fetters ?

data.v: आहोपुरुषिकां पश्य मम सद्-रत्न-कान्ति-भिः । ध्वस्ताऽन्धकारे ऽपि पुरे पूर्णेन्दोः सन्निधिः सदा ॥
data.et: Behold my wonderful manliness in as much as there is the constant presence of the Moon in my city, even though the darkness therein is destroyed by the brilliance of jewels,

data.v: हृत-रत्नश्च्युतोद्योगो रक्षोभ्यः कर-दो दिवि । पूतक्रतायीमभ्येति स-त्रपः किं न गोत्र-भित् ॥
data.et: Does the shameful Indra, bereft of (his) jewels, deprived of (his) occupation and paying tribute to the demons, not approach (and stay in hiding with) his wife in heaven ?

data.v: अ-तुल्य-महसा सार्धं रामेण मम विग्रहः । त्रपा-करस्तथाप्येष यतिष्ये तद्-विनिग्रहे।" ॥
data.et: ‘Shameful will be my enmity with Rama whose might is not comparable (to mine). Even then, here I shall try a special punishment on him."

data.v: उत्पत्य खं दश-ग्रीवो मनो-यायी शिताऽस्त्र-भृत् । समुद्र-सविधाऽऽवासं मारीचं प्रति चक्रमे ॥
data.et: Jumping up into the sky, travelling like the mind, (and) wielding a sharp missile, Ravana walked up to Marica who had his abode in the vicinity of the ocean.

data.v: सम्पत्य तत्-सनीडे-सौ तं वृत्तान्तमषिष्रवत् । त्रस्नुनाऽथ श्रुताऽर्थेन तेनाऽगादि दशाऽऽननः ॥
data.et: Descending by his Marica's) side, he (Ravana) made him listen to that happening (of the discomfiture of Surpanakha). Then Ravana was addressed thus by him who had heard the account and was feeling frightened :

data.v: "अन्तर्धत्स्व रघु-व्याघ्रात्तस्मात्त्वं राक्षसेश्वर ! । यो रण्ने दुरुपस्थानो हस्त-रोधं दधद्धनुः ॥
data.et: ‘Hide, Oh lord of demons, from that tiger of Raghus who, wielding a bow held lightly in (his) hand, is difficult to be faced on the battlefield.

data.v: भवन्तं कार्तवीर्यो यो हीन-सन्धिमचीकरत् । जिगाय तस्य हन्तारं स रामः सार्वलौकिकम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘That Rama vanquished the world-famous killer of the name Kartavirya who compelled you to make servile peace (with him).

data.v: यमाऽऽस्य-दृश्वरी तस्य ताडका वेत्ति विक्रमम्। । शूरं-मन्यो रणाच्चाऽहं निरस्तः सिंह-नर्दिना ॥
data.et: "Tadaka who saw the face of Yama knows his valour ; and I, Vainly regarding myself brave, was banished from the battlefield by him who roars like a lion.

data.v: न त्वं तेना ऽन्वभाविष्ठा ना ऽन्वभावि त्वया ऽप्यसौ ।अनुभूतो मया चा ऽसौ तेन चा ऽन्वभविष्यहम् ॥
data.et: You have not been tested by him, nor has he been tested by you, too; but he has been experienced by me and I have been experienced by him.

data.v: अध्यङ्शस्त्र-भृतां रामो न्यञ्चस्तं प्राप्य मद्-विधाः । स कन्या-शुल्कमभनङ्मिथिलायां मखे धनुः ॥
data.et: Rama is the supermost of weapon-bearers ; having confronted him, (persons) such as I, are the lowliest. As the dowry for the bride he broke the bow in the sacrifice at Mithila.

data.v: सं-वित्तः सह-युध्वानौ तच्-छक्तिं खर-दूषणौ । यज्वानश्च स-सुत्वानो यानगोपीन्मखेषु सः ॥
data.et: ‘Khara and Dusana who fought with him and the sacrificers along with the offerers of soma libation, know his might well.

data.v: सुख-जातः सुरा-पीतो नृ-जग्धो माल्य-धारयः ।अधि-लङ्कं स्त्रियो दीव्य मा ऽऽरब्धा बलि-विग्रहम्।" ॥
data.et: ‘(Oh you) who has experienced pleasure, drunk wine, devoured human beings and worn chaplets, gambled with women in Lanka ! please do not commence hostility with the mighty.

data.v: तंभीतं-कारमाक्रुश्य रावणः प्रत्यभाषत । "यात-यामं विजितवान्स रामं यदि किं ततः ॥
data.et: Having shouted at him , calling (him) a coward, Ravana replied, "If the defeated Parakurama who was aged, so what ?

data.v: अघानि ताडका तेन लज्जा-भय-विभूषणा । स्त्री-जने यदि तच्छ्लाघ्यं धिग्लोकं क्षुद्र-मानसम् ॥
data.et: To Tadaka bashfulness and timidity were ornaments; if that (shooting of the arrow) upon womenfolk were commendaable, (then) fie upon the mean-minded people (who perpetrated that crime).

data.v: यद्गेहे-नर्दिनमसौ शरैर्भीरुमभाययत् । कु-ब्रह्म-यज्ञ-के रामो भवन्तं पौरुषं न तत् ॥
data.et: It is no manliness that in the contemptible sacrifice of the wretched brahmin (Visvamitra) that Rama with (his) arrows frightened you, a coward who roars only in his) house.

data.v: चिर-कालोषितं जीर्णं कीट-निष्कुषितं धनुः । किं चित्रं यदि रामेण भग्नं क्षत्रिय-काऽन्तिके ॥
data.et: “What is there to be surprised if the bow lying there for long, worn out and eaten by insects, was broken by Rama in the presence of pitiable warriors.

data.v: वन-तापस-के वीरौ विपक्षे गलिताऽऽदरौ । किं चित्रं यदि साऽवज्ञौ मम्रतुः खर-दूषणौ ॥
data.et: What (is there) to wonder, if the two warriors (Khara and Dusana) who had lost (allconcern and were full of contempt for (their) adversary, the worthless forester ascetic, died ?

data.v: त्वं च भीरुः सु-दुर्बुद्धे ! नित्यं शरण-काम्यसि । गुणांश्चाऽपह्नुषेऽस्माकं स्तौषि शत्रूंश्च नः सदा ॥
data.et: ‘‘But you, whose intent is extremely evil, are a coward that seeks shelter for ever ; and (you) always deny my merits and praise my enemies

data.v: शीर्षच्-छेद्यमतोऽहं त्वा करोमि क्षिति-वर्धनम् । कारयिष्यामि वा कृत्यं विजिघृक्षुर्वनौकसौ ॥
data.et: Hence I shall turn you, who deserve to be beheaded, into a corpse; or else, desirous of punishing those two forest dwellers, I shall force you to do what must be done.'"

data.v: तमुद्यत-निषाताऽसिं प्रत्युवाच जिजीविषुः । मारीचो ऽनुनयंस्त्रासाद् "अभ्यमित्र्यो भवामि ते ॥
data.et: To him who had lifted his sharp sword, Marica, desirous of remaining alive and entreating (him) on account of fear, replied, I shall be confronting your enemy.

data.v: हरामि राम-सौमित्री मृगो भूत्वा मृग-द्युवौ ।उद्योगमभ्यमित्रीणो यथेष्टं त्वं च सं-तनु।" ॥
data.et: Having become a deer, I shall allure away Rama and Laksmana who are addicted to hunting; and confronting the enemy you accomplish the task as per your desire.'

data.v: ततश्चित्रीयमाणो ऽसौ हेम-रत्न-मयो मृगः । यथामुखीनः सीतायाः पुप्लुवे बहु लोभयन् ॥
data.et: Then that astonishing deer of gold and jewels leapt in front of Sita, fascinating (her) greatly.

data.v: तेना ऽदुद्यूषयद्रामं मृगेण मृग-लोचना । मैथिली विपुलोरस्कं प्रावुवूर्षुर्मृगाऽजिनम् ॥
data.et: Desirous of wearing the deer-skin, the Mithila Princess, who had deer-like eyes, forced the broad-chested Rama to hunt that deer.

data.v: योग-क्षेम-करं कृत्वा सीताया लक्ष्मणं ततः । मृगस्याऽनुपदी रामो जगाम गज-विक्रमः ॥
data.et: Then having put Laksmana in charge of the main tenance and security of Sita, Rama, whose gait was like that of an elephant, departed following the footsteps (heels) (of the deer).

data.v: स्थायं स्थायं क्वचिद्यान्तं क्रान्त्वा क्रान्त्वा स्थितं क्वचित् । वीक्षमाणो मृगं रामश्चित्र-वृत्तिं विसिष्मिये ॥
data.et: Rama was surprised at seeing the queer behaviour of the deer which went ahead at a spotstopped off and on, and moved on again.

data.v: चिरं क्लिशित्वा मर्मा-विद्रामो विलुभित-प्लवम् । शब्दायमानमव्यात्सीत्भय-दं क्षणदा-चरम् ॥
data.et: Adept in piercing the vitals, Rama, after having laboured for long, wounded the fearfully shouting demon whose leaps were deranged.

data.v: श्रुत्वा विस्फूर्जथु-प्रख्यं निनादं परिदेविनी । मत्वा कष्ट-श्रितं रामं सौमित्रिं गन्तुमैजिहत् ॥
data.et: Having heard a sound echoing the peal of thunder and having thought that Rama had fallen into trouble, the lamenting (Sita) desired Laksmana to go (to him).

data.v: "एष प्रावृषि-जाऽम्भो-द- नादी भ्राता विरौति ते । ज्ञातेयं कुरु सौमित्रे ! भयात्त्रायस्व राघवम्।" ॥
data.et: ‘‘Listen to the screams of your brother echoing the thunder of a cloud during rainy season ; Oh son of Sumitra, do the duty of a kinsman ; protect Rama from danger."

data.v: "राम-संघुषितं नैतन्मृगस्यैव विवञ्चिषोः । राम-स्वनित-सङ्काशः स्वान्"इत्यवदत्स ताम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘This is not the loud Scream of Rama. This is the yell (only) similar to that of Rama, (but really) of (that) deer who is desirous of deceiving (us)." Thus Laksmana spoke to her.

data.v: "आप्यान-स्कन्ध-कण्ठांऽसं रुषितं सहितुं रणे । प्रोर्णुवन्तं दिशो बाणैः काकुत्स्थं भीरु ! कः क्षमः ॥
data.et: Oh timid (Sita)” ! who indeed (is) capable of with standing, on the battlefield, enraged Rama whose frontal and hinder shoulders and neck are stout and who pervades the quarters with (his) arrows ?

data.v: देहं बिभ्नक्षुर-स्त्राऽग्नौ मृगः प्राणैर्दिदेविषन् । ज्या-घृष्ट-कठिनाऽङ्गुष्ठं राममायान्मुमूर्षया ॥
data.et: ‘(The deer) desirous of getting (his) body burnt in the fire of missiles and intent on gambling at the stake of his life, out of a desire to die, has approached Rama whose thumb is hardened due to its (constant) friction with the bow-string.

data.v: शत्रून्भीषयमाणं तं रामं विस्मापयेत कः । मा स्म भैषीस्त्वया ऽद्यैव कृताऽर्थो द्रक्ष्यते पतिः" ॥
data.et: Who would cause dismay to that Rama who (himself) terrifies (his) enemies ? Do not be anxious about him. The husband who has achieved his object will just be seen by you today (itself)."

data.v: "यायास्त्वमिति कामो मे गन्तुमुत्सहसे न च ।इच्छुः कामयितुं त्वं माम्"इत्यसौ जगदे तया ॥
data.et: It is my desire that you should go. You do not feel enthused to go because you are desirous of having me as your wife." Thus he was spoken to by her (Sita).

data.v: मृषोद्यं प्रवदन्तीं तां सत्य-वद्यो रघूत्तमः । निरगात् "शत्रु-हस्तं त्वं यास्यसी"ति शपन्वशी ॥
data.et: The self-restrained, excellent Raghu (Laksmana) who (always) spoke the truth, departed, cursing her, who uttered a falsehood, "You shall fall into the hands of the enemy"

data.v: गते तस्मिन्जल-शुचिः शुद्ध-दन्रावणः शिखी । जञ्जपूको ऽक्ष-माला-वान्धारयो मृदलाबुनः ॥
data.et: After he was gone, Ravana who was pure with (a bath in) water, whose teeth were clean, who bore a tuft of hair , who recited prayers constantly, who had a rosary of beads and carried a gourd-like earthen pitcher ;

data.v: कमण्डलु-कपालेन शिरसा च मृजा-वता । संवस्त्र्य लाक्षिके वस्त्रे मात्राः संभाण्ड्य दण्ड-वान् ॥
data.et: -(equipped) with the shell of a water-jar, a clean- groomed head and a staff, clad in lac-dyed garments and having procured the necessary material;

data.v: अधीयन्नात्म-विद्विद्यां धारयन्मस्करि-व्रतम् । वदन्बह्वङ्गुलि-स्फोटं भ्रू-क्षेपं च विलोकयन् ॥
data.et: - reciting the spiritual lore (Upanisads, keeping the vow of an ascetic speaking mostly with the movements of (his) fingers, and gazing with unkait eyebrows;

data.v: संदिदर्शयिषुः साम निजुह्नूषुः क्षपाट-ताम् । चंक्रमा-वान्समागत्य सीतामूचे"सुखाभव।" ॥
data.et: -intent on exhibiting peace-lovingness and con- cealing his identity as a demon, having faltering steps, having approached Sita, said, ‘Be agreeable (happy)."

data.v: सायं-तनीं तिथि-प्रण्यः पङ्कजानां दिवा-तनीम् । कान्तिं कान्त्या सदा-तन्या ह्रेपयन्ती शुचि-स्मिता ॥
data.et: Having a bright smile and putting to shame, by your ever-lasting charm, the evening lustre of the moon and the day-time beauty of the sun-lotuses;

data.v: का त्वमेकाकिनी भीरु ! निरन्वय-जने वने । क्षुध्यन्तो ऽप्यघसन्व्यालास्त्वाम-पालां कथं न वा ॥
data.et: ‘‘Oh timid one ! who are you, all alone in this forest, devoid of contact with human beings ? Or, how (is it) that wild beasts, though hungry, did not devour you who have no protector ?

data.v: हृदयं-गम-मूर्तिस्त्वं सुभगं-भावुकं वनम् । कुर्वाणा भीममप्येतद्वदा ऽभ्यैः केन हेतुना ॥
data.et: Rendering agreeable even this terrific forest, say, with what intention, have you, whose form is attractive to the heart, arrived here ?

data.v: सुकृतं प्रिय-कारी त्वं कं हरस्युपतिष्ठसे । पुण्य-कृच्चाटु-कारस्ते किङ्करः सुरतेषु कः ॥
data.et: What fortunate (person) do you, who behave pleasantly, wait upon in privacy ? Who is thy meritorious and sweet-speaking errand-boy during love-sports ?

data.v: परि-पर्युदधे रूपमा-द्यु-लोकाच्च दुर्-लभम्। । भावत्कं दृष्टवत्स्वेतदस्मास्वधि सु-जीवितम् ॥
data.et: Blessed is this life that is within us who have observed this beauty of yours which is beyond the (scope of) the ocean and difficult to get from the heaven.

data.v: आपीत-मधुका भृङ्गैः सुदिवेवाऽरविन्दिनी । सत्-परिमल-लक्ष्मीका ना ऽ-पुंस्काऽसीति मे मतिः ॥
data.et: Like a lotus-creeper whose honey is fully sucked by the bees and who is blessed with a sunny day, you, possessing the affluence of fragrance, are not without a male, that is my opinion.

data.v: मिथ्यैव श्रीः श्रियं-मन्या श्रीमन्-मन्यो मृषा हरिः । साक्षात्-कृत्याऽभिमन्येऽहं त्वां हरन्तीं श्रियं श्रियः ॥
data.et: Certainly false (is) the Goddess of Wealth who boasts of her glory; false (is) Hari who wrongly boasts as being the possesser of Laksmi, thus do I think after having cast (my) eyes upon you who vanquish the glory of Sri.

data.v: नोदकण्ठिष्यता ऽत्यर्थं त्वामैक्षिष्यत चेत्स्मरः । खेलायन्ननिशं नापि सजूः-कृत्य रतिं वसेत् ॥
data.et: Had Cupid seen you, he would neither have intensely pined for Rati nor, again, would he have made her his mate and remained sporting with her, day and night.

data.v: वल्गूयन्तीं विलोक्य त्वां स्त्री न मन्तूयतीह का । कान्तिं नाऽभिमनायेत को वा स्थाणु-समो ऽपि ते ॥
data.et: Having seen you looking (so) attractive, which woman in this world would not get enraged ? Or, again, what man, though like a pillar (or Siva) would not long for your charm ?

data.v: दुःखायते जनः सर्वाह्स एवैकः सुखायते । यस्योत्सुकायमाना त्वं न प्रतीपायसेऽन्तिके ॥
data.et: All men grieve; only that one takes delight in whose company, you being eager, do not become reluctant.

data.v: कः। पण्डितायमानस्त्वा- मादायाऽऽमिष-सन्निभाम् । त्रस्यन्वैरायमाणेभ्यः शून्यमन्ववसद्वनम्।" ॥
data.et: "Which person, who vainly regards himself learned and feels afraid of those who cherish enmity, has resorted to this deserted forest, taking you along, you who are similar to (a bait of) meat ?”

data.v: ओजायमाना तस्या ऽर्ध्यं प्रणीय जनकाऽऽत्मजा ।उवाच दशमूर्धानं साऽऽदरा गद्गदं वचः ॥
data.et: After offering him arghya (due to a guest), Sita getting valiant, (yet) full of respect, spoke to Ravana (these) choked (indistinct) words:

data.v: "महा-कुलीन ऐक्ष्वाके वंशे दाशरथिर्मम । पितुः प्रियं-करो भर्ता क्षेमं-कारस्तपस्विनाम् ॥
data.et: My highly noble-born husband, of the race of Iksvaku, (is Rama), the son of Dasaratha, doing what was desired by (his father, viz., providing well-being to the ascetics ;

data.v: निहन्ता वैर-काराणां सतां बहु-करः सदा । पारश्वधिक-रामस्य शक्तेरन्त-करो रणे ॥
data.et: - the killer of those that practise enmity, greatly obliging the good at all times, the destroyer, in battle, of the prowess of that Rama-who-wields-the-axe;

data.v: अध्वरेष्विष्टिनां पाता पूर्ती कर्मसु सर्वदा । पितुर्नियोगाद्राज-त्वं हित्वा योऽभ्यागमद्वनम् ॥
data.et: —the protector of the sacrificers during sacrifices, ever the nourisher in rituals, who having abandoned kingship at the command of his father, came over to (this) forest.

data.v: पितत्रि-क्रोष्टु-जुष्टानि रक्षांसि भय-दे वने । यस्य बाण-निकृत्तानि श्रेणी-भूतानि शेरते ॥
data.et: Torn by his arrows and fed upon by birds and jackals, demons lie piled in heaps in this terrific forest.

data.v: दीव्यमानं शितान्बाणानस्यमानं महा-गदाः । निघ्नानं शात्रवान्रामं कथं त्वं नाऽवगच्छसि ॥
data.et: How is it that you do not know Rama who strikes with sharp arrows, hurls huge maces and kills the enemies ?

data.v: भ्रातरि न्यस्य यातो मां मृगाविन्मृगयामसौ ।एषितुं प्रेषितो यातो मया तस्या ऽनु-जो वनम् ॥
data.et: Having entrusted me to his brother, that hunter has gone ahunting ; his younger brother, dispatched by me for knowing (his whereabouts) has gone to the forest."

data.v: अथा ऽऽयस्यन्कषायाऽक्षः स्यन्न-स्वेद-कणोल्बणः । संदर्षिताऽऽन्तराकूतस्तामवादीद्दशाननः ॥
data.et: Then, trying very hard, Ravana whose eyes became red, who was covered with particles of dripping sweat and who (now) revealed his internal motive, spoke to her :

data.v: "कृते कानिष्ठिनेयस्य ज्यैष्ठिनेयं विवासितम् । को नग्न-मुषित-प्रख्यं बहु मन्येत राघवम् ॥
data.et: Who would regard highly Rama, the son of the eldest (wife), exiled for the sake of the son of the youngest (wife), and similar to one (who is) naked and robbed (of everything) ?’’

data.v: राक्षसान्बटु-यज्ञेषु पिण्डी-शूरान्निरस्तवान् । यद्यसौ कूप-माण्डूकि ! तवैतावति कः स्मयः ॥
data.et: Oh female frog in a well ! if, during the sacrifices of a wretched brahmin, he has killed the demons that are valiant (only) at eating, what (sort of) pride of yours in just this much ?

data.v: मत्-पराक्रम-संक्षिप्त-राज्य-भोग-परिच्छदः । युक्तं ममैव किं वक्तुं दरिद्राति यथा हरिः ॥
data.et: Will it be proper for myself to say (as to) how Indra, whose kingdom and means of enjoyment were snatched away by my valour, has become a pauper ?

data.v: निर्-लङ्को विमदः स्वामी धनानां हृत-पुष्पकः ।अध्यास्ते ऽन्तर्-गिरं यस्मात्कस्तन्ना ऽवैति कारणम् ॥
data.et: Who knows not the reason why the Lord of Wealth (Kubera), deprived of Lanka, freed of arrogance, and with his Puspaka snatched away, stays in the (Kailasa) mountain ?'

data.v: भिन्न-नौक इव ध्यायन्मत्-तो बिभ्यद्यमः स्वयम् । कृष्णि-मानं दधानेन मुखेना ऽऽस्ते निरुद्यतिः ॥
data.et: Pondering like one whose boat is shattered and fearing me, Yama himself sits (idle) without any work and wears darkness on his face.

data.v: समुद्रोपत्यका हैमी पर्वताऽधित्यका पुरी । रत्न-पारायणं नाम्ना लङ्केति मम मैथिलि ! ॥
data.et: ‘‘Oh Mithila Princess ! my golden capital, Lanka by name(has) the ocean for its outskirts, and (is) situated on a mountain plateau.

data.v: आवासे सिक्त-संमृष्टे गन्धैस्त्वं लिप्त-वासिता ।आर्पितोरु-सुगन्धि-स्रक्तस्यां वस मया सह ॥
data.et: Along with me, anointed and perfumed with fragrant ingredients and having put on massive fragrant garlands, you stay there in an abode sprinkled and swept.

data.v: संगच्छ पौंस्नि ! स्त्रैणं मां युवानं तरुणी शुभे ! । राघवः प्रोष्य-पापीयान्जहीहि तम-किं-चनम् ॥
data.et: Oh beautiful young woman delightful to a young man ! do unite with me. The scion of the Raghus (Rama) (is) exiled and is very evil; abandon him, a penniless (wretch).

data.v: अश्नीत-पिबतीयन्ती प्रसिता स्मर-कर्मणि । वशे-कृत्य दश-ग्रीवं मोदस्व वर-मन्दिरे ॥
data.et: Intent on the act of love and ordering about 'eat, drink' (i.e.) becoming the mistress of the house), having made Ravana subservient (to yourself ), stay in the best of mansions.

data.v: मा स्म भूर्ग्राहिणी भीरु ! गन्तुमुत्साहिनी भव ।उद्भासिनी च भूत्वा मे वक्षःसंमार्दिनी भव।" ॥
data.et: Do not be obstinate, Oh timid one; be enthusiastic about going ; and after becoming highly brilliant, be the shambooer of my chest.'

data.v: तां प्रातिकूलिकीं मत्वा जिहीर्षुर्भीम-विग्रहः । बाहूपपीडमाश्लिष्य जगाहे द्यां निशा-चरः ॥
data.et: Reckoning her as adverse (to him), the demon of a terrific body, desirous of kidnapping her, having clutched her in his arms so tight as to crush her, plunged up into the sky.

data.v: त्रस्यन्तीं तां समादाय यतो रात्रिं-चराऽऽलयम् । तूष्णीं-भूय भयादासांचक्रिरे मृगपक्षिणः ॥
data.et: Having caught hold of her who was feeling frightened, he went to the homeland of the demons. Having become silent through terror, the birds and beasts stayed (put).

data.v: उच्चै रारस्यमानां तां कृपणां राम-लक्ष्मणौ । जटायुः प्राप पक्षीन्द्रः परुषं रावणं वदन् ॥
data.et: (But) Jatayu, the Lord of Birds, approached that miserable (Sita) shouting out loudly for Rama and Laksmana, speaking harsh words to Ravana.

data.v: "द्विषन् ! वने-चराऽग्र्याणां त्वमादाय-चरो वने ।अग्रे-सरो जघन्यानां मा भूः पूर्व-सरो मम ॥
data.et: Oh enemy, you that snatch and eat (the ascetics) and the best of forest-dwellers and are the foremost leader of the despicable ones, do not move ahead of me in the forest.

data.v: यशस्-कर-समाचारं ख्यातं भूवि दया-करम् । पितुर्वाक्य-करं रामं धिक्त्वां दुन्वन्तम-त्रपम् ॥
data.et: ‘Fie upon your shameless self that harasses Rama of a behaviour that brings glory, well-known in the world, acting compassionately and carrying out (his) father's orders.

data.v: अहमन्त-करो नूनं ध्वान्तस्येव दिवा-करः । तव राक्षस ! रामस्य नेयः कर्म-करोपमः ॥
data.et: Oh demon, I, like the Sun unto darkness, fit to be guided by Rama like an errand boy, am to bring about your end."

data.v: सतामरुष्-करं पक्षी वैर-कारं नराऽशिनम् । हन्तुं कलह-कारोऽसौ शब्द-कारः पपात खम् ॥
data.et: Intending to kill (Ravana ), the man-eater, injurious to the good and bearer of enmity, the fighting and roaring bird zoomed into the sky .

data.v: धुन्वन्सर्व-पथीनं खे वितानं पक्षयोरसौ । मांस-शोणित-संदर्शं तुण्ड-घातमयुध्यत ॥
data.et: Flapping the expanse of his two wings that pervaded all the paths (in the sky), he fought striking with his beak and, (on being struck by Ravana with his sword), exposing to sight (his) flesh and blood.

data.v: न बिभाय न जिह्राय न चक्लाम न विव्यथे ।आघ्नानो विध्यमानो वा रणान्निववृते न च ॥
data.et: Though being ripped, he (while) trying to kill, neither feared, nor fought shy, nor got tired, nor felt pained and did not back out from the fight.

data.v: पिशाच-मुख-धौरेयं स-च्छत्र-कवचं रथम् । युधि कद्-रथ-वद्भीमंबभञ्ज ध्वज-शालिनम् ॥
data.et: In the fight, he shattered, like a rickety chariot, the terrific chariot whose horses had the faces of demons, which carried an umbrella and a coat of arms, and which looked to advantage with its flag.

data.v: संत्रासयांचकाराऽरिं सुरान्पिप्राय पश्यतः । स त्याजयांचकाराऽरिं सीतां विंशति-बाहुना ॥
data.et: He frightened the enemy, delighted the gods and then caused Sita to be abandoned by the twenty-armed (Ravana).

data.v: अ-सीतो रावणः कासांचक्रे शस्त्रैर्निराकुलः । भूयस्तं भेदिकांचक्रे नख-तुण्डाऽऽयुधः ख-गः ॥
data.et: Devoid of Sita, Ravana, who was not distressed by (Jatayu's) weapons, began to curse; the bird whose nails and beak were (his weapons) again severely pierced him.

data.v: हन्तुं क्रोध-वशादीहांचक्राते तौ परस्पसम् । न वा पलायांचक्रे विर्दयांचक्रे न राक्षसः ॥
data.et: The two, under the influence of wrath, wished to kill each other. Neither did the bird run away nor did the demon take pity (on him).

data.v: उपासांचक्रिरे द्रष्टुं देव-गन्धर्व-किन्नराः । छलेन पक्षौ लोलूयांचक्रे क्रव्यात्पतत्रिणः ॥
data.et: The gods, gandharvas and kinnaras stood to by watch; but the filesh-eater went on cutting off by deceit the wings of the bird.

data.v: प्रलुठितमवनौ विलोक्य कृत्तं दश-वदनः ख-चरोत्तमं प्रहृष्यन् । रथ-वरमधिरुह्य भीम-धुर्यं स्व-पुरमगात्परिगृह्य राम-कान्ताम् ॥
data.et: On seeing the best of birds shorn off and laid rolling on the ground, the ten-faced (Ravana) feeling highly delighted drove to his city (of Lanka), after ascending his excellent chariot yoked with ferocious horses and having tightly clutched the wife Rama.

data.v: ओषांचकार कामाऽग्निर्दशा-वक्त्रमहर्-निशम्। । विदांचकार वैदेहीं रामादन्य-निरुत्सुकाम् ॥
प्रजागरांचकारारेरीहास्वनिशमादरात् । प्रबिभयांचकारा ऽसौ काकुत्स्थादभिशङ्कितः ॥
न जिह्रयांचकारा ऽथ सीतामभ्यर्थ तर्जितः। । नाप्यूर्जां बिभरामास वैदेह्यां प्रसितो भृशम् ॥
विदांकुर्वन्तु रामस्य वृत्तमित्यवदत्स्वकान् । रक्षांसि रक्षितुं सीतामाशिषच्च प्रयत्नवान् ॥
रामो ऽपि हत-मारीचो निवर्त्स्यन्खर-नादिनः । क्रोष्टून्समशृणोत्क्रूरान्रसतो ऽशुभ-शंसिनः ॥
आशङ्कमानो वैदेहीं खादितां निहतां मृताम् । स शत्रु-घ्नस्य सोदर्यं दूरादायान्तमैक्षत ॥
सीतां सौमित्रिणा त्यक्तां सध्रीचीं त्रस्नुमेकिकां । विज्ञाया ऽमंस्त काकुत्स्थः"क्षये क्षेमं सदुर्लभम्।" ॥
सोऽपृच्छल्लक्ष्मणं सीतां याचमानः शिवं सुरान् । रामं यथास्थितं सर्वं ब्राता ब्रूते स्म विह्वलः ॥
संदृश्य शरणं शून्यं भिक्षमाणो वनं प्रियाम् । प्राणान्दुहन्निवा ऽऽत्मानं शोकं चित्तमवारुधत् ॥
"गता स्यादवचिन्वाना कुसुमान्याश्रम-द्रुमान्। ।आ यत्र तापसान्धर्मं सुतीक्ष्णः शास्ति तत्र सा ॥
आः कष्टं बत ही-चित्रं हूं मातर्दैवतानि धिक् । हा पितः ! क्वा ऽसि हे सु-भ्रु !" बह्वेवं विललाप सः ॥
इहा ऽऽसिष्ठा ऽशयिष्टेह सा स-खेलमितो ऽगमत् ।अग्लासीत्संस्मरन्नित्थं मैथिल्या भरताऽग्रजः ॥
"इदं नक्तं-तनं दाम पौष्पमेतद्दिवा-तनम् । शुचेवोद्बध्य शाखायां प्रग्लायति तया विना ॥
ऐक्षिष्महि मुहुः सुप्तां यां मृता ऽऽशङ्कया वयम् ।अ-काले दुर्मरमहो यज्जीवामस्तया विना ॥
अ-क्षेमः परिहासो ऽयं। परीक्षां मा कृथा मम । मत्तो मा ऽन्तिर्धथाः सीते ! मा रंस्था जीवितेन नः ॥
अहं न्यवधिषं भीमं राक्षसं क्रूर विक्रमम् । मा घुक्षः पत्युरात्मानं मा न श्लिक्षः प्रियं प्रिये ॥
मा स्म द्राक्षीर्मृषा दोषं भक्तं मा मातिचिक्लिशः । शैलं न्यशिश्रियद्वामा नदीं नु प्रत्यदुद्रुवत् ॥
ऐ वाचं देहि। धैर्यं नस्तव हेतोरसुस्रुवत्। । त्वं नो मतिमिवा ऽघासीर्नष्टा प्राणानिवाऽदधः ॥
रुदतो ऽशिश्वयच्चक्षु रास्यं हेतोस्तवा ऽश्वयीत् । म्रिये ऽहं मां निरास्थश्चेन्मा न वोचश्चिकीर्षितम् ॥
लक्ष्मणा ऽऽचक्ष्व यद्याख्यत्सा किञ्चित्कोप-कारणम् । दोषे प्रतिसमाधान मज्ञाते क्रियतां कथम् ॥
इह सा व्यलिपद्गन्धैः स्नान्तीहाऽभ्यषिचज्जलैः ।इहा ऽहं द्रष्टुमाह्वं तां" स्मरन्नेवं मुमोह सः ॥
तस्या ऽलिपत शोकाऽग्निः स्वान्तं काष्ठमिव ज्वलन् ।अलिप्तेवा ऽनिलः शीतो वने तं न त्वजिह्लदत् ॥
स्नानभ्यषिचता ऽम्भो ऽसौ रुदन्दयितया विना । तथा ऽभ्यषिक्त वारीणि पितृभ्यः शोक-मूर्च्छितः ॥
तथा ऽऽ र्तो ऽपि क्रियां धर्म्यां स काले ना ऽमुचत्क्वचित् । महतां हि क्रिया नित्या छिद्रे नैवा ऽवसीदति ॥
आह्वास्त स मुहुः शूरान्मुहुराह्वत राक्षसान् । "एत सीताद्रुहः संख्ये प्रत्यर्तयत राघवम् ॥
स्व-पोषमपुषद्युष्मान्या पक्षि-मृग-शावकाः ! ।अद्युतच्चेन्दुना सार्धं तां प्रब्रूत गता यतः।" ॥
गिरिमन्वसृपद्रामो लिप्सुर्जनक-संभवाम् । तस्मिन्नायोधनं वृत्तं लक्ष्मणायाऽशिषन्महत् ॥
"सीतां जिघांसू सौमित्रे ! राक्षसावारतां ध्रुवम् ।इदं शोणितमभ्यग्रं सप्रहारे ऽच्युतत्तयोः ॥
इदं कवचमच्योतीत्साऽश्वो ऽयं चूर्णीतो रथः ।एह्यमुं गिरिमन्वेष्टुमवगाहावहे द्रुतम् ॥
मन्युर्मन्ये ममा ऽस्तम्भीद्विषादो ऽस्तभदुद्यतिम् ।अजारीदिव च प्रज्ञा बलं शोकात्तथाजरत् ॥
गृध्रस्येहाश्वतां पक्षौ कृतौ वीक्षस्व लक्ष्मण ! । जिघत्सोर्नूनमापादि ध्वंसो ऽयं तां निशा-चरात्।" ॥
क्रुद्धो ऽदीपि रघु-व्याघ्रो रक्त-नेत्रो ऽजनि क्षणात् ।उबोधि दुःस्थं त्रैलोक्यं दीप्तैरापूरि भानु-वत् ॥
अताय्यस्योत्तमं सत्वमप्यायि कृत-कृत्य-वत् ।उपाचायिष्ट सामर्थ्यं तस्य संरम्भिणो महत् ॥
अदोहीव विषादो ऽस्य समरुद्धेव विक्रमः । समभावि च कोपेन न्यश्वसीच्चाऽऽयतं मुहुः ॥
अथा ऽऽलम्ब्य धनू रामो जगर्ज गज-विक्रमः । "रुणध्मि सवितुर्मार्गं भिनद्मि कुल-पर्वतान् ॥
रिणच्मि जलधेस्तोयं विविनच्मि दिवः सुरान् । क्षुणद्मि सर्पान्पाताले छिनद्मि क्षणदा-चरान् ॥
यमं युनज्मि कालेन समिन्धानो ऽस्त्र-कौशलम् । शुष्क-पेषं पिनष्म्युर्वीमखिन्दानः स्व-तेजसा ॥
भूतिं तृणद्मि यक्षाणां हिनस्मीन्द्रस्य विक्रमम् । भनज्मि सर्व-मर्यादास्तनच्मि व्योम विस्तृतम् ॥
न तृणेह्मीति लोको ऽयं मां विन्ते निष्-पराक्रम्" ।एवं वदन्दाशरथिरपृणग्धनुशा शरं ॥
न्यवर्तयत्सुमित्रा-भूस्तं चिकीर्षुं जगत्-क्षयम् ।ऐक्षेतामाश्रमादाराद्गिरिकल्पं पतत्रिणम् ॥
तं सीता-घातिनं मत्वा हन्तुं रामो ऽभ्यधावत । "मा वधिष्ठा जटायुं मां सीतां रामा ऽहमैक्षिषि।" ॥
उपास्थितैवमुक्ते तं सखायं राघवः पितुः । पप्रच्छ जानकी-वार्तां संग्रामं च पतत्रिणम् ॥
व्रण-वेदनया ग्लायन्ममार गिरि-कन्दरे । तस्याग्न्यम्बु-क्रियां कृत्वा प्रतस्थाते पुनर्वनम् ॥
सत्वानजस्रं घोरेण बलाऽपकर्षमश्नता । क्षुध्यता जगृहाते तौ रक्षसा दीर्घ-बाहुना ॥
भुजौ चकृततुस्तस्य निस्त्रिंशाभ्यां रघूत्त्मौ । स छिन्न-बाहुरपतद्विह्वलो ह्वलयन्भुवम् ॥
प्रष्टव्यं पृच्छतस्तस्य कथनीयमवीवचत् ।आत्मानं वन-वासं च जेयं चा ऽरिं रघूत्तमः ॥
"लभ्या कथं नु वैदेही शक्यो द्रष्टुं कथं रिपुः । सह्यः कथं वियोगश्च गद्यमेतत्त्वया मम।" ॥
"अहं राम ! श्रियः पुत्रो मद्य-पीत इव भ्रमन् । पाप-चर्यो मुनेः शापाज्जात"इत्यवदत्स तम् ॥
"प्रयातस्तव यम्यत्वं शस्त्र-पूतो ब्रवीमि ते । रावणेन हृता सीता लङ्कां नीता सुरारिणा ॥
ऋष्यमूके ऽनवद्यो ऽस्ति पण्य-भ्रातृ-वधः कपिः । सुग्रीवो नाम वर्यो ऽसौ भवता चारु-विक्रमः ॥
तेन वह्येन हन्तासि त्वमर्यं पुरुषाऽशिनाम् । राक्षसं क्रूर-कर्माणं शक्राऽरिं दूर-वासिनम् ॥
आस्ते स्मरन्स कान्ताया हृताया वालिना कपिः । वृषो यथोपसर्याया गोष्ठे गोर्दण्ड-ताडितः ॥
तेन सङ्गतमार्येण रामा ऽजर्यं कुरु द्रुतम्। । लङ्कां प्राप्य ततः पापं दश-ग्रीवं हनिष्यसि ॥
अनृतोद्यं न तत्रास्ति सत्य-वद्यं ब्रवीम्यहम्। । मित्र-भूयं गतस्तस्य रिपु-हत्यां करिष्यसि ॥
आदृत्यस्तेन वृत्येन स्तुत्यो जुष्येण संगतः ।इत्यः शिष्येण गुरुवद्गृध्यमर्थमवाप्स्यसि ॥
नाऽखेयः सागरो ऽप्यन्यस्तस्य सद्-भृत्य-शालिनः । मन्युस्तस्य त्वया मार्ग्यो मृज्यः शोकश्च तेन ते।" ॥
स राजसूययाजीव तेजसा सूर्य-सन्निभः ।अ-मृषोद्यं वदन्रुच्यो जगाहे द्यां निशा-चरः ॥
अ-कृष्ट-पच्याः पश्यन्तौ ततो दाशरथी लताः । रत्नाऽन्न-पान-कुप्यानामाटतुर्नष्टसंस्मृती ॥
समुत्तरन्ताव-व्यथ्यौ नदान्भिद्योद्ध्य-सन्निभान् । सिध्य-तारामिव ख्यातां शबरीमापतुर्वने ॥
वसानां वल्कले शूद्धे विपूयैः कृत-मेखलाम् । क्षामामञ्जन-पिण्डाऽऽभा दण्दिनीमजिना ऽऽस्तराम् ॥
प्रगृह्य-पद-वत्साध्वीं स्पष्ट-रूपाम-विक्रियाम् ।अ-गृह्यां वीत-काम-त्वाद्देव-गृह्याम-निन्दिताम् ॥
धर्म-कृत्य-रतां नित्यम-कृष्य-फल-भोजनाम् । दृष्ट्वा ताममुचद्रामो युग्याऽऽयात इव श्रमम् ॥
स तामूचे ऽथ-"कच्चित्त्वममावास्या-समन्वये । पित्णां कुरुषे कार्यम-पाक्यैः स्वादुभिः फलैः ॥
अवश्य-पाव्यं पवसे कच्चित्त्वं देव-भाग्घ्विः ।आसाव्यमध्वरे सोमं द्विजैः कच्चिन्नमस्यसि ॥
आचाम्यं संध्ययोः कच्चित्सत्यक्ते न प्रहीयते । कच्चिदग्निमिवा ऽऽनाय्यं काले संमन्यसे ऽतिथिम् ॥
न प्रणाय्यो जनः कच्चिन्निकाय्यं ते ऽधितिष्ठति । देव-कार्य-विघाताय धर्मद्रोही महोदये ! ॥
कुण्ड-पाय्य-वतां कच्चिदग्निचित्या-वतां तथा । कथाभी रमसे नित्यमुपचाय्य-वतां शुभे ! ॥
वर्धते ते तपो भीरु ! व्यजेष्ठा विघ्न-नायकान् ।अजैषीः कामसंमोहौ संप्राप्था विनयेन वा ॥
ना ऽऽयस्यसि तपस्यन्ती गुरून्सम्यगतूतुषः । यमान्नोदविजिष्ठास्त्वं निजाय तपसे ऽतुषः" ॥
अथाऽर्ध्यं मधुपर्काऽऽद्यमुपनीया ऽऽदरादसौ ।अर्चयित्वा फलैरर्च्यौ सर्वत्रा ऽऽख्यदनामयम् ॥
"सख्यस्य तव सुग्रीवः कारकः कपि-नन्दनः । द्रुतं द्रष्टासि मैथिल्पाः" सैवमुक्त्वा तिरो ऽभवत् ॥
नन्दनानि मुनीन्द्राणां रमणानि वनौकसाम् । वनानि भेजतुर्वीरौ ततः पाम्पानि राघवौ ॥
"भृङ्गाऽऽली-कोकिल-क्रुङ्भिर्वाशनैः पश्य लक्ष्मण ! । रोचनैर्भूषितां पम्पा- मस्माकं हृदयाविधम् ॥
परिभावीणि ताराणां पश्य मन्थीनि चेतसाम् ।उद्भासीनि जले-जानि दुन्वन्त्य्-अदयितं जनम् ॥
सर्वत्र दयिताऽधीनं सु-व्यक्तं रामणीयकम् । येन जातं प्रियाऽपाये कद्-वदं हंस-कोकिलम् ॥
पक्षिभिर्वितृदैर्यूना शाखिभिः कुसुमोत्किरैः ।अ-ज्ञो यो यस्य वा ना ऽस्ति प्रियः प्रग्लो भवेन्न सः ॥
ध्वनीनामुद्धमैरेभिर्मधूनामुद्धयैर्भृशम् ।आजिघ्रैः पुष्प-गन्धानां पतगैर्ग्लपिता वयम् ॥
धारयैः कुसुमोर्मीणां पारयैर्बाधितुं जनान् । शाखिभिर्हा हता भूयो हृदयानामुदेजयैः ॥
ददैर्दुःखस्य मादृग्भ्यो धायैरामोदमुत्तमम् । लिम्पैरिव तनोर्वातैश्चेतयः स्याज्ज्वलो न कः ॥
अवश्याय-कणाऽऽस्रावाश्चारु-मुक्ता-फल-त्विषः । कुर्वन्ति चित्त-संस्रावं चलत्-पर्णाऽग्र-संभृताः ॥
अवसायो भविष्यामि दुःखस्या ऽस्य कदा न्वहम् । न जीवस्या ऽवहारो मां करोति सुखिनं यमः ॥
दह्ये ऽहं मधुनो लेहैर्दावैरुग्रैर्यथा गिरिः । नायः कोऽत्र स येन स्यां बता ऽहं विगत-ज्वरः ॥
समाविष्टं ग्रहेणेव ग्राहेणेवा ऽऽत्तमर्णवे । दृष्ट्वा गृहान्स्मरस्येव वनाऽन्तान्मम मानसम् ॥
वाताऽऽहति-चलच्-छाखा नर्तका इव शाखिनः । दुःसहा ही परिक्षिप्ताः क्वणद्भिरलि-गाथकैः ॥
एक-हायन-सारङ्ग-गती रघु-कुलोत्तमौ । लवकौ शत्रु-शक्तीनामृष्यमूकमगच्छताम् ॥
तौ वालि-प्रणिधी मत्वा सुग्रीवो ऽचिन्तयत्कपिः । "बन्धुना विगृहीतोऽहं भूयासं जीवकः कथम्।" ॥
स शत्रु-लावौ मन्वानो राघवौ मलयं गिरिम् । जगाम स-परीवारो व्योम-मायमिवोत्थितम् ॥
शर्म-दं मारुतिं दूतं विषम-स्थः कपि-द्विपम् । शोकाऽपनुदम-व्यग्रं प्रायुङ्क्त कपि-कुञ्जरः ॥
विश्वास-प्रद-वेषो ऽसौ पथि-प्रज्ञः समाहितः । चित्त-संख्यो जिगीषूणामुत्पपात नभस्-तलम् ॥
सुरा-पैरिव घूर्णद्भिः शाखिभिः पवनाऽऽहतैः । ऋष्यमूकमगाद्भृङ्गैः प्रगीतं साम-गैरिव ॥
तं मनो-हरमागत्य गिरिं वर्म-हरौ कपिः । वीरौ सुखा ऽऽहरो ऽवोचद्भिक्षुर्भिक्षार्ह-विग्रहः ॥
"बलिनावमूमद्रीन्द्रं युवां स्तम्बे-रमाविव ।आचक्षाथां मिथः कस्माच्छङ्करेणा ऽपि दुर्गमम् ॥
व्याप्तं गुहा-शयैः क्रूरैः क्रव्याद्भिः स-निशाचरैः । तुङ्ग-शैल-तरु-छन्नं मानुषाणाम-गोचरम् ॥
सत्वमेजय-सिंहाऽऽढ्यान्स्तनं-धाय-सम-त्विषौ । कथं नाडिंधमान्मार्गानागतौ विषमोपलान् ॥
अत्तीर्णौ वा कथं भीमाः सरितः कूलमुद्वहाः ।आसादितौ कथं ब्रूतं न गजैः कूलमुद्रुजैः ॥
रामो ऽवोचद्धनूमन्तम् "आवामभ्रं-लिहं गिरिम् ।ऐव विद्वन्! पितुः कामात्पान्तावल्पं-पचान्मुनीन् ॥
अ-मितं-पचमीशानं सर्व-भोगीणमुत्तमम् ।आवयोः पितरं विद्धि ख्यातं दशर्थं भुवि ॥
छलेन दयिता ऽरण्याद्रक्षसा ऽरुं-तुदेन नः ।अ-सूर्यं-पश्यया मूर्त्या हृता तां मृगयावहे।" ॥
प्रत्यूचे मारुति रामम् "अस्ति वालीति वानरः" । शमयेदपि संग्रामे यो ललाटं-तपं रविम् ॥
उग्रं-पश्येन सुग्रीवस्तेन भ्राता निराकृतः । तस्य मित्रीयतो दूतः संप्राप्तो ऽस्मि वशं-वदः ॥
प्रियं-वदो ऽपि नैवा ऽहं ब्रुवे मिथ्या परं-तप ! । सख्या तेन दश-ग्रीवं निहन्तासि द्विषं-तपम् ॥
वाचं-यमोऽहमनृते सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ।एहि सर्वं-सहं मित्रं सुग्रीवं कुरु वानरम्।" ॥
सर्वं-कष-यशः-शाखं राम-कल्प-तरुं कपिः ।आदायाऽ भ्रं-कषं प्रायान्मलयं फल-शालिनम् ॥
मेघं-करमिवायान्तमृतुं रामं क्लमान्विताः । दृष्ट्वा मेने नसुग्रीवो वालि-भानुं भयं-करम् ॥
उपाग्न्यकुरुतां सख्यमन्योन्यस्य प्रियं-करौ । क्षेमं-कराणि कार्याणि पर्यालोचयतां ततः ॥
आशितं-भवमुत्क्रुष्टं वल्गितं शयितं स्थितम् । बह्वमन्यत काकुत्स्थः कपीनां स्वेच्छया कृतम् ॥
ततो बलिं-दम-प्रख्यं कपि-विश्वं-भराऽधिपम् । सुग्रीवः प्राब्रवीद्रामं वालिनो युधि विक्रमम् ॥
"वसुं-धरायां कृत्स्नायां नाऽस्ति वालि-समो बली । हृदयं-गममेतत्त्वां ब्रवीमि न पराभवम् ॥
दूर-गैरन्त-गैर्बाणैर्भवानत्यन्त-गः श्रियः ।अपि संक्रन्दनस्य स्यात्क्रुद्धः किमुत वालिनः ॥
वरेण तु मुनेर्वाली संजातो दस्युहो रणे ।अ-वार्य-प्रसरः प्रातरुद्यन्निव तमोऽपहः ॥
अतिप्रियत्वान्न हि मे कातरं प्रतिपद्यते । चेतो वालि-वधं राम ! क्लेशापहमुपस्थितम् ॥
शीर्ष-घातिनमायातमरीणां त्वां विलोकयन् । पतिघ्नी-लक्ष्मणोपतां मन्येऽहं वालिनः श्रियम् ॥
शत्रुघ्नान्युधि हस्तिघ्नो गिरीन्क्षिप्यन्न-कृत्रिमान् । शिल्पिभिः पाणिघैः क्रुद्धस्त्वया जय्यो ऽभ्युपाय-वान् ॥
आढ्यं-करण-विक्रान्तो महिषस्य सुरद्विषः । प्रियं-करणमिन्द्रस्य दुष्करं कृतवान्वधम् ॥
प्रियंभावुकतां यातस्तं क्षिपन्योजनं मृतम् । स्वर्गे प्रियं-भविष्णुश्च क्र्त्स्नं शक्तो ऽप्यबाधयन्" ॥
जिज्ञासोः शक्तिमस्त्राणां रामो न्यून-धियः कपेः ।अभीनत्प्रतिपत्त्यर्थं सप्त व्योम स्पृशस्तरून् ॥
ततो वालि-पशौ वध्ये राम-र्त्विग्-जित-साध्वसः ।अभ्यभून्निलयं भ्रातुः सुग्रीवो निनदन्दधृक् ॥
गुहाया निरगाद्वाली सिंहो मृगमिव द्युवन् । भ्रातरं युङ्भियः संख्ये घोषेणा ऽऽपूरयन्दिशः ॥
व्यायच्छमानयोर्मूढो भेदे सदृशयोस्तयोः । बाणमुद्यतमायंसीदिक्ष्वाकु-कुल-नन्दनः ॥
ऋष्यमूकमगात्क्लन्तः कपिर्मृग-सदृग्द्रुतम् । किष्किन्धाऽद्रिसदाऽऽत्यर्थं निष्पिष्टः कोष्णमुच्छ्वसन् ॥
कृत्वा वालि-द्रुहं रामो मालया स-विशेषणम्। ।अङ्गद-स्वं पुनर्हन्तुं कपिघ्नाऽऽह्वाययद्रणे ॥
तयोर्वानर-सेनान्योः संप्रहारे तनुच्छिदम् । वालिनो दूर-भाग्रामो बाणं प्राणाऽदमत्यजत् ॥
वालिनं पतितं दृष्ट्वा वानरा रिपु-घातिनम् । बान्धवाऽऽक्रोशिनो भेजुरनाथाः ककुभो दश ॥
धिग्दाशरथिमित्यूचुर्मुनयो वन-वर्तिनः। ।उपेयुर्मधु-पायिन्यः क्रोशन्त्यस्तं कपि-स्त्रियः ॥
राममुच्चैरुपालब्ध शूर-मानी कपि-प्रभुः । व्रण-वेदनया ग्लायन्साधुं-मन्यम-साधुवत् ॥
"मृषा ऽसि त्वं हविर्-याजी राघव ! छद्म-तापसः ।अन्य-व्यासक्त-घातित्वाद्ब्रह्मघ्नां पाप-संमितः ॥
पाप-कृत्सुकृतां मध्ये राज्ञः पुण्यकृतः सुतः । मामपापं दुराचार ! किं निहत्या ऽभिधास्यसि ॥
अग्नि-चित्सोम-सुद्राजा रथ-चक्र-चिदाऽऽदिषु ।अनलेष्विष्टवान्कस्मान्न त्वया ऽपेक्षितः पिता ॥
मांस-विक्रयिणः कर्म व्याधस्या ऽपि विगर्हितम् । मां घ्नता भवता ऽकारि निःषङ्कं पाप-दृष्वना ॥
बुद्धिपूर्वं ध्रुवन्न त्वा राज-कृत्वा पिता खलम् । सहयुध्वानमन्येन यो ऽहिनो मामनागसम् ॥
