data.et: Blazing meteors were sighted and jackals howled ominously ; the earth quaked and Rama suspected the advent of evil.

data.v: रावणः शुश्रुवान्शत्रून्राक्षसानभ्युपेयुषः । स्वयं युयुत्सयांचक्रे प्राकाराऽग्रे निषेदिवान् ॥
data.et: Seated on the front of the rampart, Ravana who had heard that the enemies were desirous of attacking the demons, personally inspired them for fighting.

data.v: निरासू राक्षसा बाणान्प्रजहुः शूल-पट्टिशान् ।असींश्च वाहयांचक्रुः पाशैश्चाऽऽचकृषुस्ततैः ॥
data.et: The demons discharged arrows, hurled spears and axes, used swords and pulled broad nooses.

data.v: भल्लैश्च बिभिदुस्तीक्ष्णैर्विविधुस्तोमरैस्तथा। । गदाभिश्चूर्णयांचक्रुः शितैश्चक्रैश्च चिच्छिदुः ॥
data.et: And, they pierced with sharp crescent-shaped lances and similarly injured with javelins, crushed with maces and tore off with cutting discs.

data.v: वानरा मुष्टिभिर्जघ्नुर्ददंशुर्दशनैस्तथा । निरासुश्च गिरींस्तुङ्गान्द्रुमान्विचकरुस्तथा ॥
data.et: The monkeys beat with fists and also bit with teeth, hurled lofty boulders and similarly dispersed trees ;

data.v: लाङ्गूलैर्लोठयांचक्रुस्तलैर्निन्युश्च संक्षयम् । नखैश्चकृततुः क्रुद्धाः पिपिषुश्च क्षितौ बलात् ॥
data.et: Enraged, they killed with tails, led to destruction with palms, tore up with nails and pulverised on the earth with force.

data.v: संबभूवुः कबन्धानि प्रोहुः शोणित-तोय-गाः । तेरुर्भटाऽऽस्य-पद्मानि ध्वजैः फेणैरिवाऽऽबभे ॥
data.et: There arose headless trunks; rivers of blood flowed ; the lotus-like faces of warriors floated and the flags appeared like foam.

data.v: रक्त-पङ्के गजाः सेदुर्न प्रचक्रमिरे रथाः । निममज्जुस्तुरङ्गाश्च गन्तुं नोत्सेहिरे भटाः ॥
data.et: Elephants got stuck up in mud (created by) blood, chariots could not proceed, horses sank deep and warriors dared not go ahead.

data.v: कोट्या कोट्या पुर-द्वारमेकैकं रुरुघे द्विषाम् । षट्-त्रिंशद्धरि-कोट्यश्च निवव्रुर्वानराऽऽधिपम् ॥
data.et: Each and every gate of the city was blocked by a crore each of the enemies ; and thirty-six crores encircled the lord of the monkeys.

data.v: तस्तनुर्जह्वलुर्मम्लुर्जग्लुर्लुलुठिरे क्षताः । मुमूर्च्छुर्ववमू रक्तं ततृषुश्चोभये भटाः ॥
data.et: Injured warriors of both sides groaned, tossed about, felt weary, desponded, rolled (on the ground), fainted, vomitted blood and got thirsty.

data.v: सम्पातिना प्रजङ्घस्तु युयुधे ऽसौ द्रुमाहतः । चकम्पे तीव चुक्रोश जीवनाशं ननाश च ॥
data.et: Prajaigha, however, fought Sampati; hit with a tree, he was shaken, cried excessively and so perished as to lose his life.

data.v: उच्चख्नाते नलेना ऽऽजौ स्फुरत्-प्रतपनाऽक्षिणी । जम्बुमाली जहौ प्राणान्ग्राव्णा मारुतिना हतः ॥
data.et: By Nala were dug out both the sparkling eyes of Pratapana ; hit with a boulder by Maruti, Jambumali laid down his (life-)breaths.

data.v: मित्रिघ्नस्य प्रचुक्षोद गदया ऽङ्गं विभीषणः। । सुग्रीवः प्रघसं नेभे बहून्रामस्ततर्द च ॥
data.et: Of Mitraghna, Vibhisana pounded the body with a mace; Sugriva killed Praghasa and Rama killed very many.

data.v: वज्रमुष्टेर्विशिश्लेष मैन्देना ऽभिहतं शिरः । नीलश्चकर्त चक्रेण निकुम्भस्य शिरः स्फुरत् ॥
data.et: Vajramusti's head, battered by Mainda, got severed. Nila, sawed off with a dise the throbbing head of Nikumbha.

data.v: विरूपाक्षो जहे प्राणैस्तृढः सौमित्रि-पत्रिभिः । प्रमोचयांचकाराऽसून्द्विविदस्त्वशनि-प्रभम् ॥
data.et: Pierced by Laksmana's arrows, Virupaksa was aban- doned by (his) life-breaths. Dvivida caused life-breaths to be given up by Asaniprabha.

data.v: गदा शत्रु-जिता जिघ्ये तां प्रतीयेष वालि-जः । रथं ममन्थ स-हयं शाखिना ऽस्य ततो ऽङ्गदः ॥
data.et: A mace was hurled by Indrajit ; the son of vali caught it. Thereafter Aigada, with a tree, battered his (Indrajits) chariot along with the horses.

data.v: तत्कर्म वालि-पुत्रस्य दृष्ट्वा विश्वं विसिष्मिये । संत्रेसू राक्षसाः सर्वे बहु मेने च राघवः ॥
data.et: Having seen that deed of the son of Vali, the universe was wonderstruck, all the demons took fright and Raghava (Rama) held it in great esteem.

data.v: सुग्रीवो मुमुदे देवाः साध्वित्यूचुः सविस्मयाः । विभीषणो ऽभितुष्टाव प्रशशंसुः प्लवङ्गमाः ॥
data.et: Sugriva rejoiced, the gods, full of surprise, exclaimed, "Well done !' Vibhisana praised (him), and the monkeys applauded aloud.

data.v: ही चित्रं लक्ष्मणेनोदे रावणिश्च तिरोदधे । विचकार ततो रामः शरान्संतत्रसुर्द्विषः ॥
data.et: ‘‘Oh, wonder !' uttered by Laksmanpa and, Indrajit the son of Ravana, disappeared. Then Rama dispersed arrows ; the enemies took fright (felt distressed).

data.v: विभिन्ना जुघुरुर्घोरं जक्षुः क्रव्याऽशिनो हतान् । चुष्च्योत व्रणिनां रक्तं छिन्नाश्चेलुः क्षणं भुजाः ॥
data.et: Injured, they screamed horridly ; carnivorous beasts devoured the slain ; the blood of the wounded trickled (down); severed arms throbbed for a moment.

data.v: कृत्तैरपि दृढ-क्रोधो वीर-वक्त्रैर्न तत्यजे । पलायांचक्रिरे शेषा जिह्रियुः शूर-मानिनः ॥
data.et: The deep-rooted anger was not abandoned by the warriors' faces, though severed; the rest ran away; those who regarded themselves brave felt ashamed.

data.v: राघवो न दयांचक्रे दधुर्धैर्यं न केचन । मम्रे पतङ्गवद्वीरैर्हाहेति च विचुक्रुशे ॥
data.et: Raghava took no pity; none took courage ; Warriors died like moths and screamed , Ah, Alas !'

data.v: तिरोबभूवे सूर्येण प्रापे च निशया ऽऽस्पदम् । जग्रसे काल-रात्रीव वानरान्राक्षसाम्श्च सा ॥
data.et: The sun disappeared and (immediately) a foot-hold was acquired by the night ; and, like a night of death, she swallowed the monkeys and the demons.

data.v: चुकोपेन्द्रजिदत्युग्रं सर्पाऽस्त्रं चा ऽऽजुहाव सः ।आजुहुवे तिरोभूतः परानीकं जहास च ॥
data.et: Indrajit got angry and summoned the extremely terrific serpent missile; he who had become invisible, challenged the enemy's army and jeered.

data.v: बबाधे च बलं कृत्स्नं निजग्राह च सायकैः ।उत्ससर्ज शरांस्तेऽस्य सर्प-साच्च प्रपेदिरे ॥
data.et: He overpowered the whole amry and immediately bound it down with arrows; he discharged arrows and they turned into serpents against (Rama's army).

data.v: आचिचाय स तैः सेनामाचिकाय च राघवौ । बभाण च "न मे मायां जिगायेन्द्रोऽपि किं नृभिः" ॥
data.et: He enveloped the army and covered the two Raghu princes with them, and exclaimed. Even Indra could not subdue my jugglery. What with men ?’’

data.v: आचिक्याते च भूयो ऽपि राघवौ तेन पन्नगैः । तौ मुमुहतुरुद्विग्नौ वसुधायां च पेततुः ॥
data.et: Once again were the Raghu princes covered by him with serpents. Distressed, the two fainted and fell down on the ground.

data.v: ततो रामेति चक्रन्दुस्त्रेसुः परिदिदेविरे । निशश्वसुश्च सेनान्यः प्रोचुर्धिगिति चाऽऽत्मनः ॥
data.et: Then the commanders of the army yelled, “Alas, Oh Rama, "took fright, lamented, sighed and exclaimed "Fie upon ourselves !'

data.v: मन्युं शेकुर्न ते रोद्धुं ना ऽस्रं संरुरुधुः पतत् । विविदुर्नेन्द्रजिन्-मार्गं परीयुश्च प्लवङ्गमाः ॥
data.et: They could not restrain (their) grief, did not check the falling tears, could not know the way to Indrajit and went around.

data.v: दधावा ऽद्भिस्ततश्चक्षुः सुग्रीवस्य विभीषणः । विदांचकार धौताऽक्षः स रिपुं खे ननर्द च ॥
data.et: Then Vibhisana washed the eye of Sugriva with water ; he whose eye was washed apprehended the enemy in the sky and shouted .

data.v: उज्जुगूरे ततः शैलं हन्तुमिन्द्रजितं कपिः । विहाय रावणिस्तस्मादानंहे चा ऽन्तिकं पितुः ॥
data.et: Now the monkey (Sugriva) hurled a rock for kill ing Indrajit. (But) the son of Ravana left (the battle-field) and thence went to his father.

data.v: आचचक्षे च वृत्तान्तं प्रजहर्ष च रावनः । गाढं चोपजुगूहैनं शिरस्युपशिशिङ्घ च ॥
data.et: He reported the happening and immediately Ravana was highly delighted , embraced him tightly and smelt his head.

data.v: ध्वजानुद्दुधुवुस्तुङ्गान्मांसं चेमुर्जगुः पपुः । कामयांचक्रिरे कान्तास्ततस्तुष्टा निशाचराः ॥
data.et: Thereafter the delighted demons hoisted lofty flags, ate meat, sangdrank (and) longed for their sweethearts.

data.v: दर्शयांचक्रिरे रामं सीतां राज्ञश्च शासनात् । तस्या मिमीलतुर्नेत्रे लुलुठे पुष्पकोदरे ॥
data.et: And (they) showed Rama to Sita, at the command of the King. Both her eyes got shut and she rolled down in the interior of the Puspaka.

data.v: प्राणा दध्वंसिरे गात्रं तस्तम्भे च प्रिये हते ।उच्छश्वास चिराद्दीना रुरोदा ऽसौ ररास च ॥
data.et: The dear Rama being slain, her life-breaths perished and body stiffened. That miserable (Sita) heaved, wept and screamed for long.

data.v: "लौह-बन्धैर्बबन्धे नु वज्रेण किं विनिर्ममे । मनो मे न विना रामाद्यत्पुस्फोट सहस्र-धा ॥
data.et: "Is my heart caged in iron fetters or is it fashioned out of adamant since it did not burst into a thousand pieces in the absence of Rama ?

data.v: उत्तेरिथ समुद्रं त्वं मदर्थे ऽरीन्जिहिंसिथ । ममर्थ चाऽतिघोरां मां धिग्जीवित-लघूकृताम् ॥
data.et: For my sake you crossed the ocean, killed the enemies and perished ! Fie upon me, excessively wicked, rendered lowly (despicable) by life.

data.v: न जिजीवा ऽसुखी तातः प्राणता रहितस्त्वया । मृतेऽपि त्वयि जीवन्त्या किं मया ऽणकभार्यया।" ॥
data.et: ‘Deprived of you (who were) alive, (thy) unhappy father did not survive ; What (use) is (your) accursed wife living, even while you are dead.'

data.v: सा जुगुप्सान्प्रचक्रे ऽसून्जगर्हे लक्षणानि च । देहभाञ्जि ततः केशान्लुलुञ्च लुलुठे मुहुः ॥
data.et: She got nauseated with her life and censured the (auspicious) signs existing on her person ; then (she) tore off her hair and rolled down again and again.

data.v: जग्लौ दध्यौ वितस्तान क्षणं प्राण न विव्यथे । दैवं निनिन्द चक्रन्द देहे चा ऽतीव मन्युना ॥
data.et: She wearied (herself), worried, screamed, stopped breathing for a moment, grieved, blamed Fate, wailed and burnt with excessive grief.

data.v: आश्वासयांचकारा ऽथ त्रिजटा तां निनाय च। । ततः प्रजागरांचक्रुर्वानराः स-विभीषणाः ॥
data.et: Then Trijata consoled (her) and took her away. Thereafter the monkeys along with Vibhisapa kept awake.

data.v: चिचेत रागस्तत्कृच्छ्रमोषांचक्रे शुचा ऽथ सः । मन्युश्चा ऽस्य समापिप्ये विरुराव च लक्ष्मणम् ॥
data.et: Rama felt that agony ; thereupon he burnt with grief ; and his anger waxed and he called (out for) Laksmana.

data.v: समीहे मर्तुमानर्चे तेन वाचा ऽखिलं बलम् ।आपपृच्छे च सुग्रीवं स्वं देशं विससर्ज च ॥
data.et: He wished to die ; the whole army was honoured by him with words; and he took leave of Sugriva and dismissed him to his land.

data.v: आदिदेश स किष्किन्धां राघवौ नेतुमङ्गदम् । प्रतिजज्ञे स्वयं चैव सुग्रीवो रक्षसा वधम् ॥
data.et: He (Sugriva) ordered Aigada to carry the two Raghu princes to Kiskindha ; Sugriva also vowed to kill the demons by himself.

data.v: "नागाऽस्त्रमिदमेतस्य विपक्षस्तार्क्ष्य-संस्मृतिः" । विभीषणादिति श्रुत्वा तं निदध्यौ रघूत्तमः ॥
data.et: Having heard from Vibhisapa (that) this is serpent missile and its counter remedy is the remembrance of Garuda ,’’ the excellent Raghu Prince meditated upon him .

data.v: ततो विजघटे शैलैरुद्वेलं पुप्लुवे ऽम्बुधिः । वृक्षेभ्यश्चुच्युते पुष्पैर्विरेजुर्भासुरा दिशः ॥
data.et: Then the mountains burst; the ocean flooded across the shore ; flowers fell down from the trees ; and the radiant quarters shone brightly.

data.v: जगाहिरे ऽम्बुधिं नागा ववौ वायुर्मनो-रमः । तेजांसि शंशमांचक्रुः शर-बन्धा विशिश्लिषुः ॥
data.et: The serpents plunged into the ocean; wind pleasurable to the mind blew; lustre got mellowed (and) the bonds of the arrows got loosened.

data.v: भ्रेजिरे ऽक्षत-वद्योधा लेभे संज्ञां च लक्ष्मणः । विभीषणो ऽपि बभ्राजे गरुत्मान्प्राप चा ऽन्तिकम् ॥
data.et: The warriors shone as if uninjured and Laksmana regained consciousness. Vibhisana too glittered and Garuda came near.

data.v: संपस्पर्शा ऽथ काकुत्स्थौ जज्ञाते तौ गत-व्यथौ । तयोरात्मानमाचख्यौ ययौ चा ऽथ यथा-गतम् ॥
data.et: Then he touched the two Kakutstha princes ; they became devoid of agony; (he) announced himself to them and departed just as he had come.

data.v: स्वेनुस्तित्विषुरुद्येमुरच्चख्नुः पर्वतांस्तरून् । वानरा दद्रमुश्चा ऽथ संग्रामं चाऽऽशशाशिरे ॥
data.et: The monkeys shouted, glittered, exerted, dug up

data.v: डुढौकिरे पुनर्लङ्कां बुबुधे तान्दशाननः । जीवतश्च विवेदा ऽरीन्बभ्रंशे ऽसौ धृतेस्ततः ॥
data.et: They again invaded Lanka ; Ravana recognised them and realised that the enemies were alive ; thereupon he swerved from his fortitude.

data.v: सस्रंसे शर-बन्धेन दिव्येनेति बुबुन्द सः । बभाजा ऽथ परं मोहमूहांचक्रे जयं न च ॥
data.et: He heard that the divine bonds of the arrows had slipped off; he then took to extreme delusion and did not expect victory.

data.v: घूम्राक्षो ऽथ प्रतिष्ठासांचक्रे रावण-संमतः । सिंहाऽऽस्यैर्युयुजे तस्य वृकाऽऽस्यैश्च रथः खगैः ॥
data.et: Thereafter, permitted by Ravana, Dhumraksa intended to march out ; his chariot was yoked with beasts fying in the sky which had mouths of lions or foxes.

data.v: त्वक्-त्रैः संविव्ययुर्देहान्वाहनान्यधिशिश्यिरे ।आनर्जुर्नृ-भुजोऽस्त्राणि ववञ्चुश्चाऽऽहव-क्षितिम् ॥
data.et: The cannibals covered (their) bodies with armour, ascended vehicles, picked up missiles and proceeded to the battle-field.

data.v: अध्युवास रथं तेये पुराच्चुक्षाव चा ऽशुभम् । संश्रावयांचकारा ऽऽख्यां धूम्राक्षस्तत्वरे तथा ॥
data.et: Dhumraksa ascended (his) chariot, went out of the city and sneezed inauspiciously; he also announced his name and made haste.

data.v: निलिल्ये मूर्ध्नि गृध्रोऽस्य क्रूरा ध्वाङ्क्षा विवाशिरे । शिशीके शोणितं व्योम चचाल क्ष्मा-तलं तथा ॥
data.et: A Vulture settled down on his head; evil crows crowed; the sky sprinkled blood; also the surface of the earth quaked.

data.v: ततः प्रजघटे युद्धं शस्त्राण्यासुः परस्परम् । वव्रश्चुराजुघूर्णुश्च स्येमुश्चुकूर्दिरे तथा ॥
data.et: Then the battle started; (they) hurled missiles mutually; they pierced, revolved, shouted and sported.

data.v: रुरुजुर्भ्रेजिरे फेणुर्बहुधा हरि-राक्षसाः । वीरा न बिभयांचक्रुर्भीषयांचक्रिरे परान् ॥
data.et: The monkeys and the demons smashed, shone and moved variously; the warriors did not fear ; (they) frightened the enemies.

data.v: रत्तं प्रचुश्चुतुः क्षण्णाः शिश्वियुर्बाण-विक्षताः ।अस्यतां शुशुवुर्बाणान्भुजाः साऽङ्गुष्ठ-मुष्टयः ॥
data.et: Injured, they oozed out blood (and) got swollen ; the arms of those who hurled arrows disappeared along with the fingers and fists.

data.v: रणे चिक्रीड धूम्राक्षस्तं ततर्जाऽनिलाऽऽत्मजः ।आददे च शिलां साऽश्वं पिपेषा ऽस्य रथं तया ॥
data.et: Dhumraksa sported in the battle; the son of the Wind (Hanuman) condemned him ; and he picked up a rock and with it smashed his chariot, along with the horses.

data.v: पपात राक्षसो भूमौ रराट च भयंकरम् । तुतोद गदया चाऽरिं तं दुध्रावा ऽद्रिणा कपिः ॥
data.et: The demon fell on the ground and yelled horridly ; and (he) smote the enemy with a mace; the monkey rendered him motionless with a boulder,

data.v: अकम्पनस्ततो योद्धुं चकमे रावणाऽज्ञया । स रथेना ऽभिदुद्राव जुघुरे चाऽतिभैरवम् ॥
data.et: Thereafter Akampana wished to fight under the order of Ravana. He proceeded hurriedly and roared very dreadfully.

data.v: पस्पन्दे तस्य वामाऽक्षि सस्यमुश्चाऽशिवाः खगाः । तान्वव्राजा ऽवमत्या ऽसौ बभासे च रणे शरैः ॥
data.et: His left eye throbbed and ill-boding birds twittered. Having disregarded them (these omens), he went ahead and shone with arrows in the battle.

data.v: खमूयुर्वसुधामूवुः सायका रज्जु-वत्तताः । तस्माद्बलैरपत्रेपे पुप्रोथा ऽस्मै न कश्चन ॥
data.et: Spread out like ropes, the arrows covered the sky and veiled the earth. The enemies shied away from him ; none could withstand him.

data.v: स भस्म-साच्चकाराऽरीन्दुदाव च कृतान्त-वत् । चुक्रोध मारुतिस्ताल- मुच्चख्ने च महा-शिखम् ॥
data.et: He reduced the enemies to ashes and tormented them like the God of Death. Maruti got angry and dug out a sala tree having huge branches.

data.v: यमाया ऽकम्पनं तेन निरुवाप महा-पशुम् । बभ्रज्ज निहते तस्मिन्शोको रावणमग्निवत् ॥
data.et: By means of that tree, he offered Akampana (as) a huge (sacrificial) beast to Yama. He having been killed, grief scorched Ravana like fire .

data.v: स बिभ्रेष प्रचुक्षोद दन्तैरोष्ठं चखाद च । प्रगोपायांचकारा ऽऽशु यत्नेन परितः पुरम् ॥
data.et: He stirred, pounded, and bit (his) lip with the teeth. He hastily got the city guarded all around, with effort.

data.v: प्रहस्तमर्थयांचक्रे योद्धुमद्भुत-विक्रमम्। । "किं विचारेण रजेन्द्र ! युद्धाऽर्था वयमित्य्सौ" ॥
data.et: He requested Prahasta, whose valour was wonderful, to fight. "What (is the use of thought ? We are meant for wars," thus he. --

data.v: चक्वाणा ऽशङ्कितो योद्धुमुत्सेहे च महा-रथः । निर्येमिरे ऽस्य योद्धारश्चक्wxल्क़्क़्पे चाऽश्व-कुञ्जरम् ॥
data.et: --declared dauntlessly and the mighty chariot-fighter marched forward to fight . Ravana assigned warriors to him and kept ready horses and elephants.

data.v: युयुजुः स्यन्दनानश्वैरीजुर्देवान्पुरोहिताः ।आनर्चुर्ब्राह्मणान्सम्यगाशिषश्चाऽऽशशंसिरे ॥
data.et: Chariots were yoked with horses ; the priests sacrificed to the gods, and worshipped brahmins (who) blessed (them) well.

data.v: ऊहिरे मूर्ध्नि सिद्धार्था गावश्चा ऽऽलेभिरे भटैः । प्रचुक्ष्णुवुर्महा ऽस्त्राणि जिज्ञासांचक्रिरे हयान् ॥
data.et: White mustard grains were carried on the head and cows were touched by the warriors; they sharpened (their) mighty missiles and desired to test their horses.

data.v: ललुः खड्गान्ममार्जुश्च ममृजुश्च परश्वधान् । "अलंचक्रे समालेभे ववसे बुभुजे पपे ॥
data.et: (They) picked up and polished (their) swords and cleaned (their ) axes. ( By the soldiers their own selves ) were decorated, anointed, clothed, fed and (drinks) were drunk.

data.v: जहसे च क्षणं यानैर्निर्जग्मे योद्धृभिस्ततः । विप्रान्प्रहस्त आनर्च जुहाव च विभावसुम् ॥
data.et: The soldiers laughed for a moment and then made

data.v: संवर्गयांचकारा ऽऽप्तान्चन्दनेन लिलेप च । चचाम मधु मार्द्वीकं त्वक्-त्रं चाऽऽचकचे वरम् ॥
data.et: He honoured his well-wishing kinsmen, smeared ( himself ) with sandal paste, drank grape-wine and tied up (his) excellent coat of mail.

data.v: उष्णीषं मुमुचे चारु रथं च जुजुषे शुभम् ।आललम्बे महाऽस्त्राणि गन्तुं प्रववृते ततः ॥
data.et: He put on a nice turban, took to an auspicious chariot, caught hold of mighty missiles and then started to go.

data.v: आजघ्नुस्तूर्य-जातानि तुष्टुवुश्चा ऽनुजीविनः । रजः प्रववृधे घोरं घोषश्च व्यानशे दिशः ॥
data.et: The dependants beat all sorts of drums and praised (him). Awful dust gathered up and sound pervaded the quarters.

data.v: तं यान्तं दुद्रुवुर्गृध्राः क्रव्यादश्च सिषेविरे ।आववुर्वायवो घोराः खादुल्काश्च प्रचक्षरुः ॥
data.et: Vultures accompanied him and carnivorous animals attended him who was marching ahead; terrific winds blew and meteors shot down from the sky.

data.v: सस्यन्दे शोणितं व्योम रणाऽङ्गानि प्रजज्वलुः । रथाः प्रचस्खलुः साऽश्वा न ररंहाऽ-श्वकुञ्जरम् ॥
data.et: The sky scattered blood ; the war instruments went up in flames; chariots skidded along with the horses and the troops of horses and elephants would not budge.

data.v: प्रतोदा जगलुर्वाममानञ्चुर्यज्ञिया मृगाः । ददाल भूः पुपूरे द्यौः कपीनामपि निःस्वनैः ॥
data.et: Whips slipped down; sacrificial beasts passed by the left; the earth split up; the sky was filled with the shouts of the monkeys too.

data.v: मिमेह रक्तं हस्त्यश्वं राक्षसाश्च नितिष्ठिवुः । ततः शुशुभतुः सेने निर्-दयं च प्रजह्रतुः ॥
data.et: The troops of elephants and horses made water (urinated) and the demons spat out blood. Then both the armies flashed and struck mercilessly.

data.v: दिद्विशुर्दुद्युवुश्चच्छुश्चक्लमुः सुषुपुर्हताः । चखादिरे चखादुश्च विलेपुश्च रणे भटाः ॥
data.et: In the battle, warriors hated, confronted, battered (mutually), fainted and lay down (as if) killed. They were up (again) and they ate and bewailed.

data.v: प्रहस्तस्य पुरो-मात्यान्जिहिंसुर्दधृषुस्तथा । वानराः कर्म सेनानी रक्षसां चक्षमे ने तत् ॥
data.et: In front of Prahasta the monkeys killed and also overpowered the ministers; the commander of the demons did not brook that action.

data.v: ऊर्णुनाव स शस्त्रौघैर्वानराणामनीकिनीम् । शशास च बहून्योधान्जीवितेन विवेच च ॥
data.et: He covered up the monkey army with streams of weapons and struck many warriors and deprived them of life;

data.v: आससञ्ज भयं तेषां दिद्युते च यथा रविः । नाऽऽययास द्विषद्-देहैर्जगाहे च दिशो दश ॥
data.et: -(he) instilled fear into them and shone forth like the sun; (he) was not exhausted and penetrated the ten quarters with the enemies' bodies.

data.v: केचित्संचुकुटुर्भीता लेजिरे ऽन्ये पराजिताः । संग्रामाद्बभ्रशुः केचिद्ययाचुश्चा ऽपरे ऽभयम् ॥
data.et: Frightened, some contracted (or curled up); being defeated, others felt ashamed; some slipped away from the battle; others begged for safety.

data.v: एवं विजिग्ये तां सेनां प्रहस्तो ऽतिददर्प च । शशाम न च संक्रुद्धो निर्जुगोप निशाचरान् ॥
data.et: Thus Prahasta vanquished that army and was excessively delighted ; and (once) enraged, he did not calm down and protected the demons.

data.v: चुक्रुधे तत्र नीलेन तरुश्चोच्चिक्षिपे महान् । प्रहस्तो ऽभिहतस्तेन बाणान्विससृजे बहून् ॥
data.et: Thereupon Nala got enraged and a huge tree was lifted up by him; beaten with it, Prahasta discharged plentiful arrows.

data.v: सेहे कपी रथाऽश्वांश्च रिपोस्ततर्ह शाखिना । धरित्रीं मुसली तेये प्रहस्तश्चिखिदे न च ॥
data.et: The monkey withstood (them) and destroyed the enemy's chariot and horses with the tree ; wielding a mace Prahasta descended to the ground and did not grieve .

data.v: संदुधुक्षे तयोः कोपः पस्फाये शस्त्र-लाघवम् । नुनोद शाखिनं नील आवव्रे मुसली तरुम् ॥
data.et: The wrath of the two fared up; (their) quickness in hurling weapons waxed; Nila hurled a tree ; the mace-bearer (Prahasta) warded off that tree.

data.v: वियत्यानभ्रतुर्भूमौ मण्डलानि विचेरतुः । प्रदुद्रुवतुरन्योन्यं वीरौ शश्रमतुर्न च  ॥
data.et: The two warriors dived into the sky, moved in circles on the earth, assaulted each other and did not tire .

data.v: समीरयांचकारा ऽथ राक्षसस्य कपिः शिलाम् । क्षतस्तया ममारा ऽसावाशिश्राय च भू-तलम् ॥
data.et: Thereafter, the monkey hurled a boulder at the demon; injured by it, he died and took to the ground.

data.v: तुतुषुर्वानराः सर्वे नेशुश्चित्रा निशा-चराः । जेरुराशा दशास्यस्य सैन्यं नीलं नुनाव च ॥
data.et: All the monkeys were pleased ; the demons of various types perished; Ravana's hopes withered and the army applauded Nila.

data.v: यदा न फेलुः क्षणदा-चराणां मनोरथा राम-बलाऽभियोगे । लङ्कां तदा भेजुरुदीर्ण-दैन्या व्याचख्युरुच्चैश्च हतं प्रहस्तम् ॥
data.et: When the desires of the demons in the battle with Rama's army did not fructify, then they took to Lanka and loudly announced (to Ravana) the slain Prahasta.

data.v: राक्षसेन्द्रस्ततो ऽभैषीदैक्षिष्ट परितः पुरम् । प्रातिष्ठिपच्च बोधाऽर्थं कुम्भकर्णस्य राक्षसान् ॥
data.et: Thereafter Ravana dreaded, looked around the city and dispatched demons for awakening Kumbhakarna.

data.v: ते ऽभ्यगुर्भवनं तस्य सुप्तं चैक्षिषता ऽथ तम् । व्याहार्षुस्तुमुलान्शब्दान्दण्डैश्चा ऽवधिषुर्द्रुतम् ॥
data.et: They repaired to his mansion and then beheld him asleep, produced a tumultous din and quickly struck (him) with sticks;

data.v: केशानलुञ्चिषुस्तस्य गजान्गात्रेष्वचिक्रमन् । शीतैरभ्यषिचंस्तोयैरलातैश्चाऽप्यदम्भिषुः ॥
data.et: -plucked his hair, made elephants walk across his limbs, sprinkled him with cold water and also singed him with burning (fire brands);

data.v: नखैरकर्तिषुस्तीक्ष्णैरदाङ्क्षुर्दशनैस्तथा । शितैरतौत्सुः शूलैश्च भेरीश्चाऽवीवदन्शुभाः ॥
data.et: —tore him with sharp nails, as also bit him with teeth, pierced him with pointed spikes and sounded auspicious drums.

data.v: स तान्ना ऽजीगणत्सर्वा- निच्छया ऽबुद्ध च स्वयम् ।अबूबुधत कस्मान्मा- मप्राक्षीच्च निशा-चरान् ॥
data.et: He heeded not all those and woke up of his own will, and asked the demons, Why have you awakened me ? ’

data.v: ते ऽभाषिषत "राजा त्वां दिदृक्षुः क्षणदा-चर !" । सोऽस्नासीद्व्यलिपन्मांसमप्सासीद्वारुणीमपात् ॥
data.et: They said, "Oh demon, the King is desirous of seeing you. " He bathed, anointed (himself), ate meat and drank Wine.

data.v: न्यवसिष्ट ततो द्रष्टुं रावणं प्रावृतत्गृहात्। । राजा यान्तं तमद्राक्षीदुदस्थाच्चेषदासनात् ॥
data.et: Then he dressed to meet Ravana and started from (his) house. The King saw him coming and rose up slightly from the throne.

data.v: अतुषत्पीठमासन्ने निरदिक्षच्च काञ्चनम्। ।अस्मेष्ट कुम्भकर्णोऽल्पमुपाविक्षदथा ऽन्तिके ॥
data.et: He was pleased and pointed to a golden seat nearby. Kumbhakarna smiled and sat by his side.

data.v: अवादीन् "मां किमित्याह्वो" राज्ञा च प्रत्यवादि सः । "माज्ञासीस्त्वं सुखी रामो यदकार्षीत्स रक्षसाम् ॥
data.et: He said, What for did you summon me ?” And, he was replied to, by the King. "You (who are) happy need not know what Rama did to the demons.

data.v: उदतारीदुदन्वन्तं पुरं नः परितो ऽरुधत् । व्यद्योतिष्ट रणे शस्त्रैरनैषीद्राक्षसान्क्षयम् ॥
data.et: He crossed the ocean, besieged the city all around, shone with (his weapons) in the battle and brought the demons to ruin.

data.v: न प्रावोचमहं किंचित्प्रियं यावदजीविषम् । बन्धुस्त्वमर्चितः स्नेहान्माद्विषो न वधीर्मम ॥
data.et: So long as I lived, I never solicited anything desir- able, not that, you, a brother, honoured with affection, might not kill my enemies.

data.v: वीर्यं मा न ददर्शस्त्वं मा न त्रास्थाः क्षतां पुरम् । तवा ऽद्राक्ष्म वयं वीर्यं त्वमजैषीः पुरा सुरान्" ॥
data.et: Do not refrain from showing valour; do not refuse to protect the harmed city; we have seen your bravery; formerly, you have vanquished the gods."

data.v: अवोचत्कुम्भकर्णस्तं "वयं मन्त्रेऽभ्यधाम यत् । न त्वं सर्वं तदश्रौषीः फलं तस्येदमागमत् ॥
data.et: Kumbhakarna told him, "You have not listened to all that we had spoken to you in counsel. This fruit of that has come (now).

data.v: प्राज्ञ-वाक्यान्यवामंस्था मूर्ख-वाक्येष्ववाऽस्थिथाः ।अध्यगीष्ठाश्च शास्त्राणि प्रत्यपत्था हितं न च ॥
data.et: You disregarded the speech of the wise and abided by the words of the fools; you have studied the science (but) did not accept what is wholesome (in it).

data.v: मूर्खास्त्वामववञ्चन्त ये विग्रहमचीकरन् ।अभाणीन्माल्यवान्युक्तमक्षंस्थास्त्वं न तन्मदात् ॥
data.et: ‘‘The fools that made you indulge in conflict, deceived you. Malyavan spoke (what was) proper ; you did not brook it through vanity.

data.v: राघवस्या ऽमुषः कान्तामाप्तैरुक्तो न चाऽर्पिपः । मा नाऽनुभूः स्वकान्दोषान्मा मुहो मा रुषोऽधुना ॥
data.et: You shattered (separated) Rama's beloved (wife), and did not return (her) when spoken to by well-wishing kinsmen . Not that you should not experience (the fruit of ) your own faults; do not be senseless, do not get angry now.

data.v: तस्याऽप्यत्यक्रमीत्कालो यत्तदाऽहमवादिषम् ।अघानिषत रक्षासि परैः कोशांस्त्वमव्ययीः ॥
data.et: "The time for even that which I had told then is past.

data.v: सन्धान-कारणं तेजो न्यगभूत्ते कृथास्तथा । यत्त्वं वैराणि कोशं च सह-दण्डमजिग्लपः।" ॥
data.et: You have so acted that the means of peace, your lustre, has been dimmed, since you have depleted along with the army (your) valour and treasury."

data.v: अक्रुधच्चाऽभ्यधाद्वाक्यं कुम्भकर्णं दशाननः । "किं त्वं मामजुगुप्सिष्ठा नैदिधः स्व-पराक्रमम् ॥
data.et: Ravana got angry and immediately addressed (these) words to Kumbhakarna : Why did you condemn me, (but) did not enkindle your own heroism ?

data.v: मोज्जिग्रहः सु-नीतानि मा स्म क्रंस्था न संयुगे । मोपालब्धाह्कृतैर्दोषैर्मा न वाक्षीर्हितं परम्।" ॥
data.et: Force me not to accept good sayings; do not hesitate to march out in the battle; do not taunt me about mistakes already committed; do not demur to carry out the highest interest.”

data.v: कुम्भकर्णस्ततो ऽगर्जीद्भटांश्चा ऽन्यान्न्यवीवृतत्। ।उपायंस्त महाऽस्त्राणि निरगाच्च द्रुतं पुरः ॥
data.et: Thereafter Kumbhakarna thundered and caused other warriors to return (to fight), took up mighty missiles and hastily went out of the city.

data.v: मूर्ध्ना दिवमिवा ऽलेखीत्खं व्यापद्वपुषोरुणा । पादाभ्यां क्ष्मामिवा ऽभैस्तीत्दृष्ट्या ऽधाक्षीदिव द्विशः ॥
data.et: He scratched, as it were, the sky with his head, pervaded the sky with his huge frame, broke as though the earth with his (two) feet and burnt the enemies as if with his glance.

data.v: दग्ध-शैल इवा ऽभासीत्प्राक्रंस्त क्षय-मेघ-वत् । प्राचकम्पदुदन्वन्तं राक्षसानप्यतित्रसत् ॥
data.et: (He) appeared like a blazed mountain, stalked ahead like the cloud of destruction, caused the ocean to quake, frightened excessively even the demons.

data.v: स-पक्षो ऽद्रिरिवा ऽचालीन्न्यश्वसीत्कल्प-वायु-वत् ।अभार्षीद्ध्वनिना लोका- नभ्राजिष्ट क्षयाऽग्नि-वत् ॥
data.et: (He) moved like a winged mountain, breathed out like the tornado at the end of the aeon, filled the worlds with roars, and flashed like the fire of destruction.

data.v: अनंसीद्भूर्भरेणा ऽस्य रंहसा शाखिनो ऽलुठन् । सिंहाः प्रादुद्रुवन्भीताः प्राक्षुभन्कुल-पर्वताः ॥
data.et: By his weight, the earth caved in, trees rolled down by (his) speed, lions ran away frightened and the dividing (border) mountains shook.

data.v: उत्पाताः प्रावृतंस्तस्य द्यौरशीकिष्ट शोणितम् । वायवोऽवासिषुर्भीमाः क्रूराश्चाऽकुषत द्विजाः ॥
data.et: Ill omens dogged him, the heaven sprinkled blood, ferocious tornados began to blow and birds boding evil chirped.

data.v: अस्पन्दिष्टा ऽक्षि वामं च घोराश्चा ऽराटिषुः शिवाः । न्यपप्तन्मुसले गृध्रा दीप्तया ऽपाति चोल्कया ॥
data.et: And (his) left eye throbbed and dreadful jackals howled, Vultures fell headlong on (his) maces and a burning meteor shot down.

data.v: आंहिष्ट तान-संमान्य दर्पात्स प्रधन-क्षितिम् । ततोऽनर्दीदनन्दीच्च शत्रूनाह्वास्त चाऽऽहवे ॥
data.et: Having ignored them, he marched ahead. Then (he) roared, rejoiced and challenged the enemies to battle.

data.v: प्राशीन्न चा ऽतृपत्क्रूरः क्षुच्चाऽस्याऽवृधदश्नतः ।अधाद्वसामधासीच्च रुधिरं वन-वासिनाम् ॥
data.et: He devoured (the monkeys) and was not satiated; the hunger of his, (who went on) eating increased; he drank the fat and sipped the blood of the forest-dwellers.

data.v: माम्सेना ऽस्या ऽश्वतां कुक्षी जठरं चा ऽप्यशिश्वियत् । बहूनामग्लुचत्प्राणा- नग्लोचीच्च रणे यशः ॥
data.et: Both his sides swelled with meat and his abdomen too got swollen. (He) dispelled the life-breaths of many and snatched away their fame in the battle.

data.v: सामर्थ्यं चा ऽपि सो ऽस्तम्भीद्विक्रमं चाऽस्य ना ऽस्तभन् । शाखिनः केचिदध्यष्ठुर्न्यमाङ्क्षुरपरे ऽम्बु-धौ ॥
data.et: He also restrained (their) might (but) they did not stem his valour ; some resorted to trees and others plunged into the ocean.

data.v: अन्ये त्वलङ्घिषुः शैलान्गुहास्वन्ये न्यलेषत । केचिदासिषत स्तब्धा भयात्केचिदघूर्णिषुः ॥
data.et: Others, however, crossed the mountains ; some others hid in caves; some sat paralysed; and some rolled about through fear.

data.v: उदतारिषुरम्भो-धिं वानराः सेतुना ऽपरे ।अलज्जिष्टाऽङ्गदस्तत्र प्रत्यवास्थित चोर्जितम् ॥
data.et: other monkeys crossed the ocean by the bridge. At this Angada felt ashamed and resorted to bravery (dare-devilry).

data.v: सत्त्वं समदुधुक्षच्च वानराणामयुद्ध च । ततः शैलानुदक्षैप्सुरुदगूरिषत द्रुमान् ॥
data.et: And he enkindled the spirit of the monkeys and fought ; then they hurled boulders and lifted up trees.

data.v: अनर्दिषुः कपि-व्याघ्राः सम्यक्चा ऽयुत्सताऽऽहवे । तानमर्दीदखादीच्च निरास्थच्च तलाऽऽहतान् ॥
data.et: The tiger-like monkeys roared and fought neatly in the battle. He (Kumbhakarna) crushed, devoured and scattered the monkeys who were (first) hit with his palm.

data.v: प्राचुचूर्णच्च पादाभ्यामबिभीषत च द्रुतम् ।अतर्हीच्चैव शूलेन कुम्भकर्णः प्लवङ्गमान् ॥
data.et: And he pulvarised them with his two feet and instantly frightened (them); Kumbhakarna even pierced the monkeys with lances.

data.v: अतौत्सीद्गदया गाढमपिषच्चोपगूहनैः । जनुभ्यामदमीच्चाऽन्यान्हस्त-वर्तमवीवृतत् ॥
data.et: He hurt them deep with the mace and crushed (some of) them with embraces ; others he punished by his (two) knees and moulded still others by pressing (them) with (his) palms.

data.v: अदालिषुः शिला देहे चूर्ण्यभूवन्महा-द्रुमाः । क्षिप्तास्तस्य न चा ऽचेतीत्तानसौ ना ऽपि चा ऽक्षुभत् ॥
data.et: On (his) body, boulders got shattered, huge trees were crushed to powder; he did not (at all) feel that they were hurled at him, nor also was he agitated.

data.v: अद्राष्टां तं रघु-व्याघ्रौ आख्यच्चैनं विभीषणः । "एष व्यजेष्ट देवेन्द्रं नाऽशङ्किष्ट विवस्वतः ॥
data.et: The two tiger-like Raghu princes perceived him and Vibhisana briefed (them) on him. "He vanquished the Lord of the gods (Indra) and did not dread the Sun.

data.v: यक्षेन्द्र-शक्तिमच्छासीन्ना ऽप्रोथीदस्य कश्चन । कुम्भकर्णान्न भैष्टं मा युवामस्मान्नृपाऽऽत्मजौ ॥
data.et: "(He) shattered the mighty missile of the Lord of

data.v: घ्नन्तं मोपेक्षिषाथां च मा न कार्ष्टमिहाऽऽदरम्। । "अमुं मा न वधिष्टे"ति रामोऽवादीत्ततः कपीन् ॥
data.et: Do not disregard him who hits; don't you have no regard for this one. Do not hesitate to kill him. Thus Rama spoke to the monkeys.

data.v: ते व्यरासिषुराह्वन्त राक्षसं चा ऽप्यपिप्लवन् ।अबभासन्स्वकाः शक्तीर्द्रुम-शैलं व्यकारिषुः ॥
data.et: They chattered, challenged the demon and also jumped, exhibited their own powers, (and) hurled (at him) a number of trees and boulders.

data.v: ते तं व्याशिषता ऽक्षौत्सुः पादैर्दन्तैस्तथा ऽच्छिदन्। ।आर्जिजत्शरभो वृक्षं नीलस्त्वा ऽऽदित पर्वतम् ॥
data.et: They crowded (around him), crushed him with the feet, so also tore him with the teeth ; Sarabha tried to pick up a tree ; Nila however, took up a boulder.

data.v: ऋषभो ऽद्रीनुदक्षैप्सीत्ते तैररिमतर्दिषुः। ।अस्फूर्जीद्गिरि-शृङ्गं च व्यस्राक्षीद्गन्धमादनः ॥
data.et: Rsabha hurled boulders ; with those they thrashed the enemy; Gandhamadana thundered and discharged the summit of a mountain.

data.v: अकूर्दिष्ट व्यकारीच्च गवाक्षो भू-धरान्बहून्। । स तान्नाऽजीगणद्वीरः कुम्भकर्णोऽव्यथिष्ट न ॥
data.et: Gavaksa frolicked and dispersed many boulders; that brave Kumbhakarna did not heed them, nor was he hurt.

data.v: अमन्थीच्च पराऽनीकमप्लोष्ट च निरङ्कुशः । निहन्तुं चाऽत्वरिष्टाऽरीनजक्षीच्चाऽङ्कमागतान् ॥
data.et: And he harassed the enemy's army and hopped about unrestricted and hastened to kill the enemies and devoured those that came near his lap.

data.v: व्यक्रुक्षद्वानराऽनीकं संपलायिष्ट चाऽऽयति । हस्ताभ्यां नश्यदक्राक्षीद्भीमे चोपाधिताऽऽनने ॥
data.et: On his coming, the monkey-army yelled and filed. He dragged back (the) disappearing (army) with both hands and threw it into his terrific mouth.

data.v: रक्तेना ऽचिक्लिदद्भूमिं सैन्यैश्चा ऽतस्तरद्धतैः । ना ऽतार्प्सीद्भक्षयन्क्रूरो ना ऽश्रमद्घ्नन्प्लवङ्गमान् ॥
data.et: The cruel one drenched the ground with blood and covered it with the slain forces; he was not satiated (by) eating and was not tired (of ) killing the monkeys.

data.v: न योद्धुमशकन्केचिन्ना ऽढौकिषत केचन । प्राणशन्नासिकाभ्यां च वक्त्रेण च वनौकसः ॥
data.et: Some could not fight, some did not go near him, and the forest-dwellers vanished through both his nostrils and mouth.

data.v: उदरे चा ऽजरन्नन्ये तस्य पाताल-सन्निभे ।आक्रन्दिषुः सखीनाह्वन्प्रपलायिषताऽस्विदन् ॥
data.et: Some were digested in his stomach which resembled the nether world (patala) ; they yelled, called (their) friends, fled quickly (and) perspired.

data.v: रक्तमश्च्योतिषुः क्षुण्णाः क्षताश्च कपयोऽतृषन् ।उपास्थायि नृपो भग्नैरसौ सुग्रीवमैजिहत् ॥
data.et: The crushed monkeys passed out blood; wounded, (they) felt thirsty: the King (Rama) was approached by the scattered (monkeys) and he goaded on Sugriva.

data.v: योद्धुं सो प्यरुषच्छत्रोरैरिरच्च महा-द्रुमम्। । तं प्राप्तं प्रासहिष्टाऽरिः शक्तिं चोग्रामुदग्रहीत् ॥
data.et: He, too, was enraged for fighting and threw a huge tree against the enemy; he withstood it (as it) reached (him) and picked up a ferocious missile.

data.v: स तामबिभ्रमद्भीमां वानरेन्द्रस्य चा ऽमुचत्। । प्रापप्तन्मारुतिस्तत्र तां चा ऽलासीद्वियद्-गताम् ॥
data.et: He whirled that terrific (missile) and discharged it towards the lord of the monkeys. Maruti instantly fell thereon and caught that (missile) that had risen up the sky.

data.v: अशोभिष्टाऽचखण्डच्च शक्तिं वीरो न चा ऽयसत्। । लौह-भार-सहस्रेण निर्मिता निरकारि मे ॥
data.et: The brave Maruti blazed and broke the missile and was not tired. ‘Manufactured out of a thousand weight-units (20 tolas) of iron.

data.v: शक्तिरत्यकुपद्रक्षो गिरिं चोदखनीद्गुरुम् । व्यसृष्ट तं कपी-न्द्रस्य तेनाऽमूर्च्छीदसौ क्षतः ॥
data.et: -my missile is (broken by him), thus the demon got angry and dug out a heavy boulder and hurled it against (Sugriva), the lord of the monkeys; wounded thereby he fainted.

data.v: अलोठिष्ट च भू-पृष्ठे शोणितं चा ऽप्यसुस्रुवत् । तमादायाऽपलायिष्ट व्यरोचिष्ट च राक्षसः ॥
data.et: -and rolled on the ground and passed blood; after picking him up, the demon ran off and became radiant (with victory).

data.v: अभैषुः कपयो ऽन्वारत्कुम्भुकर्णं मरुत्-सुतः । शनैरबोधि सुग्रीवः सोऽलुञ्चीत्कर्ण-नासिकम् ॥
data.et: The monkeys got frightened; the son of the Wind (Maruti) chased Kumbhakarna ; gradually Sugriva came to (his) senses ; (and) he plucked off the ears and nose

data.v: राक्षसस्य न चा ऽत्रासीत्प्रनष्टुमयतिष्ट च। ।अक्रोधि कुम्भकर्णेन पेष्टुमारम्भि च क्षितौ ॥
data.et: -of the demon and did not fear; he also tried to ( disentangle himself from his grip and) flee. At this Kumbhakarna got enraged and began to crush him against the ground.

data.v: सुग्रीवो ऽस्या ऽभ्रशद्धस्तात्समगाहिष्ट चा ऽम्बरम् । तूर्णमन्वसृपद्राम- माननन्दच्च वानरान् ॥
data.et: sugriva slipped off from his hand and adeptly plunged into the sky, hurriedly approached Rama and delighted the monkeys.

data.v: अतत्वरच्च तान्योद्धुमचिचेष्टच्च राघवौ। । कुम्भकर्णो न्यवर्तिष्ट रणेऽयुत्सन्त वानराः ॥
data.et: He hurried them up to fight and urged the two Raghavas. Kumbhakarna re-entered the fray and the monkeys fought (him).

data.v: अविवेष्टन्नृपाऽऽदेशादारुक्षंश्चाऽऽशु राक्षसम् । तानधावीत्समारूढांस्ते ऽप्युस्रंसिषता ऽऽकुलाः ॥
data.et: (Rama) got (him) surrounded (by the monkeys); and (they), by the command of the King, quickly mounted on the demon. He shook of those that had mounted on him, and they too, hurtled down distressed.

data.v: अग्रसिष्ट व्यधाविष्ट समाश्लिक्षच्च निर्-दयम्। । ते चा ऽप्यघोरिषुर्घोरं रक्तं चा ऽवमिषुर्मुखैः ॥
data.et: He swallowed, chased and mercilessly hugged (them). They too yelled fiercely and vomitted blood through their mouths.

data.v: स चाऽपि रुधिरैर्मत्तः स्वेषामप्यदयिष्ट न ।अग्रहीच्चा ऽऽयुरन्येषामरुद्ध च पराक्रमम् ॥
data.et: And he, intoxicated by blood, did not pity even his own (soldiers), and took the life and strained the valour of the enemies.

data.v: संत्रस्तानांअपाहारि सत्त्वं च वन-वासिनाम् ।अच्छेदि लक्ष्मणेनाऽस्य किरीटं कवचं तथा ॥
data.et: The spirit of the frightened forest-dwellers was eradicated; His diadem as well as his armour was shattered by Laksmana ;

data.v: अभेदि च शरैर्देहः प्राशंसीत्तं निशा-चरः। ।अस्पर्धिष्ट च रामेण तेना ऽस्या ऽक्षिप्सतेषवः ॥
data.et: -and, his body was injured by means of arrows, The demon praised him and fought with Rama ; by him arrows were discharged at him.

data.v: यैरघानि खरो वाली मारीचो दूषणस्तथा। ।अवामंस्त स तान्दर्पात्प्रोदयंसीच्च मुद्गरम् ॥
data.et: Through vanity, he disregarded those arrows with which Khara, vali, Marica as well as Dusana were killed, and brandished his club.

data.v: वायव्याऽस्त्रेण तं पाणिं रामो ऽच्छैत्सीत्सहाऽऽयुधम् ।आदीपि तरु-हस्तो ऽसा- वधावीच्चा ऽरि-संमुखम् ॥
data.et: With the missile of Wind, Rama severed that arm along with the weapon; with a tree in his (other) hand he glowed brightly and ran up to confront (face) Rama.

data.v: स-वृक्षमच्छिदत्तस्य शक्राऽस्त्रेण करं नृपः । जङ्घे चा ऽशीशतद्बाणैरप्रासीदिषुभिर्मुखम् ॥
data.et: The King, with Indra's missile, cut off his hand

data.v: ऐन्द्रेण हृदये ऽव्यात्सीत्सो ऽध्यवात्सीच्च गां हतः। ।अपिक्षातां सहस्रे द्वे तद्-देहेन वनौकसाम् ॥
data.et: He struck at his (Kumbhakarna's) heart with Indra's missile and, killed (him), (at which he (Kumbhakarna) took to (fell on) the ground; of forest-dwellers two thousands were ground under his body.

data.v: अस्ताविषुः सुरा रामं दिशः प्रापन्निशा-चराः । भूरकम्पिष्ट साऽद्रीन्द्रा व्यचालीदम्भसां पतिः ॥
data.et: Gods applauded Rama ; the demons reached (filed in) (different) directions ; the earth, along with mighty mountains quaked; the ocean got agitated .

data.v: हतं रक्षांसि राजानं कुम्भकर्णमशिश्रवन् ।अरोदीद्रावणो ऽशोचीन्मोहं चा ऽशिश्रियत्परम् ॥
data.et: The demons announced slain Kumbhakarpa to the King . Ravana wept, lamented and passed into a high faint.

data.v: अपप्रथद्गुणान्भ्रातुरचिकीर्तच्च विक्रमम् । "क्रुद्धेन कुम्भकर्णेन ये ऽदिर्षिशत शत्रवः ॥
data.et: He proclaimed the virtues and recounted the valour of his brother. 'The enemies who were perceived (confronted) by the enraged Kumbhakarna.

data.v: कथं न्वजीविषुस्ते च स चा ऽमृत महा-बलः।" ।अयुयुत्सिषता ऽऽश्वास्य कुमारा रावणं ततः ॥
data.et: -survived; but he, whose might was great, died; How is it ?" Thereafter, having reassured Ravana, the princes, (the sons of Ravana), desired to fight.

data.v: देवान्तको ऽतिकायश्च त्रिशिराः स नरान्तकः । ते चांऽऽहिषत संग्रामं बलिनो रावणाऽऽत्मजाः ॥
data.et: Those powerful sons of Ravana, Devantaka, Atikaya, Trisiras and that (famous) Narantaka, marched forth for battle.

data.v: युद्धोन्मत्तं च मत्तं च राजा रक्षार्थमाञ्जिहत् । सुतानां निरगातां तौ राक्षसौ रण-पण्डितौ ॥
data.et: The King dispatched Yuddhonmatta and Matta for the protection of his sons. Those two demons, expert in fighting, marched out.

data.v: तैरजेषत सैन्यानि द्विषो ऽकारिषता ऽऽकुलाः । पर्वतानिव ते भूमावचैषुर्वानरोत्तमान् ॥
data.et: By them the forces were vanquished, enemies were rendered distressed; like mountains they heaped on the earth the best of monkeys.

data.v: अङ्गदेन समं योद्धुमघटिष्ट नरान्तकः । प्रैषिषद्राक्षसः प्रासं सो ऽस्फोटीदङ्गदोरसि ॥
data.et: Narantaka strove to fight with Aigada; the demon discharged a barbed missile; it broke on the chest of Aigada.

data.v: अश्वान्वालि-सुतो ऽहिंसीदतताडच्च मुष्टिना। । रावणिश्चा ऽव्यथो योद्धुमारब्ध च महीं गतः ॥
data.et: The son of Vali killed (his) horses and thrashed him with the fists and, unharmed, Ravana's son, who descended to the ground, began to fight.

data.v: तस्या ऽहारिषत प्राणा मुष्टिना वालि-सूनुना। । प्रादुद्रुवंस्ततः क्रुद्धाः सर्वे रावणयोऽङ्गदम् ॥
data.et: With a fist-blow, his life-breaths were snatched away by the son of Vali. Then all the enraged sons of Ravana rushed towards Angada.

data.v: ततो नील-हनूमन्तौ रावणीनववेष्टताम् ।अकारिष्टां गिरींस्तुङ्गानरौत्सीत्त्रिशिराः शरैः ॥
data.et: Then Nala and Hanuman surrounded Ravana's sons (and) hurled lofty boulders ; Trisiras blocked (them) with arrows.

data.v: परिघेणा ऽवधिष्टा ऽथ रणे देवान्तको बली । मुष्टिना ऽददरत्तस्य मूर्धानं मारुताऽऽत्मजः ॥
data.et: Then , in the fight, the mighty Devantaka hit with an iron-tipped club ; the Son of the Wind smashed his head with a first-below.

data.v: अदीदिपत्ततो वीर्यं नीलं चाऽपीपिडच्छरैः । युद्धोन्मत्तस्तु नीलेन गिरिणाऽनायि संक्षयम् ॥
data.et: Then Yuddhonmatta enkindled valour and tormented Nila with arrows ; by Nila, however, he was led to destruction by means of a boulder.

data.v: अबभ्राजत्ततः शक्तिं त्रिशिराः पवनाऽऽत्मजे । हनूमता क्षतास्तस्य रणे ऽमृषत वाजिनः ॥
data.et: Then Trisiras shot a missile at the Son of the Wind struck by Hanuman, his horses died in the fight.

data.v: अस्रसच्चाऽऽहतो मूर्ध्नि खड्गं चा ऽजीहरद्द्विषा । प्राणानौज्झीच्च खड्गेन छिन्नैस्तेनैव मूर्धभिः ॥
data.et: And, hit on the head, he dropped down and allowed (his) sword to be snatched away by the enemy, and laid down his life with his (three) heads severed by that very sword !

data.v: मत्तेना ऽमारि संप्राप्य शरभाऽस्तां महा-गदाम् । सहस्र-हरिणा ऽक्रीडीदतिकायस्ततो रणे ॥
data.et: Having received (a blow from) the huge club hurled by Sarabha, Matta died. Then Atikaya sported in the battle in a thousand-horsed.

data.v: रथेना ऽविव्यथच्चाऽरीन्व्यचारीच्च नि-रङ्कुशः । विभीषणेन सो ऽख्यायि राघवस्य महा-रथः ॥
data.et: -chariot and tormented his enemies and moved about unrestrained. By Vibhisana that mighty (chariot)-warrior was announced (introduced) to Rama.

data.v: "अतस्तम्भदयं वज्रं स्वयम्भुवमतूतुषत् ।अशिक्षिष्ट महाऽस्त्राणि रणे ऽरक्षीच्च राक्षसान् ॥
data.et: This one stopped the adamant and delighted the Creator (Self-born-Brahma), studied mighty missiles and pro tected the demons in battle;

data.v: अद्यगीष्टा ऽर्थ-शास्त्राणि यमस्या ऽह्नोष्ट विक्रमम् । देवाऽऽहवेष्वदीपिष्ट ना ऽजनिष्टा ऽस्य साध्वसम् ॥
data.et: -(he) studied the science of politics, dispelled the valour of Yama, (and) blazed in the wars with the gods; no fear (ever) arose in him.

data.v: एष रावणिरापादि वानराणां भयङ्करः" ।आह्वता ऽथ स काकुत्स्थं धनुश्चा ऽपुस्फुरद्गुरु ॥
data.et: Dreadful to the monkeys, this son of Ravana has come near." Then he challenged the descendent of Kakutstha (Rama) and flourished his heavy bow.

data.v: सौमित्रिः सर्प-वत्सिंहमार्दिदत्तं महाऽऽहवे। । तौ प्रावीवृततां जेतुं शर-जालान्यनेकशः ॥
data.et: Like a serpent assaulting a lion, the son of Sumitra (Laksmana) assaulted him in the great war; for winning a vic tory, they discharged numerous arrows.

data.v: अच्छैत्तां च महाऽऽत्मानौ चिरमश्रमतां न च । तथा तावास्थतां बाणानतानिष्टां तमो यथा ॥
data.et: And the two magnanimous (warriors), broke (the arrows) and did not tire out for long. They shot arrows in such a manner (even) as to spread darkness.

data.v: सौर्याऽऽग्नेये व्यकारिष्टामस्त्रे राक्षस-लक्ष्मणौ । ते चोपागमता नाशं समासाद्य परस्परम् ॥
data.et: The demon and Laksmana discharged the Solar' and the Fiery missiles, (respectively), and having dashed mutually, they (the two arrows) perished.

data.v: अबिभ्रजत्ततः शस्त्रमैषीकं राक्षसो रणे । तदप्यध्वसदासाद्य माहेन्द्रं लक्ष्मणेरितम् ॥
data.et: Then the demon ignited the Aisika missile in the battle. That too, perished after dashing against the Mahendra missile shot by Laksmana .

data.v: ततः सौमित्रिरस्मार्षीददेविष्ट च दुर्-जयम् । ब्रह्माऽस्त्रं तेन मूर्धानमदध्वंसन्नर-द्विषः ॥
data.et: Then Laksmana recollected and ignited the invincible Brahma missile and with it smashed the head of the man-hater (Atikaya).

data.v: ततो ऽक्रन्दीद्दशग्रीवस्तमाशिश्वसदिन्द्रजित् । निरयासीच्च संक्रुद्धः प्रार्चिचच्च स्वयम्भुवम् ॥
data.et: Then Ravana cried (in grief). Indrajit consoled him and marched out enraged and worshipped the Self-born (Brahma).

data.v: अहौषीत्कृष्णवर्त्मानं समयष्टा ऽस्त्र-मण्डलम् । सो ऽलब्ध ब्रह्मणः शस्त्रं स्यन्दनं च जयाऽऽवहम् ॥
data.et: (He) offered oblations in the Fire, worshipped the group of missiles; he acquired from the Creator a weapon and a chariot which brought victory.

data.v: तमध्यासिष्ट दीप्राऽग्रममोदिष्ट च रावणिः । छन्न-रूपस्ततो ऽकर्तीद्देहान्रावण-विद्विषाम् ॥
data.et: The son of Ravana mounted it which had a blazing front and instantly rejoiced; then (he), whose form became invisible, smashed the bodies of Ravana's enemies.

data.v: सप्त-षष्टिं प्लवङ्गानां कोटीर्बाणैरसूषुपत्। । निशाऽन्ते रावणिः क्रुद्धो राघवौ च व्यमूमुहत् ॥
data.et: By the end of night, the angry Indrajit put to (eternal) sleep seven thousand crores of monkeys and rendered the two Raghavas unconscious.

data.v: अपिस्फवत्स्व-सामर्थ्यमगूहीत्सायकैर्दिशः ।अघोरीच्च महा-घोरं गत्वा प्रैषीच्च रावणम् ॥
data.et: Indrajit enhanced his own might, veiled the quarters with arrows, thundered very ferociously and having gone back, sent (out) Ravana (to see the devastation).

data.v: विभीषणस्ततो ऽबोधि स-स्फुरौ राम-लक्ष्मणौ ।अपारीत्स गृहीतोल्को हत-शेषान्प्लवङ्गमान् ॥
data.et: Then Vibhisapa realised (that) Rama and Laksmana (showed) a throbbing ; he, who held a torch, delighted the remaining monkeys that had survived the dead (saying) :

data.v: "मा शोचिष्ट रघु-व्याघ्रौ नाऽमृषातामिति ब्रुवन् ।अवाबुद्ध स नीलाऽऽदीन्निहतान्कपि-यूथ-पान् ॥
data.et: “Do not grieve, the tiger-like Raghu Princes are not dead." He came to know that the monkey commanders Nila and others were slain.

data.v: तत्रैषज्जाम्बवान्प्राणीदुदमीलीच्च लोचने । पौलस्त्यं चाऽगदीत् "कच्चिदजीवीन्मारुताऽऽत्मजः।" ॥
data.et: Among them Jambavan breathed slightly and opened his eyes, and spoke to Vibhisana (Paulastya), Has the Son of the Wind survived per chance ?

data.v: तस्य क्षेमे महा-राज ! ना ऽमृष्मह्यखिला वयम्। । पौलस्त्यो ऽशिश्रवत्तं च जीवन्तं पवनाऽऽत्मजम् ॥
data.et: Oh great King, in (case of) his safety all of us may not die." And Vibhisana reported to him that the Son of the Wind was alive.

data.v: आयिष्ट मारुतिस्तत्र तौ चा ऽप्यहृषतां ततः । प्राहैष्टां हिमवत्-पृष्ठे सर्वौषधि-गिरिं ततः ॥
data.et: Maruti arrived there and thereupon both of them rejoiced; then (the two) dispatched behind Himalaya to the mountain of all medical herbs.

data.v: तौ हनूमन्तमानेतुमोषधीं मृत-जीविनीम् । सन्धान-करणीं चाऽन्यां वि-शल्य-करणीं तथा ॥
data.et: -Maruti, to fetch the herb which revived the dead (myrtajiwan), which joined together broken bones (sandhana karan) and also another one which completely healed wounds.

data.v: प्रोदपाति नभस्तेन स च प्रापि महा-गिरिः । यस्मिन्नज्वलिषू रात्रौ महौषध्यः सहस्र-शः ॥
data.et: The sky was dived into by him (Hanuman) and he reached the huge mountain whereupon the important herbs shone brightly by the thousands at night

data.v: निरचायि यदा भेदो नौषधीनां हनू-मता । सर्व एव समाहारि तदा शैलः महौषधिः ॥
data.et: When the distinction between the medicinal herbs was not determined by Hanuman, then the whole mountain along with the herbs was brought (by him) there (to Lanka).

data.v: प्राणिषुर्निहताः केचित्केचित्तु प्रोदमीलिषुः । तमो ऽन्ये ऽहासिषुर्योधा व्यजृम्भिषत चाऽपरे ॥
data.et: Some of the dead, breathed again; some, on the other hand, opened (their eyes) ; other warriors abandoned darkness (unconsciousness) and still others yawned.

data.v: अजिघ्रपंस्तथैवाऽन्यानोषधीरालिपंस्तथा ।एवं तेऽचेतिषुः सर्वे वीर्यं चाऽधिषताऽधिकम् ॥
data.et: He made (them) smell the herbs; so also smeared others (with them); thus they all came back to life and acquired greater strength.

data.v: अजिह्लदत्स काकुत्स्थौ शेषांश्चा ऽजीजिवत्कपीन् । हनूमानथ ते लङ्का- मग्निना ऽदीदिपन्द्रुतम् ॥
data.et: Hanuman delighted the two Kakutstha princes and revived the remaining monkeys ; thereafter, they hastily ignited Lanka with fire.

data.v: समनात्सीत्ततः सैन्यममार्जीद्भल्ल-तोमरम् ।अमार्क्षीच्चा ऽसिपत्राऽऽदीनबभासत्परश्वधान् ॥
data.et: Then the army (of Ravana) put on armour, polished crescent-tipped lances and javelinscleaned (their) ine swords and brightened (their) axes.

data.v: कुम्भकर्ण-सुतौ तत्र समनद्धां महा-बलौ । निकुम्भश्चैव कुम्भश्च प्रापतां तौ प्लवङ्गमान् ॥
data.et: Then Nikumbha and Kumbha, the two very mighty sons of Kumbhakarna, put on coats of mail and they accosted the monkeys.

data.v: अगोपिष्टां पुरीं लङ्कामगौप्तां रक्षसां बलम् ।अत्याक्तामायुधाऽनीकमनैष्टां च क्षयं द्विषः ॥
data.et: The two protected the city (of) Lanka, saved the army of the demons, discharged a multitude of weapons and led the enemy to destruction.

data.v: अकोकूयिष्ट तत्सैन्यं प्रपलायिष्ट चाऽऽकुलम् ।अच्युतच्च क्षतं रक्तं हतं चा ऽध्यशयिष्ट गाम् ॥
data.et: That distressed army yelled and fled; being wounded, (it) emitted blood, and being killed, (it) lay on the ground.

data.v: अङ्गदेना ऽहसातां तौ युध्यकम्पन-कम्पनौ ।अभ्यार्दीद्वालिनः पुत्रं प्रजङ्घो ऽपि स-मत्सरः ॥
data.et: Those two, Akampana and Kampana, were killed in the battle by Aigada. Thereupon Prajaigha, full of jealousy, struck the soa of Vati (Angada).

data.v: तस्या ऽप्यबेभिदिष्टा ऽसौ मूर्धानं मुष्टिना ऽङ्गदः ।अहार्षीच्च शिरः क्षिप्रं यूपाक्षस्य निराकुलः ॥
data.et: That Aigada smashed his head with a fist-blow and Nirakula quickly severed the head of Yupaksa.

data.v: शरीरं लोहिताक्षस्य न्यभाङ्क्षीद्द्विविदस्तदा । क्रुद्धः कुम्भस्ततो ऽभैत्सीन्मैन्दं स-द्विविदं शरैः ॥
data.et: Then (the monkey) Dvivida pounded the body of Lohitaka. Thereupon enraged Kumbha injured Mainda along with Dvivida with arrows.

data.v: आघूर्णिष्टां क्षतौ क्ष्मां च तावाशिश्रियतामुभौ। । मातुलौ विह्वलौ दृष्ट्वा कुम्भं वालि-सुतो नगैः ॥
data.et: Wounded, those two whirled and took to the ground. On seeing both his maternal uncles distressed, the son of Vali with trees.

data.v: प्रौर्णावीच्छर-वर्षेण तानप्रौहीन्निशा-चरः। । वानरानैजिहद्रामस्य तूर्णं रक्षितुमङ्गदम् ॥
data.et: --covered up Kumbha ; the demon dispelled them with a shower of arrows. Rama hurriedly impelled the monkeys to protect Aigada.

data.v: द्रुतमत्रास्त सुग्रीवो भ्रातृव्यं षत्रु-संकटात् । मुष्टिना कौम्भकर्णिं च क्रुद्धः प्राणैरतित्यजत् ॥
data.et: Sugriva instantly rescued (his) brother's son from the danger of the enemy and enraged, he, with a fist-blow, got the son of Kumbhakarna to be forsaken by his life-breaths.

data.v: निकुम्भो वानरेन्द्रस्य प्राहैषीत्परिघं ततः । हनूमांश्चा ऽऽपतन्तं तमभाङ्क्षीद्भोगि-भीषणम् ॥
data.et: Then Nikumbha hurled a club at the monkey chief and Hanuman smote down that (club) which was rushing down and was as terrific as a cobra.

data.v: प्रौर्णुवीत्तेजसाऽरातिमरासीच्च भयंकरम् । ग्रीवां चा ऽस्य तथाक्राक्षीदजिजीवद्यथा न तम् ॥
data.et: (He) overpowered the enemy with (his) lustre, and thundered ferociously and so pulled his neck as not to let him live.

data.v: समगतकपि-सैन्यं सम्मदेना ऽतिमात्रं विटप-हरिण-नाथः सिद्धिमौहिष्ट नित्याम् । नृ-पति-मतिररंस्त प्राप्त-कामेव हर्षात्रजनि-चर-पतीनां सन्ततो ऽतायि शोकः ॥
data.et: The monkey army was overwhelmed with exultation; the lord of the monkeys inferred eternal victory ; the Kings mind exulted through joy as if it had secured its desires ; the grief of the King of the demons waxed unabated.

data.v: ततः प्ररुदितो राजा रक्षसां हत-बान्धवः । "किं करिष्यामि राज्येन सीतया किं करिष्यते ॥
data.et: Then the King of the demons, whose kinsmen were slain, lamented, What shall I do with the kingdom ? What could be done with Sita ?

data.v: अतिकाये हते वीरे प्रोत्सहिष्ये न जीवितुम्। । ह्रेपयिष्यति कः शत्रून्केन जायिष्यते यमः ॥
data.et: ‘‘The warrior Atikaya having been killed, I shall not enthuse (myself) to live. Who will put the enemies to shame ? By whom will Yama be vanquished ?

data.v: अतिकायाद्विना पाश्यं को वा छेत्स्यति वारुणम् । रावणं मंस्यते को वा स्वयम्भूः कस्य तोक्ष्यति ॥
data.et: ‘‘Or who but Atikaya will cut of the noose of Varuna ? Or who will respect Ravana ? Whom will Brahma please ?

data.v: श्लाघिष्ये केन को बन्धून्नेष्यत्युन्नतिमुन्नतः । कः प्रेष्यति पित्न्काले कृत्वा कित्थष्यते न कः ॥
data.et: By whom shall be praised? Who, himself pros perous, will lead his kinsmen to prosperity ? Who will gratify the manes at the proper time ? Who having achieved (something great) will not boast ?

data.v: उद्यंस्यति हरिर्वज्रं विचरिष्यति निर्-भयः । भोक्ष्यते यज्ञ-भागांश्च शूर-मानं च वक्ष्यति ॥
data.et: (Now) Indra will brandish the adamant and move

data.v: रविस्तप्स्यति निः-शङ्कं वास्यत्यनियतं मरुत् । निर्वर्त्स्यत्यृतु-संघातः स्वेच्छयेन्दुरुदेष्यति ॥
data.et: The sun will shine fearlessly: the wind will blow unrestricted; the collection of seasons will end (i.e., They will occur singly); the moon will rise at its will.

data.v: तीव्रं स्यन्दिष्यते मेघैरुग्रं वर्तिष्यते यमः ।अतिकायस्य मरणे किं करिष्यन्ति नाऽन्यथा ॥
data.et: ‘‘The clouds will shower severely and Yama will behave ferociously. On Atikaya's death who and what will not act differently ?

data.v: अन्मीलिष्यति चक्षुर्मे वृथा यद्विनयाऽऽगतम् ।आज्ञा-लाभोन्मुखं नम्रं न द्रक्ष्यति नरान्तकम् ॥
data.et: In vain will my eye open, my eye that will not per ceive the modest Narantaka, arrived in humility, with his face raised for receiving orders !

data.v: धिङ्मां त्रिशिरसा ना ऽहं सन्दर्शिष्ये ऽद्य यत्पुनः । घानिष्यन्ते द्विषः केन तस्मिन्पञ्चत्वमागते ॥
data.et: ‘‘Fie upon me, for I shall not be seen again today by (my son) Trisiras. He being slain, through whom will the enemies be got killed ?’’

data.v: शत्रुभिर्निहते मत्ते द्रक्ष्ये ऽहं संयुगे सुखम् । युद्धोन्मत्ताद्विना शत्रून्समास्कन्त्स्यति को रणे ॥
data.et: "Matta being killed by the enemies, I shall (now) be easily encountered (by my enemies) in battle. Who but Yuddhonmatta will march towards the enemies in the battle ?’

data.v: आह्वास्यते वि-शङ्को मां योत्स्यमानः शत-क्रतुः । प्रकल्प्स्यति च तस्या ऽर्थो निकुम्बे दुर्हणे हते ॥
data.et: Dauntless Indra, desirous of fighting, will challenge me; and Nikumbha, who was hard to kill, being killed, his (Indra's) objective will be achieved.

data.v: कल्पिष्यते हरेः प्रीतिर्लङ्का चोपहनिष्यते । देवान्तक ! त्वया त्यक्तो रिपोर्यास्यामि वश्यताम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘Indra's delight will occur (ensue) and Lanka will be devastated; the gods will arrive here and I shall get into the servitude of the enemy.

data.v: मरिष्यामि विजेष्ये वा हताश्चेत्तनया मम । हनिष्यामि रिपूंस्तूर्णं न जीविष्यामि दुःखितः ॥
data.et: ‘If my sons are killed, I shall die or vanquish ; I shall quickly kill the enemies ; (but) grieved, I shall not live.

data.v: स्मेष्यन्ते मुनयो देवाः कथयिष्यन्ति चाऽनिशम् । "दश-ग्रीवस्य दुर्-नीतेर्विनष्टं रक्षसां कुलम्।" ॥
data.et: The sages will smile and the gods will declare, day night, ‘The race of demons perished on account of the evil policies of Ravana.

data.v: केन सम्भावितं तातकुम्भकर्णस्य राघवः । रणे कर्त्स्यति गात्राणि मर्माणि च वितर्त्स्यति ॥
data.et: By whom was it foreseen, Oh father, that Rama would sever the limbs and hurt the vitals of Kumbhakarna in battle ;

data.v: पतिष्यति क्षितौ भानुः पृथिवी तोलयिष्यते। । नभस्वान्भङ्क्ष्यते व्योम मुष्टिभिस्ताडयिष्यते ॥
data.et: that the sun will tumble down on the earth ; the earth will be hurled up; the wind will be shattered; the sky will be beaten up with fist-blows;

data.v: इन्द्रोः स्यन्दिष्यते वह्निः समुच्चोक्ष्यति सागरः । जलं धक्ष्यति तिग्मांशोः स्यन्त्यन्ति तमसां चयाः ॥
data.et: —"that fire will ooze out of the moon; the ocean will dry up; water will burn; a mass of darkness will flow from the sun;

data.v: कुम्भकर्णो रणे पुंसा क्रुद्धः परिभविष्यते । संभावितानि नैतानि कदाचित्केनचिज्जने ॥
data.et: -that the enraged Kumbhakarna will be overpowered in battle by a human male. These were never thought possible by anyone among the people.

data.v: कुम्भकर्णे हते लङ्का- मारोक्ष्यन्ति प्लवङ्गमाः । दङ्क्ष्यन्ति राक्षसान्दृप्ता भङ्क्ष्यन्ति च ममा ऽऽश्रमान् ॥
data.et: ‘Kumbhakarna being killed, the arrogant monkeys will invade Lanka, bite the demons and pull down (my) resorts.

data.v: चर्त्स्यन्ति बाल-वृद्धांश्च नर्त्स्यन्ति च मुदा युताः । तेन राक्षस-मुख्येन विना तान्को निरोत्स्यति ॥
data.et: And (they will) kill the children and old men and will dance, full of joy; who without that chief of demons, will restrain them ?

data.v: अमर्षो मे परः सीतां राघवः कामयिष्यते । च्युत-राज्यात्सुखं तस्मात्किं किला ऽसाववाप्स्यति ॥
data.et: My greatest anger (is that), Rama will make love to Sita ; what pleasure, indeed, will she derive from him who has lost his kingdom ?

data.v: मारयिष्यामि वैदेहीं खादयिश्यामि राक्षसैः । भूमौ वा निखनिष्यामि विध्वंसस्या ऽस्य कारणम् ॥
data.et: I shall kill the Videha Princess (and) have her devoured by the demons; or I shall ditch the cause of this devastation down into the ground.

data.v: ना ऽनुरोत्स्ये जगल्-लक्ष्मीं घटिष्ये जीवितुं न वा । न रंस्ये विषयैः शून्ये भवने बान्धवैरहम् ॥
data.et: I shall not covet the riches of the world, nor shall I strive to live, nor shall I feel happy with sensuous objects in this palace which is devoid of kinsmen.

data.v: मोदिष्ये कस्य सौख्ये ऽहं को मे मोदिष्यते सुखे ।आदेयाः किंकृते भोगाः कुम्भकऋण ! त्वया विना ॥
data.et: Without you, Oh Kumbhakarna, in whose happiness shall I rejoice ? Who will exult in my happiness ? For what purpose should pleasures be acquired ?

data.v: याः सुहृत्सु विपन्नेषु मामुपैष्यन्ति संपदः । ताः किं मन्यु-क्षताऽऽभोगा न विपत्सु विपत्तयः ॥
data.et: Is it not that, with their dimensions pruned by grief, the riches that will come to mewhile my (well-wishingfriends are dead, will be disastrous among calamities !

data.v: "विनङ्क्ष्यति पुरी क्षिप्रं तूर्णमेष्यन्ति वानराः ।अ-सन्धित्सोस्तवे"त्येतद्विभीषण-सुभाषितम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘This was well said by Vibhisapa, The monkeys will soon arrive(this) capital of yours, who are not desirous of peace, will perish ?'

data.v: "अर्थेन संभृता राज्ञा न भाषिष्यामहे वयम् । संयोत्स्यामह"इत्येतत्प्रहस्तेन च भाषितम् ॥
data.et: And this was said by Prahasta : 'Well nourished with money by the king, we shall not speak, (but) shall fight.

data.v: मानुषो नाम पत्काषी राजानं पुरुषाऽशिनाम् । योधयिष्यति संग्रामे दिव्याऽस्त्र-रथ-दुर्जयम् ॥
data.et: Indeed, a human male, treading on feet, will force the King of the cannibals, invincible on account of his divine missiles and chariot, to fight in battle !

data.v: सन्नत्स्याम्यथवा योद्धुं न कोष्ये सत्त्व-हीन-वत् ।अद्य तप्र्स्यन्ति मांसाऽदा भूः पास्यत्यरि-शोणितम् ॥
data.et: Or I shall brace up for fighting (and) not bewait like a dis-spirited (person). Today the carnivorous animals will be gratified, the earth will drink blood.

data.v: आकर्क्ष्यामि यशः शत्रूनपनेष्यामि कर्मणा ।अनुभाविष्यते शोको मैथिल्या ऽद्य पति-क्षयात् ॥
data.et: ‘‘I shall wrench fame, repel the enemies with my activity. Toady Sita will be made to experience grief on account of the destruction of (her) husband.

data.v: मन्तूयिष्यति यक्षेन्द्रो वल्गूयिष्यति नो यमः । ग्लास्यन्त्य-पति-पुत्राश्च वने वानर-योषितः ॥
data.et: The lord of the Yaksas will be depressed; Yama will not rejoice; and the young wives of the monkeys will despond devoid of husbands and sons.

data.v: सुखं स्वप्स्यन्ति रक्षांसि भ्रमिष्यन्ति च निर्भयम् । न विक्रोक्ष्यन्ति राक्षस्यो नरांश्चा ऽत्स्यन्ति हर्षिताः ॥
data.et: The demons will sleep happily and move about fear lessly; the demonesses will not weep and be exalted that they will eat men.

data.v: प्राङ्मुहूर्तात्प्रभातेऽहं भविष्यामि ध्रुवं सुखी ।आगामिनि ततः काले यो द्वितीयः क्षणोऽपरः ॥
data.et: Before the (close of the first) mudurta in the morning. I shall definitely be happy (by killing Rama). Then during what (will be the next second moment (muhurta) in the time to come.

data.v: तत्र जेतुं गमिष्यामि त्रिदशेन्द्रं सहाऽमरम् । ततः परेण भूयो ऽपि लङ्कामेष्याम्यमत्सरः" ॥
data.et: —‘therein I shall proceed to vanquish the lord of the gods, along with the gods ; with the next morment (nuhurta) thereafter I shall once again return to Lanka, free of anger.’’

data.v: तमेव-वादिनं मूढमिन्द्र्जित्समुपागतः । "युयुत्सिष्ये ऽहमित्येवं वदन्रिपु-भयंकरः ॥
data.et: To the infatuated one speaking thus, came Indrajit, fearful to the enemy, saying thus, I wish to fight.

data.v: ना ऽभिज्ञा ते महाराज ! जेष्यावः शक्र-पालितम् । दृप्त-देव-गुणाऽऽकीर्ण- मावां सह सुराऽऽलयम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘Oh great King, don't you have the recollection that we two together conquered the abode of the gods protected by Indra and thronged by haughty hosts of gods ?

data.v: ना ऽभिज्ञा ते स-यक्षेन्द्रं भङ्क्ष्यावो यद्यमं बलात् । रत्नानि चा ऽऽहरिष्यावः प्राप्स्यावश्च पुरीमिमाम् ॥
data.et: Don't you have the recollection that we two forcibly broke up Yama, along with the lord of the Yaksas, and snatched away jewels and reached this city ?

data.v: एष पेक्ष्याम्यरीन्भूयो न शोचिष्यसि रावण ! । जगद्द्रक्ष्यसि नी-राममवगाहिष्यसे दिशः ॥
data.et: "Here, I shall crush the enemies; you will never lament again, Oh Ravana ; you will see the world bereft of Rama and pervade the quarters.

data.v: सह-भृत्यः सुराऽऽवासे भयं भूयो विधास्यसि । प्रणंस्यत्यद्य देवेन्द्रस्त्वां वक्ष्यति स सन्नतिम् ॥
data.et: "Along with dependents, you will again instil fear in the residence of the gods. Today the King of the gods will surrender and he will announce his salutation to you.

data.v: भेष्यते मुनिभिस्त्वत्तस्त्वमधिष्ठास्यसि द्विषः । ज्ञास्ये ऽहमद्य संग्रामे समस्तैः शूर-मानिभिः ॥
data.et: “Fright for you will be entertained by the sages ; you will overpower enemies. Today, in the battle, I shall be tested by all those who falsely regard themselves as brave.

data.v: ज्ञायिष्यन्ते मया चा ऽद्य वीरं-मन्या द्विषद्-गणाः । गूहिष्यामि क्षितिं कृत्तै- रद्य गात्रैर्वनाकसाम् ॥
data.et: "And those hosts of enemies, who falsely feel brave will be tested by me, today. I shall cover the earth today with the severed limbs of the forest-dwellers.

data.v: आरोक्ष्यामि युगान्त-वारिद-घटा- संघट्ट-धीर-ध्वनिं निर्यास्यन्रथमच्छ्रित-ध्वज-धनुः- खड्ग-प्रभा-भासुरम्। । श्रोष्यस्यद्य विकीर्ण-वृक्ण-विमुख- व्यापन्न-शत्रौ रणे तृप्तांश्छोणित-शोण-भीषणमुखान्क्रव्याऽशिनः क्रोशतः।" ॥
data.et: “Marching out, I shall mount a chariot which will produce a deep sound like that of the collision of banks of clouds at the end of the aeon and which will be lustrous with the radiance of the upraised flag, bow and sword. Today you shall hear the yelling of carnivorous beings who (will be) satiated on the battered and slain enemies scattered face downwards on the battlefield and whose faces will be red and ferocious with blood. "

data.v: आशासत ततः शान्तिमस्नुरग्नीनहावयन् । विप्रानवाचयन्योधाः प्राक्कुर्वन्मङ्गलानि च ॥
data.et: Then the warriors solicited peace, bathed, offered oblations in the (sacred) fires, made brahmins utter (blessings) and performed auspicious rites.

data.v: अपूजयन्कुल-ज्येष्ठानुपागूहन्त बालकान्। । स्त्रीः समावर्धयन्साऽस्राः कार्याणि प्रादिशंस्तथा ॥
data.et: They honoured the elders of the family, embraced the children, reassured the women who were full of tears, (and) so also instructed (them) about (their) tasks.

data.v: आच्छादयन्व्यलिम्पंश्च प्राश्नन्नथ सुराऽऽमिषम् । प्रापिबन्मधु-माध्वीकं भक्ष्यांश्चा ऽऽदन्यथेप्सितान् ॥
data.et: They dressed, anointed (themselves), consumed wine with meat, drank the madhvika wine to their content and ate food as (they) desired.

data.v: न्यश्यन्शस्त्राण्यभीष्टानि समनह्यंश्च वर्मभिः ।अध्यासत सु-यागानि द्विषद्भ्यश्चा ऽशपंस्तथा ॥
data.et: They sharpened their favourite weapons and braced themselves with coats of mail, mounted good vehicles and cursed (their) enemies.

data.v: अपूजयंश्चतुर्-वक्त्रं विप्रानार्चंस्तथा ऽस्तुवन् । समालिपत शक्राऽरिर्यानं चा ऽभ्यलषद्वरम् ॥
data.et: They worshipped the four-faced (Brahma), honoured the brahmins and also praised (one another). Indrajit smeared (himself) and desired an excellent chariot.

data.v: आमुञ्चद्वर्म रत्नाऽऽढ्यमबध्नात्खड्गमुज्ज्ल्वलम् ।अध्यास्त स्यन्दनं घोरं प्रावर्तत ततः पुरः ॥
data.et: He donned an armour rich with jewels, tied a blazing sword, mounted a terrific chariot and then marched forth.

data.v: आघ्नन्भेरीर्महा-स्वानाः कम्बूंश्चा ऽप्यधमन्शुभान् ।अताडयन्मृदङ्गांश्च पेराश्चा ऽपूरयन्कलाः ॥
data.et: They beat loud-sounding drums , so also blew auspicious conchs, mydangas and blew sweet peras.

data.v: अस्तुवन्बन्दिनः शब्दानन्योन्यं चोदभावयन् ।अनदन्सिंहनादांश्च प्राद्रेकत हय-द्विपम् ॥
data.et: The bards sang praises ; (the warriors) gave out calls to one another and roared like lions.

data.v: अ-निमित्तान्यथा ऽपश्यन्नस्फुटद्रवि-मण्डलम् ।औक्षन्शोणितमम्भोदा वायवोऽवान्सु-दुःसहाः ॥
data.et: Now they saw evil omens ; the sun's orb burst; the clouds showered blood (and) extremely unbearable hurricanes blew.

data.v: आर्च्छन्वामं मृगाः कृष्णाः शस्त्राणां व्यस्मरन्भटाः । रक्तं न्यष्ठीवदक्लाम्य- दखिद्यद्वाजि-कुञ्जरम् ॥
data.et: Black antelopes passed by the left; warriors forgot (their) weapons ; the troop of horses and elephants vomitted blood, got exhusted and depressed.

data.v: न तानगणयन्सर्वानास्कन्दंश्च रिपून्द्विषः ।अच्छिन्दन्नसिभिस्तीक्ष्णैरभिन्दंस्तोमरैस्तथा ॥
data.et: The enemies disregarded all of them and attacked their enemies, cut (them) with sharp swords, so also pierced (them) with javelins.

data.v: न्यकृन्तंश्चक्र-धाराभिरतुदन्शक्तिभिर्दृढम् । भल्लैरविध्यन्नुग्राऽग्रैरतृंहंस्तोमरैरलम् ॥
data.et: They severed with the sharp edges of discs, injured firmly (deeply) with missiles, wounded with sharp-tipped spears (and) battered amply with javelins.

data.v: आस्यन्प्लवङ्गमा वृक्षानधुन्वन्भू-धरैर्भृशम् ।अहिंसन्मुष्टिभिः क्रोघाददशन्दशनैरपि ॥
data.et: The monkeys hurled trees, killed excessively with mountains, struck with fists and bit in anger with teeth too .

data.v: प्रादुन्वन्जानुभिस्तूर्णमतुदंस्तल-कूर्परैः । प्राहिण्वन्नरि-मुक्तानि शस्त्राणि विविधानि च ॥
data.et: They speedily tortured with knees, mauled with palms and elbows and tossed back the various weapons discharged by the enemies .

data.v: अतृणेट्शक्र-जिच्छत्रूनभ्राम्यच्च समन्ततः ।अध्वनच्च महा-घोरं न च कंचन नाऽदुनोत् ॥
data.et: Indrajit killed his enemies and stalked all around; and he thundered most frighteningly, not that he did not frighten one and all.

data.v: नाऽजानन्सन्दधानं तं धनुर्नैक्षन्त बिभ्रतम् । नेषूनचेतन्नस्यन्तं हतास्तेना ऽविदुर्द्विषः ॥
data.et: They did not see him fixing the arrow (to the bow), did not perceive him wielding the bow, did not notice him. discharging the arrow ; the enemies struck by him realised (only his valour).

data.v: अशृण्वन्नन्यतः शब्दं प्रपलायन्त चा ऽन्यतः ।आक्रन्दमन्यतोऽकुर्वंस्तेना ऽहन्यन्त चाऽन्यतः ॥
data.et: They heard the sound from one place and quickly fled elsewhere; (they) gave out a yell from another place and by him they were killed from elsewhere.

data.v: प्रालोठन्त व्यभिद्यन्त परितो रक्तमस्रवन् । पर्यश्राम्यन्नतृप्यंश्च क्षतास्तेना ऽम्रियन्त च ॥
data.et: Hit by him, they rolled, got separated (or severely injured), oozed blood all around, got exhausted and thirsty, and died.

data.v: सौमित्रिराकुलस्तस्मिन्ब्रह्माऽस्त्रं सर्व-रक्षसाम् । निधनाया ऽऽजुहूषत्तं व्य्ष्टभ्नाद्रघु-नन्दनः ॥
data.et: Distressed at him, the son of Sumitra (Laksmana) wished to invoke the missile of Brahma for the massacre of all demons; Rama restrained him.

data.v: ततो माया-मयीं सीतां घ्नन्खड्गेन वियद्-गतः ।अदृश्यतेन्द्रजिद्वाक्यमवदत्तं मरुत्-सुतः ॥
data.et: Then Indrajit was seen rising up in the sky and killing a phantom of Sita with a sword; the Son of the Wind addressed him (these) words :

data.v: "मा ऽपराध्नोदियं किंचिदभ्रश्यत्पत्युरन्तिकात् । सीतां राक्षस ! मा स्मैनां निगृह्णाः पाप ! दुःखिताम्" ॥
data.et: This one, Oh demon, has committed no crime; she stayed away from the vicinity of her husband. Oh sinner, do not kill her who is grieved.’’

data.v: "पीडा-करम-मित्राणां कर्तव्यमिति शक्रजित् ।अब्रवीत्खड्ग-कृष्टश्च तस्या मूर्धानमच्छिनत् ॥
data.et: Whatever is troublesome to the enemies has to be done, " thus spoke Indrajit, and, having drawn his sword, severed her head .

data.v: "यत्-कृते ऽरीन्व्यगृह्णीम समुद्रमतराम च । सा हते"ति वदन्राममुपातिष्ठन्मरुत्-सुतः ॥
data.et: ‘‘She for whom we fought the enemies and crossed the ocean is slain. So saying Maruti went to Rama .

data.v: ततः प्रामुह्यतां वीरौ राघवावरुतां तथा ।उष्णं च प्राणतां दीर्घमुच्चैर्व्याक्रोशतां तथा ॥
data.et: Then the brave Raghu Princes fainted and lamented and heaved long hot sighs and called out loudly.

data.v: तावभाषत पौलस्त्यो "मा स्म प्ररुदितं युवाम् । ध्रुवं स मोहयित्वाऽस्मान्पापोऽगच्छन्निकुम्भिलाम् ॥
data.et: The Son of Pulastya (Vibhisana) told them, ‘‘You two do not weep. Definitely, that sinner, having beguiled us, has gone to Nikumbhila.

data.v: मा स्म तिष्ठत तत्र-स्थो वध्यो ऽस्माव-हुताऽनलः ।अस्त्रे ब्रह्म-शिरस्युग्रे स्यन्दने चा ऽनुपार्जिते ॥
data.et: Do not wait; he ought to be killed (while he) is staying there and has not sacrificed into the Fire, and while the terrific Brahmasiras missile and chariot have not been secured (by him).

data.v: ब्रह्मा ऽदधाद्वधं तस्य तस्मिन्कर्मण्यसंस्थिते" । प्रायच्छदाज्ञां सौमित्रेर्युथपानां च राघवः ॥
data.et: Brahma decreed his slaying while that ritual is incomplete.” Rama gave the command to Sumitra's son and the troop-leaders.

data.v: तां प्रत्यैच्छन्सु-संप्रितास्ततस्ते स-विभीषणाः । निकुम्भिलां समभ्यायन्न्यरुध्यन्त च राक्षसैः ॥
data.et: Then, highly pleased, they accepted it, proceeded to Nikumbhila along with Vibhisapa (but) were prevented by the demons (who were).

data.v: दिक्-पालैः कदनं तत्र सेने प्राकुरुतां महत् ।ऐतां रक्षांसि निर्जित्य द्रुतं पौलस्त्य-लक्ष्मणौ ॥
data.et: –the protectors of the quarters. There, both the armies fought a terrible battle. Having subdued the demons, Laksmana and Vibhisana quickly went (ahead).

data.v: तत्रेन्द्रजितमैक्षेतां कृत-धिष्ण्यं समाहितम्। । सो ऽजुहोत्कृष्णवर्त्मानमामनन्मन्त्रमुत्तमम् ॥
data.et: There they saw seated in concentration, Indrajit who had arranged the altars ; repeatedly reciting the most powerful incantation, he sacrificed into the Fire.

data.v: अध्यायच्छक्रजिद्ब्रह्म समाधेरचलन्न च। । तमाह्वयत सौमित्रिरगर्जच्च भयंकरम् ॥
data.et: Indrajit meditated upon Brahman (the Eternal Soul) and did not stir from concentration. Laksmapa challenged him and roared fearfully.

data.v: अकुप्यदिन्द्रजित्तत्र पितृव्यं चाऽगदद्वचः । "त्वमत्रा ऽजायथा देह इहा ऽपुष्यत्सुराऽमिषैः ॥
data.et: At that, Indrajit got wild and said (these) words to his (paternal) uncle : ‘‘You took birth here and (your) body got fat here on wine and flesh.

data.v: इहा ऽजीव इहैव त्वं क्रूरमारभथाः कथम् । नाऽपश्यः पाणिमार्द्रं त्वं बन्धु-त्वं नाऽप्यपैक्षथाः ॥
data.et: Here only you lived; how did you undertake (this)

data.v: अ-धर्मान्ना ऽत्रसः पाप ! लोक-वादान्न चा ऽबिभेः । धर्म-दुषण ! नूनं त्वं ना ऽजाना ना ऽशृणोरिदम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘Oh sinner, you did not fear irreligiosity and you were not afraid of public censure. Oh violator of duty, indeed, you have neither known nor heard this.

data.v: निराकृत्य यथा बन्धून्लघु-त्वं यात्य-संशयम्।" । पितृव्येण ततो वाक्यमभ्यधीयत शक्रजित् ॥
data.et: —as to how one having repudiated his kinsmen, doubtlessly gets debased." Then Indrajit was addressed (these) words by his uncle :

data.v: "मिथ्या मा स्म व्यतिक्रामो मच्छीलं मा न बध्यथाह् । सत्यं समभवं वंशे पापानां रक्षसामहम् ॥
data.et: Do not overstep falsely; not that you do not know my character. True, I took birth in the race of sinful demons.

data.v: न त्वजायत मे शीलं तादृक्यादृक्पितुस्तव। । क्षयाऽऽवहेषु दोषेषु वार्यमाणो मया ऽरमत् ॥
data.et: My character, however, did not become like that of your father. Though being dissuaded by me, he revelled in vices wrought with ruin.

data.v: दश-ग्रीवं ऽहमेतस्मादत्यजं न तु विद्विषन्। । पर-स्वान्यार्जयन्नारीरन्यदीयाः परामृशत् ॥
data.et: “On this account did I leave Ravana, but not feeling inimical. He got the riches of others looted and touched the wives of others.

data.v: व्यजिघृक्षत्सुरान्नित्यं प्रामाद्यद्गुणिनां हिते ।आशङ्कत सुहृद्-बन्धून-वृद्धान्बह्वमन्यत ॥
data.et: ‘‘He always wished to fight the gods, erred in (following the beneficial (advice) of the virtuous, suspected friends and kinsmen (and) highly respected the immature.

data.v: दोषैररमतैभिस्ते पिता ऽत्यज्यत यैर्मया। । ततो-रुष्यदनर्दच्च द्वि-विंशतिभिरेव च ॥
data.et: Your father revelled in these vices, wherefore he was abandoned by me" Thereby Indrajit got angry and thundered and also with forty-

data.v: शरैरताडयद्बन्धुं पञ्च-विंशतिभिर्नृपम् । रावणिस्तस्य सौमित्रिरमथ्नाच्चतुरो हयान् ॥
data.et: arrows, (that) son of Ravana struck (his) relative (and) with a hundred the King (Laksmana). Laksmana killed his four horses (of the chariot).

data.v: सागरथिं चा ऽलुनाद्बाणैरभनक्स्यन्दनं तथा । सौमित्रिमकिरद्बाणैः परितो रावणिस्ततः ॥
data.et: And (his) charioteer, (he) cut down with arrows, so also shattered his chariot. Then the Son of Ravana enveloped the Son of Sumitra all around with arrows.

data.v: तावस्फावयतां शाक्तिं बाणांश्चाऽकिरतां मुहुः। । वारुणं लक्ष्मणोऽक्षिप्यदक्षिपद्रौद्रमिन्द्रजित् ॥
data.et: The two enhanced their strength and repeatedly discharged arrows. Laksmana discharged Varuna's missile and Indrajit hurled Rudra’s.

data.v: ते परस्परमासाद्य शस्त्रे नाशमगच्छताम् ।आसुरं राक्षसः शस्त्रं ततो घोरं व्यसर्जयत् ॥
data.et: The two missiles, having contacted each other

data.v: तस्मान्निरपतद्भूरि शिला-शूलेष्टि-मुद्गरम्। । माहेश्वरेण सौमित्रिरस्तभ्नात्तत्सुदुर्जयम् ॥
data.et: Therefrom fell down copious boulders, spikes, swords and mallets. The son of Sumitra halted that highly invincible (missile) with (the missile) of Mahesvara.

data.v: ततो रौद्र-समायुक्तं माहेन्द्रं लक्ष्मणोऽस्मरत् । तेनाऽऽगम्यत घोरेण शिरश्चा ऽह्रियत द्विषः ॥
data.et: Then Laksmana remembered the Mahendra missile in conjunction with the Raudra. That terrific missile shot forth and the enemy's head was shorn off.

data.v: अतुष्यन्नमराः सर्वे प्राहृष्यन्कपि-यूथपाः । पर्यष्वजत सौमित्रिं मूर्ध्न्यजिघ्रच्च राघवः ॥
data.et: All the gods rejoiced; the chiefs of monkey troops were highly delighted; Rama embraced and smelt Lasmana on the head.

data.v: अरोदीद्राक्षसाऽनीकमरोदन्नृ-भुजां पतिः । मैथिल्यै चा ऽशपद्धन्तुं तां प्राक्रमत चाऽऽतुरः ॥
data.et: The army of the demons wept ; the lord of cannibals wailed and swore at the Mithila Princess, and, distressed, (he) walked up to kill her.

data.v: "अ-युक्तमिदम्" त्यन्ये तमाप्ताः प्रत्यवारयन् । न्यरुन्धंश्चा ऽस्य पन्थानं बन्धुता शुचमारुणत् ॥
data.et: Other well-meaning kinsmen dissuaded him saying, ‘‘This is improper, and blocked his way; the multitude of kinsmen dispelled his grief,

data.v: आस्फायता ऽस्य वीरत्वममर्षश्चा ऽप्यतायत । रावणस्य ततः सैन्यं समस्तमयुयुत्सयत् ॥
data.et: Ravana's valour swelled up and anger expanded; then he made his whole army wish for fighting.

data.v: अग्नीनवरिवस्यंश्च ते ऽनमस्यंश्च शङ्करम् । द्विजानप्रीणयन्शान्त्यै यातुधाना भवद्-भियः ॥
data.et: Those demons in whom fear was being born, attended (respectfully) to the Fire and bowed to Sankara, and pleased the brahmins for pacification (of evil).

data.v: परितः पर्यवाद्वायुराज्य-गन्धिर्मनो-रमः ।अश्रूयत स पुण्याहः स्वस्ति-घोषः समुच्चरन् ॥
data.et: All around blew a breeze smelling ghee and delightful to the mind; the rising recital of "Be it well (syasti)” along with May the day be auspicious" was heard.

data.v: योद्धारो ऽबिभरुः शान्त्यै साऽक्षतं वारि मूर्धभिः । रत्नानि चा ऽददुर्गाश्च समवाञ्छन्नथाऽऽशिषः ॥
data.et: For pacification (of evil), the warriors carried, on their heads, water with unbroken (rice grains) ; they gave away jewels and cattle, and then ardently wished for blessings.

data.v: अदिहंश्चन्दनैः शुभ्रैर्विचित्रं समवस्त्रयन् ।अधारयन्स्रजः कान्ता वर्म चा ऽन्ये ऽदधुर्द्रुतम् ॥
data.et: They smeared themselves with white sandal (paste), donned multicoloured dresses, put on charming garlands and quickly put on armour.

data.v: समक्ष्णुवत शस्त्राणि प्रामृजन्खड्ग-संहतीः । गजाऽऽदीनि समारोहन्प्रातिष्ठन्ता ऽऽथ सत्वराः ॥
data.et: (They) sharpened the weapons, polished the bulk of swords, mounted elephants and other (mounts) and set out in baste.

data.v: अपूरयन्नभः शब्दो बल-संवर्त-संभवः ।अपूर्यन्त च दिग्-भागास्तुमुलैस्तूर्य-निस्वनैः ॥
data.et: The din arising from the bustle of the forces filled the firmanent and the space of the quarters was pervaded by the tumultous peals of trumpets.

data.v: आसीद्द्वारेषु संघट्टो रथाऽश्व-द्विपरक्षसाम् । समहान-निमित्तैश्च समभूयत भीषणैः ॥
data.et: There was , at the gates , a very great upsurage of chariots, horses, elephants and demons: and dreadful evil omens occurred.

data.v: कपयो ऽबिभयुस्तस्मिन्नभञ्जंश्च महा-द्रुमान् । प्रोदखायन्गिरींस्तूर्णमगृह्णंश्च महा-शिलाः ॥
data.et: At that, the monkeys got frightened, and tore off big trees, hurriedly dug up mountains and picked up huge boulders.

data.v: ततः समभवद्युद्धं प्राहरन्कपि-राक्षसाः ।अन्योन्येना ऽभ्यभूयन्त विमर्दमसहन्त च ॥
data.et: Then ensued a battle; monkeys and demons struck (each other) ; they were overpowered by one another and with stood (each other's) strokes.

data.v: प्रावर्धत रजो भौमं तद्व्याश्नुत दिशो दश । पराऽऽत्मीय-विवेकं च प्रामुष्णात्कपि-रक्षसाम् ॥
data.et: Dust from the ground rose up higher and higher ; it pervaded the ten quarters and robbed the monkeys and the demons of the discrimination between one's own and the enemy's (soldiers).

data.v: ततो ऽद्विषुर्निरालोके स्वेभ्यो ऽन्येभ्यश्च राक्षसाः। ।अद्विषन्वानराश्चैव वानरेभ्यो ऽपि निर्दयाः ॥
data.et: Then, in the absence of light, the demons got wild with their own and other's (soldiers). And the merciless monkeys got inimical with the monkeys too.

data.v: अघुरंस्ते महा-घोरमश्च्योतन्नथ शोणितम् । समपद्यत रक्तेन समन्तात्तेन कर्दमः ॥
data.et: They thundered very dreadfully; then blood oozed out ; on account of that blood slush got formed all around.

data.v: गम्भीराः प्रावहन्नद्यः समजायन्त च ह्रदाः । वृद्धं च तद्रजो ऽशाम्यत्समवेद्यन्त च द्विषः ॥
data.et: Deep rivers flowed forth and deep lakes were created; and that swollen dust settled down and the enemies were recognised all around.

data.v: ततो ऽचित्रीयता ऽस्त्रौघैर्धनुश्चा ऽधूनयन्महत् । रामः समीहितं तस्य नाऽचेतन्स्वे न चा ऽपरे ॥
data.et: Then Rama worked wonders with streams of missiles and waved (his) huge bow; neither his own (followers) nor those of the enemy understood his intention.

data.v: छिन्नानैक्षन्त भिन्नांश्च समन्ताद्राम-सायुकैः। । क्रुष्टं हाहेति चा ऽशृण्वन्न च रामं न्यरूपयन् ॥
data.et: They did not see (the demons) injured and battered all around by Rama's arrows ; and they heard (their) cry Ah ! Alas !' (but) did not perceive Rama.

data.v: अभिनच्छत्रु-संघातानक्षुणद्वाजि-कुञ्जरम् ।अपिनट्च रथाऽनीकं न चा ऽज्ञायत संचरन् ॥
data.et: He smashed crowds of enemies, pulverised elephants and horses, and pounded the chariot array , (but) was not apprehended raging around,

data.v: दश दन्ति-सहस्राणि रथिनां च महाऽऽत्मनाम् । चतुर्दश सहस्राणि साऽऽरोहाणां च वाजिनाम् ॥
data.et: Ten thousands of elephants, fourteen thousands of magnanimous chariot-warriors and of horses along with their riders.

data.v: लक्षे च द्वे पदातीनां राघवेण धनुर्-भृता ।अनीयन्ताष्टमे भागे दिवसस्य परिक्षयम् ॥
data.et: —and two lacs of foot-soldiers were led to destruction by the bow-bearing Rama, in (just) one-eighth of the day.

data.v: यम-लोकमिवाऽग्रथ्नाद्रुद्राऽऽक्रीडमिवा ऽकरोत् । शैलैरिवा ऽचिनोद्भूमिं बृहद्भी राक्षसैर्हतैः ॥
data.et: With the multitude of demons killed, he wove up, as it were(a sort of) Yama's world, prepared a play-ground, as it were, for Rudra (a cerematorium), and heaped up the earth as though with boulders.
