data.v: अस्तुवन्देव-गन्धर्वा व्यस्मयन्त प्लवङ्गमाः । कपीन्द्रेऽतन्यत प्रीतिः पौलस्त्योऽमन्यताऽद्भुतम् ॥
data.et: The gods and the gandharvas eulogised (him) ; the monkeys were surprised; delight was spread in the Lord of the monkeys (Sugriva), and Vibhisapa regarded (it as) marvellous.

data.v: राक्षस्यः प्रारुदन्नुच्चैः प्राजुगुप्सन्त रावणम्। ।अमुह्यद्बाल-वृद्धं च समरौदितरो जनः ॥
data.et: The demonesses wept bitterly and loudly (and) despised Ravana. The old people and children fainted and other people wailed intensely,

data.v: सर्वतश्चाऽभयं प्राप्नोन्नैच्छन्नृभ्यस्तु रावणः । फलं तस्येदमभ्यायाद्दुरुक्तस्येति चा ऽब्रुवन् ॥
data.et: And they spoke thus, "Ravana secured safety from all, but did not solicit (i) from human beings; here came the fruit of that mistaken utterance.'

data.v: ततो ऽधावन्महा-घोरं रथमास्थाय रावणः ।अक्ष्मायत मही गृध्राः समारार्यन्त भीषणाः ॥
data.et: Thereafter, having mounted a very terrific chariot Ravana rushed out ; the earth quaked ; dreadful vultures frequented all around.

data.v: मेघाः स-विद्युतो ऽवर्षंश्चेल-क्नोपं च शोणितम् ।अवान्भीमा नभस्वन्तः प्रारुवन्न-शिवाः शिवाः ॥
data.et: And clouds accompanied by lightning showered blood, enough to wet clothes; terrific storms blewinauspicious jackals howled.

data.v: आटाट्यता ऽवमत्या ऽसौ दुर्निमित्तानि संयुगे ।अधुनोद्धनुरस्त्रौघैः प्रौर्णोनूयत विद्विषः ॥
data.et: Having disregarded those evil omens, he stalked about incessantly in the battle, waved (his) bow and ceaselessly covered his enemies with streams of missiles.

data.v: व्यनाशयंस्ततः शत्रून्सुग्रीवाऽस्ता महीभृतः । ततो व्यरसदग्लायदध्य्शेत मही-तलम् ॥
data.et: Thereafter, the boulder hurled by Sugriva destroyed the enemies; then (the army) yelled, felt weary and lay down on the surface of the ground;

data.v: आश्च्योतद्रुधिरं तोयमलसच्चाऽति विह्वलम् ।अशीयत नृ-मांसाऽदां बलं सुग्रीव-बाधितम् ॥
data.et: -the army of the cannibals, harassed by Sugriva and in extreme agony, oozed out blood and pined for water and slept (in death) .

data.v: विरूपाक्षस्ततो क्रीडत्संग्रामे मत्त-हस्तिना । मुष्टिनाऽदालयत्तस्य मूर्धानं वानराऽधिपः ॥
data.et: Then Virupaksa disported in the battle on a rutting elephant. The Lord of the monkeys pounded his head with a fist-blow.

data.v: अचूर्णयच्च यूपाक्षं शिलया तदनन्तरम्। । संक्रुद्धो मुष्टिनाऽतुभ्नादङ्गदोऽलं महोदरम् ॥
data.et: And thereafter (he) crushed Yupaksa with a rock. The highly enraged Aigada completely finished Mahodara with a fist-blow.

data.v: ततो ऽकुष्णाद्दशग्रीवः क्रुद्धः प्राणान्वनौकसाम् ।अगोपायच्च रक्षांसि दिशश्चा ऽरीनभाजयत् ॥
data.et: Then the angry Ravana pulled out the life-breaths of the forest-dwellers; he protected the demons and had the enemies resort to the quarters.

data.v: आलोकयत्स काकुत्स्थमधृष्णोद्घोरमध्वनत् । धनुरभ्रमयद्भीममभीषयत विद्विषः ॥
data.et: He beheld Rama, braced up, shouted fiercely, whirled (his) terrific bow and frightened the dire enemies.

data.v: आस्कन्दल्लक्ष्मणं बानैरत्यक्रामच्च तं द्रुतम् । राममभ्यद्रवज्जिष्णुरस्कुनाच्चेषु-वृष्टिभिः ॥
data.et: Accustomed to victory, he harassed Laksmana with his arrows and hurriedly went past him, accosted Rama and enveloped (him) with showers of arrows.

data.v: अपौहद्बाण-वर्षं तद्भल्लै रामो निराकुलः । प्रत्यस्कुनोद्दष-ग्रीवं शरैराशी-विषोपमैः ॥
data.et: Unperturbed, Rama dispelled that shower of arrows with spears (and) in return enveloped Ravana with arrows comparable to serpents.

data.v: मण्डलान्याटतां चित्रमच्छित्तां शस्त्र-संहतीः । जगद्विस्मापयेतां तौ न च वीरावसीदताम् ॥
data.et: The two whirled marvellously in circles and cut the volleys of weapons ; those (two) warriors dismayed the world and did not get exhausted.

data.v: व्योम प्राचिनुतां बाणैः क्ष्मामक्ष्मापयतां गतैः ।अभित्तां तूर्णमन्योन्यं शिक्षाश्चा ऽतनुतां मुहुः ॥
data.et: (The two) covered the sky with arrows, made the earth tremble by (their) movements , injured each other speedily and repeatedly spread out (exhibited) (their) instruction (in fighting).

data.v: समाधत्ता ऽऽसुरं शस्त्रं राक्षसः क्रूर-विक्रमः । तदक्षरन्महासर्पान्व्याघ्र-सिंहांश्च भीषणान् ॥
data.et: The demon of cruel valour aimed the Asura missile; it emitted huge serpents and fierce tigers and lions.

data.v: न्यषेधत्पावकाऽस्त्रेण रामस्तद्राक्षसस्ततः ।अदीव्यद्रौद्रमत्युग्रं मुसलाऽऽद्यगलत्ततः ॥
data.et: Rama despelled it with the Fire missile ; then the demon deployed the extremely terrific Raudra missile ; therefrom fell down maces and other weapons.

data.v: गान्धर्वेण न्यविद्यत्तत्क्षितीन्द्रो ऽथ नराऽशनः । सर्व-मर्मसु काकुत्स्थ- मौम्भत्तीक्ष्णैः शिलीमुखैः ॥
data.et: The King counter-struck it with the Gandharva missile. Then the cannibals overspread Rama on all his vitals with sharp arrows.

data.v: ततस्त्रिशिरसं तस्य प्रावृश्चल्लक्ष्मणो ध्वजम् ।अमथ्नात्सारथिं चाऽऽशु भूरिभिश्चा ऽतुदच्छरैः ॥
data.et: Thereafter, Laksmana cut off his three-pronged banner and speedily crushed down (his) charioteer and perforated (him) with a multitude of arrows.

data.v: अश्वान्विभीषनो ऽतुभ्नात्स्यन्दनं चाऽक्षिणोद्द्रुतम् । नाऽक्षुभ्नाद्राक्षसो भ्रातुः शक्तिं चोदवृहद्गुरुम् ॥
data.et: Vibhisana killed (his) horses and speedily smashed (his) chariot. The demon was not agitated and lifted up a heavy missile against (his) brother.

data.v: तामापतन्तीं सौमित्रिस्त्रिधाऽकृन्तच्छिलीमुखैः ।अशब्दायन्त पश्यन्तस्ततः क्रुद्धो निशाचरः ॥
data.et: Laksmana split with arrows that oncoming (missile) into three ; the onlookers yelled; thereupon the enraged demon-

data.v: अष्ट-घण्टां महा-शक्तिमुदयच्छन्महत्तराम् । रामाऽनुजं तया ऽविध्यत्स महीं व्यसुराश्रयत् ॥
data.et: --picked up a bigger and mightier missile which had eight bells (and), with it, he struck Rama's younger brother, (at which) he (Laksmana) fell breathless on the ground.

data.v: राघवस्याऽभृशायन्त सायकास्तैरुपद्रुतः । ततस्तूर्णं दशग्रीवो रण-क्ष्मा पर्यशेषयत् ॥
data.et: Rama's arrows gained speed ; battered by them Ravana vacated (left alone) the battlefield in a trice.

data.v: स-स्फुरस्योदकर्षच्च सौमित्रेः शक्तिमग्र-जः ।असिञ्चदोषधीस्ता याः समानीता हनूमता ॥
data.et: And, the elder brother pulled out the missile from Laksmana who had (still a throbbing, (and) sprinkled the (juice of the medicinal herbs that were fetched by Hanuman.

data.v: उदजीवत्सुमित्रा-भूर्भ्राता ऽऽश्लिष्यत तमायतम् । सन्यङ्मूर्धन्युपाशिङ्घ- दपृच्छच्च निरामयम् ॥
data.et: The son of Sumitra revived; the brother embraced him for long, smelt (him) properly on the head and inquired about the removal of his agony.

data.v: ततः प्रोदसहन्सर्वे योद्धुमभ्यद्रवत्परान् ।अकृच्छ्रायत च प्राप्तो रथेना ऽन्येन ऽरावणः ॥
data.et: Then all were enthused to fight. Ravana, who had come in another chariot, assaulted the enemies and proceeded to (inflict) misery.

data.v: "भूमि-ष्ठस्या ऽसमं युद्धं रथ-स्थेने"ति मातलिः ।आहरद्रथमत्युग्रं स-शस्त्रं मघवा ऽऽज्ञया ॥
data.et: The fight of one standing on the ground with another standing in a chariot (is) unequal’ --Hence Matali, at the command of Indra, brought (for Rama) a terrific chariot (equipped) with weapons.

data.v: सो ऽध्यष्ठीयत रामेण शस्त्रं पाशुपतं ततः । निरास्यत दशाऽऽस्यस्तच्छक्राऽस्त्रेणाजयन्नृपः ॥
data.et: It was ascended by Rama. Then Ravana discharged the Pasupata missile ; the King subdued it with Indra's missile.

data.v: ततः शत-महस्रेण रामः प्रौर्णोन्निशाचरम् । बाणानामक्षिणोद्धुर्यान्सारथिं चाऽदुनोद्द्रुतम् ॥
data.et: Thereafter, with a hundred thousand arrows, Rama enveloped the demon ( and ) killed (the horses ) yoked to (Ravana's) chariot and instantly injured the charioteer.

data.v: अदृश्यन्ता ऽनिमित्तानि प्राह्वलत्क्षिति-मण्डलम् । रावणः प्राहिणोच्छूलं शक्तिं चैन्दीं मही-पतिः ॥
data.et: Evil omens were perceived; the sphere of the earth trembled; Ravana hurled a spike and the King hurled Indra's Sakti.

data.v: ताभ्यामन्योन्यमासाद्य समवाप्यत संशमः । लक्षेण पत्रिणां वक्षः क्रुद्धो रामस्य राक्षसः ॥
data.et: Having dashed against each other, extinction was attained by the two (missiles). The enraged demon (covered) Rama's chest with a lac of arrows.

data.v: अस्तृणादधिकं रामस्ततो ऽदेवत सायकैः ।अक्लाम्यद्रावणस्तस्य सूतो रथमनाशयत् ॥
data.et: As he covered (Rama's chest) thus, Rama sported increasingly with (his) arrows, Ravana fainted and (his) charioteer made his chariot disappear.

data.v: राक्षसोऽतर्जयत्सूतं पुनश्चाऽढौकयद्रथम् । निरास्येतामुभौबाणानुभौ धुर्यानविध्यताम् ॥
data.et: The demon scolded the charioteer and got his chariot taken again (back to the battle-field). Both discharged arrows; both wounded the horses (of each other).

data.v: उभावकृन्ततां केतूनाव्यथेतामुभौ न तौ ।अदीप्येतामुभौ धृष्णू प्रायुञ्जातां च नैपुणम् ॥
data.et: Both cut off (each other’s) flags ; both of those were not pained; both the daring ones brightened up and employed (all their) skill.

data.v: उभौ मायां व्यतायेतां वीरौ ना ऽश्राम्यतामुभौ । मण्डलानि विचित्राणि क्षिप्रमाक्रामतामुभौ ॥
data.et: Both spread a phantasmagoria ; both the warriors did not tire; both quickly made various circular movements.

data.v: न चोभावप्यलक्ष्येतां यन्तारावाहतामुभौ । स्यन्दनौ समपृच्येतामुभयोर्दीप्त-वाजिनौ ॥
data.et: And both of them were not seen (i.e., disappeared from view), and both struck the charioteers. The chariots, with resplendent horses, of both of them, contacted each other.

data.v: ततो मायामयान्मूर्ध्नो राक्षसो ऽप्रथयद्रणे । रामेणैकशतं तेषां प्रावृश्च्यत शिलीमुखैः ॥
data.et: Then the demon spread around illusory heads in the battle ; a hundred of them were severed by Rama with arrows.

data.v: समक्षुभ्नन्नुदन्वन्तः प्राकम्पन्त महीभृतः । सन्त्रासमबिभः शक्रुः प्रैंखच्च क्षुभिता क्षितिः ॥
data.et: The seas got agitated; mountains quaked; Indra entertained fear and got excited; the earth stirred.

data.v: ततो मातलिना शस्त्रमस्मर्यत महीपतेः । वधाय रावणस्योग्रं स्वयम्भूर्यदकल्पयत् ॥
data.et: Then by Matali was revived Rama's memory of that terrible missile which Bramha had fashioned for slaying Ravana.

data.v: नभस्वान्यस्य वाजेषु फले तिग्मांशु-पावकौ । गुरुत्वं मेरु-सङ्काशं देहः सूक्ष्मो वियन्मयः ॥
data.et: -which had (god) Wind on its wings, the Sun and the Fire on the blade, whose heaviness was like that of the Meru (mountain) and whose subtle body consisted of the sky.

data.v: राजितं गारुडैः पक्षैर्विश्वेषां घाम तेजसाम् । स्मृतं तद्रावणं भित्त्वा सुघोरं भुव्यशाययत् ॥
data.et: —which glittered with Garuda-like wings and was the repository of universal brilliance ; (when) remembered, that terrific (missile), having split up Ravana, felled him on the ground.

data.v: आबध्नन्कपि-वदनानि संप्रसादं प्राशंसत्सुर-समितिर्नृपं जिता ऽरिम् ।अन्येषां विगत-परिप्लवा दिगन्ताः पौलस्त्योऽजुषत शुचं विपन्न-बन्धुः ॥
data.et: The faces of the monkeys put on great delight; the assembly of gods praised the King who had vanquished the enemy ; to others the ends of the quarters (seemed to) become free of oppression ;Vibhisana , whose brother was dead, entertained grief.

data.v: व्यश्नुते स्म ततः शोको नाभि-सम्बन्ध-सम्भवः । विभीषणमसावुच्चै रोदिति स्म दशाऽऽननम् ॥
data.et: Then the grief that had its origin in couterine relation ship, greatly enveloped Vibhisana. He loudly bewailed Ravana.

data.v: "भूमौ शेते दश-ग्रीवो महार्ह-शयनोचितः । नेक्षते विह्वलं मां च न मे वाचं प्रयच्छति ॥
data.et: Accustomed to a very costly bed, Ravana lies on the ground ; he does not look at my distressed self, nor address a word.

data.v: विपाकोऽयं दश-ग्रीव ! संदृष्टो ऽनागतो मया। । त्वं तेनाऽभिहितः पथ्यं किं कोपं न नियच्छसि ॥
data.et: ‘(When) this consequence had not (yet) come, Oh Ravana, (it) was fully foreseen by me ; on that account, you were told beneficial things; why did you not dispel (your) anger ?

data.v: भजन्ति विपदस्तूर्णमतिक्रामन्ति सम्पदः । तान्मदान्नाऽवतिष्ठन्ते ये मते न्यायवादिनाम् ॥
data.et: Misfortunes soon overtake and riches bypass those who, through vanity, do not abide by the opinion of those that speak out what is just."

data.v: अ-पथ्यमायतौ लोभादामनन्त्यनुजीविनः । प्रियं शृणोति यस्तेभ्यस्तमृच्छन्ति न सम्पदः ॥
data.et: Dependents, through avarice , consent to that which is unwholesome in future. Riches do not accrue to him who listens from them (only) to the agreeable."

data.v: प्राज्ञास्तेजस्विनः सम्यक्पश्यन्ति च वदन्ति च । तेऽवज्ञाता महाराज ! क्लाम्यन्ति विरमन्ति च ॥
data.et: The brilliant and intelligent perceive properly and (then) speak out. (When) disregarded, they, oh great King, get depressed and indifferent.

data.v: लेढि भेषज-वन्नित्यं यः पथ्यानि कटून्यपि । तदर्थं सेवते चा ऽऽप्तान्कदाचिन्न स सीदति ॥
data.et: He who always enjoys (consumes), beneficial (advice), like medicine, though bitter and, for that purpose, resorts to well-wishers, never perishes.

data.v: सर्वस्य जायते मानः स्व-हिताच्च प्रमाद्यति । वृद्धौ भजति चा ऽपथ्यं नरो येन विनश्यति ॥
data.et: ‘In prosperity, everybody breeds pride, commits mistakes regarding ones own welfare and resorts to the unwholesome. On that account a man perishes.

data.v: द्वेष्टि प्रायो गुणेभ्यो यन्न च स्निह्यति कस्यचित् । वैरायते महद्भिश्च शीयते वृद्धिमानपि ॥
data.et: Even a prosperous (person) suffers a downfall if he mostly hates virtues, does not cherish anybody and harbours enmity towards the great

data.v: समाश्वसिमि केना ऽहं कथं प्राणिमि दुर्-गतः । लोक-त्रय-पतिर्भ्राता यस्य मे स्वपिति क्षितौ ॥
data.et: "By whom may be reassured, whose brother, the lord of the three worlds, lies (dead) on the ground ? How may I, ill-fated, live ?

data.v: अहो जागर्ति कृच्छ्रेषु दैवं यद्बल-भिज्जितः । लुठ्यन्ति भूमौ क्लिद्यन्ति बान्धवा मे स्वपन्ति च ॥
data.et: Alas ! Fate wakes up during difficulties; for, the defeaters of Indra, my kinsmen, roll, get drenched and sleep on the ground.

data.v: शिवाः कुष्णन्ति मांसानि भूमिः पिबति शोणितम् । दशग्रीव-सनाभीनां समदन्त्यामिषं खगाः ॥
data.et: Jackals pull out the flesh, the earth sucks the blood (and) birds feast on the meat of the couterine brothers of Ravana.

data.v: येन पूत-क्रतोर्मूर्ध्नि स्थीयते स्म महाऽऽहवे । तस्याऽपीन्द्रजितो दैवाद्ध्वांक्षैः शिरसि लीयते ॥
data.et: ‘Due to Fate, crows are roosting on the head of even that Indrajit by whom, in a great battle, (his) foot was laid on the head of Indra.

data.v: स्वर्भानुर्भास्करं ग्रस्तं निष्टीवति कृताऽह्निकः ।अभ्युपैति पुनर्भूतिं राम-ग्रस्तो न कश्चन ॥
data.et: "Rahu who has finished his daily meal (routine), spits out the swallowed Sun ; (but) none eclipsed by Rama attains prosperity again.

data.v: त्वमजानन्निदं राजन्नीडिषे स्म स्व-विक्रमम् । दातुं नेच्छसि सीतां स्म विषयाणां च नेशिषे ॥
data.et: "Unaware of this, you, Oh King, used to eulogise your own valour, did not desire to give back Sita and did not exercise control on (your) passions.

data.v: मन्त्रे जातु वदन्त्यज्ञास्त्वं तानप्यनुमन्यसे । कथं नाम भवांस्तत्र ना ऽवैति हितमात्मनः ॥
data.et: "Sometime, ignorant persons speak to you in counsel and you approve of them ; how indeed do you not understand your own welfare therein (in those matters) ?

data.v: अ-पृष्टो नु ब्रवीति त्वां मन्त्रे मातामहो हितम् । "न करोमीतिपौलस्त्य ! तदा मोहात्त्वमुक्तवान् ॥
data.et: Indeed, not consulted (by you), your maternal grand father spoke to you, in counsel, about your own welfare ; at that time, On Ravana, through infatuation, you said, I shall not do (that)'.

data.v: त्वं स्म वेत्थ महाराज ! यत्स्माऽऽह न विभीषनः। । पुरा त्यजति यत्क्रुद्दो मां निराकृत्य संसदि ॥
data.et: ‘‘Oh great king, you did not understand what Vibhisapa said; for, (being) enraged, you, having repudiated me in the assembly, dismissed me in days gone by.

data.v: हविर्जक्षिति निःशङ्को मखेषु मधवानसौ । प्रवाति स्वेच्छया वायुरुद्गच्छति च भास्करः ॥
data.et: (Now), that dauntless Indra eats oblations in the sacrifice; the wind blows at its own will and the sun rises (at its will).

data.v: धनानामीशते यक्षा यमो दाम्यति राक्षसान् । तनोति वरुणः पाशमिन्दुनोदीयते ऽधुना ॥
data.et: ‘‘Yaksas exercise control over wealth and Yama restrains the demons; varupa spreads (his) noose and the moon rises (at its will).

data.v: शाम्यत्यृतु-समाहारस्तपस्यन्ति वनौकसः । नो नमस्यन्ति ते बन्धून्वरिवस्यन्ति ना ऽमराः ॥
data.et: 'The concomitance of the seasons ends; the forest dwellers practise penance ; the gods do not salute or wait upon your kinsmen.

data.v: श्रीर्निष्कुष्यति लङ्कायां विरज्यन्ति समृद्धयः । न वेद तन्न यस्याऽस्ति मृते त्वयि विपर्ययः ॥
data.et: The Goddess of wealth is displeased with Laika ; prosperities fade away; I know not anything which does not attain a reverse when you are dead.

data.v: शक्तिं संस्वजते शक्रो गोपायति हरिः श्रियम् । देव-वन्द्यः प्रमोदन्ते चित्रीयन्ते घनोदयाः ॥
data.et: ‘Indra wields (his) Sakti , visnu protects Laksmi, the captive goddesses rejoice and the eminences of the clouds become variegated.

data.v: बिभ्रत्यस्त्राणि साऽमर्षा रण-काम्यन्ति चा ऽमराः । चकासति च मांसाऽदां तथारन्ध्रेषु जाग्रति ॥
data.et: The enraged gods wield weapons and wish for a battle; they blaze and are also wakeful (watchful) about the weak spots of the demons.

data.v: चञ्चूर्यते ऽभितो लङ्कामस्मांश्चा ऽप्यतिशेरते । भूमयन्ति स्व-सामर्थ्यं कीर्तिं नः कनयन्ति च ॥
data.et: "They ride intentionally around Lanka and outdo us; they augment their strength and lessen our reputation

data.v: दिशो व्यष्नुवते दृप्तास्त्वत्-कृतां जहति स्थितिम् । क्षोदयन्ति च नः क्षुद्रा हसन्ति त्वां विपद्-गतम् ॥
data.et: ‘Puffed up with pride, they occupy the quarters, give up the limitations laid down by you ; and (those) mean ones will call us mean and jeer at you who have fallen into disaster.

data.v: शमं शमं नभस्वन्तः पुनन्ति परितो जगत् ।उज्जिहीषे महाराज ! त्वं प्रशान्तो न किं पुनः ॥
data.et: Calming down incessantly, the winds purify the world all around . Why do you, oh great king, (though) dead (calmed) not get revived again ?

data.v: प्रोर्णोति शोकस्चित्तं मे सत्वं संशाम्यतीव मे । प्रमार्ष्टि दुःखमालोकं मुञ्चाम्यूर्जं त्वया विना ॥
data.et: ‘‘Grief envelopes my mind; my spirit, as though, ebbs; affiliction obliterates light ; without you I lose (my) prowess,

data.v: केन संविद्रते-नाऽन्यस्त्वत्तो बान्धव-वत्सलः । विरौमि शून्ये प्रोर्णौमि कथं मन्यु-समुद्भवम् ॥
data.et: Who do not know well that there is none more affectionate to (his) kinsmen, than you ? I lament in void. How may I conceal the uprise of grief ?

data.v: रोदिम्यनाथमात्मानं बन्धुना रहितस्त्वया । प्रमाणं नोपकाराणामवगच्छामि यस्य ते ॥
data.et: I lament my orphaned self, (being) separated from my brother, that you, for whose obligation I know no measure.

data.v: नेदानीं शक्र-यक्षेन्द्रौ बिभीतो न दरिद्रितः । न गर्वं जहितो दृप्तौ न क्लिश्नीतो दशाऽऽनन ! ॥
data.et: Now Indra and Kubera do not fear, nor become poor, nor give up (their) vanity. Oh Ravana, the two arrogant ones do not worry (get distressed)

data.v: त्वया ऽपि नाम रहिताः कार्याणि तनुमो वयम् । कुर्मश्च जीविते बुद्धिं धिक्तृष्णां कृत-नाशिनीम् ॥
data.et: Indeed, separated even from you, we carry on our activity and have the intention to live ; fie upon ungrateful greed.

data.v: तृणेह्मि देहमात्मीयं। त्वं वाचं न ददासि चेत् । द्राघयन्ति हि मे शोकं स्मर्यमाणा गुणास्तव ॥
data.et: If you do not give me a word (speak to me), I shall destroy my body ; for (the reason of their) being remembered, your virtues aggravate my grief.

data.v: उन्मुच्य स्रजमात्मीयां मां स्रजयति को हसन् । नेदयत्यासनं को मे को हि मे वदति प्रियम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘Who, having removed his own garland, will garland me, smiling ? Who will pull my seat closer ; who will speak delightful (words) to me (and when ) ?

data.v: न गच्छामि पुरा लङ्का- मायुर्यावद्दधाम्यहम् । कदा भवति मे प्रीतिस्त्वां पश्यामि न चेदहम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘So long as I sustain my life, I shall not, in future, go to (the city of) Lanka ? When can I have delight if I do not see you ?

data.v: ऊर्ध्वं म्रिये मुहूर्ताद्धि विह्वलः क्षत-बान्धवः । मन्त्रे स्म हितमाख्यामि न करोमि तवा ऽप्रियम् ॥
data.et: In over a muhurta shall I die, I who am afflicted and whose kinsmen are killed. In (my) counsel, I had told (what was) beneficial; I did nothing undesirable to you.”

data.v: अन्तःपुराणि पौलस्त्यं पौराश्च भृश-दुःखिताः । संश्रुत्य स्मा ऽभिधावन्ति हतं रामेण संयुगे ॥
data.et: Having heard (of) Ravana to have been killed by Rama in battle, the ladies of the harem and the excessively grief-sticken citizens ran (to the battle-field).

data.v: मूर्धजान्स्म विलुञ्चन्ति क्रोशन्ति स्मा ऽतिविह्वलम् ।अधीयन्त्युपकाराणां मुहुर्भर्तुः प्रमन्यु च ॥
data.et: (The wives) pulled out (their) hair, wept in extreme distress and incessantly recollected the obligation of (their) husband, with enhanced grief.

data.v: रावणस्य नमन्ति स्म पौराः सास्रा रुदन्ति च।" । भाषते स्म ततो रामो वचः पौलस्त्यमाकुलम् ॥
data.et: The citizens saluted Ravana and wept with tears. Thereafter Rama addressed a speech to the distressed Vibhisana :

data.v: "दातुः स्थातुर्द्विषां मूर्ध्नि यष्टुस्तर्पयितुः पित्न् । युद्धाऽभग्नाऽऽविपन्नस्य किं दशाऽऽस्यस्य शोचसि ॥
data.et: Why do you lament the charitable sacrificer who trampled over the heads of his enemies, who invariably satiated the manes, who was never defeated or distressed in a battle ? (Or who was injured and slain in a fight ?)

data.v: बोभवीति न सम्मोहो व्यसने स्म भवादृशाम् । किं न पश्यसि सर्वो ऽयं जनस्त्वामवलम्बते ॥
data.et: Excessive bewilderment in difficulty never arises in (persons) such as you. Do you not see that all these people depend upon you ?

data.v: त्वमर्हसि भ्रातुरनन्तराणि कर्तुं जनस्या ऽस्य च शोक-भङ्गम् । धुर्ये विपन्ने त्वयि राज्य-भारो मज्जत्यनूढः क्षणदा-चरेन्द्र !" ॥
data.et: ‘‘You deserve to perform the post-death rites of your brother and the dissipation of the grief of these people. Oh Lord of demons, if you, who is the leader, become distraught, the burden of the kingdom, being unsustained, will collapse."

data.v: अप-मन्युस्ततो वाक्यं पौलस्त्यो राममुक्तवान् । "अ-शोच्योऽपि व्रजन्नस्तं सनाभिर्दुनुयान्न किम् ॥
data.et: Thereafter Vibhisana, whose grief had subsided, addressed Rama (these) words : Might a couterine brother, though not worth lamenting, not cause grief, (while) reaching his end ?

data.v: तं नो देवा विधेयासुर्येन रावण-वद्वयम् । सपत्नांश्च ऽधिजीयास्म संग्रामे च मृषीमहि ॥
data.et: May the gods arrange that, for us, by which we, like Ravana, may vanquish enemies and die in battle.

data.v: क्रियेरंश्च दशाऽऽस्येन यथा ऽन्येना ऽपि नः कुले । देवद्यञ्चो नराऽहारा न्यञ्चश्च द्विषतां गणाः ॥
data.et: May someone else in our family, like Ravana, make the demons wage war with the gods and render the hosts of gods lowly.

data.v: स एव घारयेत्प्राणानीदृशे बन्धु-विप्लवे । भवेदाश्वासको यस्य सुहृच्छक्तो भवादृशः ॥
data.et: ‘‘He alone would sustain (his) life-breaths in such a ruin of (his) kinsmen, who has a capable friend like your honour for his comforter.

data.v: म्रियेयोर्ध्वं मुहूर्ताद्धि न स्यास्त्वं यदि मे गतिः ।आशंसा च हि नः प्रेते जीवेम-दशमूर्धनि ॥
data.et: I might die in a mahurla if you were not my resort; for we had no desire that we may live after Ravana has passed away.

data.v: प्रकुर्याम वयं देशे गर्ह्यां तत्र कथं रतिम् । यत्र विंशति-हस्तस्य न सोदर्यस्य सम्भवः।" ॥
data.et: How may we entertain any damned attachment to that country wherein there is no existence of our twenty-armed couterine brother (Ravana) ?"

data.v: आमन्त्रयेत तान्प्रह्वान्मन्त्रिणोऽथ विभीषणः । "गच्छेत त्वरितं लङ्कां राज-वेश्म विशेत च ॥
data.et: Then Vibhisana ordered his submissive ministers: "Quickly go to Lanka and enter the King's palace.

data.v: आददीध्वं महाऽर्हाणि तत्र वासांसि स-त्वराः ।उद्धुनीयात सत्-केतून्निर्हरेताऽग्र्य-चन्दनम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘Therein promptly seize very costly clothings, unfurl huge flags and fetch the best sandalwood.

data.v: मुञ्चेताऽऽकाश-धूपांश्च ग्रथ्नीयात स्रजः शुभाः ।आनयेता ऽमितं दारु कर्पूराऽगुरु-कुङ्कुमम् ॥
data.et: "Fumigate with sky-pervading incense, weave auspi cious garlands, fetch unlimited wood, camphor, sandalwood and saffron.

data.v: उह्येरन्यज्ञ पात्राणि ह्रियेत च विभावसुः । भ्रियेत चाऽऽज्यमृत्विग्भिः कल्प्येत च समित्-कुशम् ॥
data.et: "Let the sacrificial fire-vessels be carried and fire taken along ; let the ghee be collected and faggots and kusa grass be kept ready by the officiating priests.

data.v: स्नानीयैः स्नापयेताऽऽशु रम्यैर्लिम्पेत वर्णकैः ।अलङ्कुर्यात रत्नैश्च रावणाऽर्हैर्दशाऽऽननम् ॥
data.et: ‘Promptly bathe Ravana with bathing materials, smear (him) with attractive unguents and embellish him with jewels worthy of Ravana.

data.v: वासयेत सु-वासोभ्यां मेध्याभ्यां राक्षसाऽऽधिपम् । ऋत्विक्स्रग्विणमादध्यात्प्राङ्-मूर्धानं मृगाऽजिने ॥
data.et: May you perfume the lord of demons with excellent holy scents; let the priests place him wearing a garland, head eastwards, on a deerskin.

data.v: यज्ञ-पात्राणि गोत्रेषु चिनुयाच्च यथा-विधि । जुहुयाच्च हविर्वह्नौ गायेयुः साम सामगाः।" ॥
data.et: May he place, as per prescriptions, the sacrificial utensils on his limbs and offer an oblation in fire. Let the Sama reciters chant Sama hymns.'"

data.v: गत्वा ऽथ ते पुरीं लङ्कां कृत्वा सर्वं यथोदितम् । समीपेऽन्त्याऽऽहुतेः साऽस्राः प्रोक्तवन्तो विभीषणम् ॥
data.et: Thereafter, having gone to the city of Lanka and having done everything as per instructions, they, with tears, spoke to Vibhisapa, when the final oblation was nearby.

data.v: "कृतं सर्वं यथोद्दिष्टं कर्तुं वह्नि-जल-क्रियाम् । प्रयतेथा महाराज ! सह सर्वैः स्व-बन्धुभिः ॥
data.et: "Everything is done as ordered : Oh great king, may you, with all your relatives exert to perform the cremation and the water-offering

data.v: अज्ञा-वन्नोत्सहेथास्त्वं धेया धीर-त्वम-च्युतम् । स्थेयाः कार्येषु बन्धूनां हेयाः शोकोद्भवं तमः ॥
data.et: "Why do you, likene ignorant person, not get ready: pick up excellent courage ; may you abide by (your) duty to (your) kinsmen and abandon the bewilderment (delusion) arising from grief.

data.v: नाऽवकल्प्यमिदं ग्लायेद्यत्कृच्छ्रेषु भवानपि । न पृथग्-जन-वज्जातु प्रमुह्येत्पण्डितो जनः ॥
data.et: ‘‘This is inconceivable that you too should despond in calamities. A wise person should never be excessively stupified like an ordinary person.

data.v: यच्च यत्र भवांस्तिष्ठेत्तत्रा ऽन्यो रावणस्य न । यच्च यत्र भवान्सीदेन्महद्भिस्तद्विगर्हितम् ॥
data.et: None else of Ravana's (men may stand) wherever and for whatever you may stand; and where and what you may despair ( get disheartened ) aboutis condemned by the magnanimous.

data.v: आश्चर्यं यच्च यत्र त्वां प्रब्रूयाम वयं हितम् ।अपि साक्षात्प्रशिष्यास्त्वं कृच्छ्रेष्विन्द्र-पुरोहितम् ॥
data.et: It is strange that we have to tell you (as to) what is beneficial and where. For, in difficulty, you may (i.e., are able to) instruct (advise) even Brhaspati himself (in person).

data.v: कामो जनस्य"जह्यास्त्वं प्रमादं नैरृताऽधिप !" ।उत द्विषोऽनुशोचेयुर्विप्लवे किमु बान्धवाः ॥
data.et: Oh lord of demons, it is the peoples will that you should abandon0 (this) lapse (from duty) ; even enemies may lament during (this) calamity; what then (of) kinsmen ?

data.v: स भवान्भ्रातृ-वद्रक्षेद्यथावदखिलं जनम् । न भवान्संप्रमुह्येच्चेदाश्वस्युश्च निशाचराः ॥
data.et: If your majesty would not be stupified and your honour may protect all the people like your brethren, according to convention, then the demons may feel reassured."

data.v: ततः स गतवान्कर्तुं भ्रातुरग्नि-जल-क्रियाम्। । प्रोक्तवान्कृत-कर्तव्यं वचो रामोऽथ राक्षसम् ॥
data.et: Thereupon, he proceeded to perform the cremation of and give water-offerings to (his) brother. Then Rama addressed (him) who had done his duty, these words, as he (Rama).

data.v: अम्भांसि रुक्म-कुम्भेन सिञ्चन्मूर्धि समाधिमान् । "त्वं राजा रक्षसां लङ्का- मवेक्षेथा विभीषन ? ॥
data.et: —sprinkled waters on his (Vibhisapa's) head with golden pitchers: "Possessed of concentration, you, Oh Vibhisana, the king of the demons, should look after (protect) Lanka.

data.v: क्रुद्धाननुनयेः सम्यक्धनैर्लुब्धानुपार्जयेः । मानिनो मानयेः काले त्रस्तान्पौलस्त्य ! सान्त्वयेः ॥
data.et: You may, Oh Vibhisapa, pacify properly the enraged, win over the avaricious with riches, honour the proud at the proper time (and) console the distressed.

data.v: इच्छा मे परमा नन्देः कथं त्वं वृत्र-शत्रु-वत् ।इच्छेद्धि सुहृदं सर्वो वृद्धि-संस्थं यतः सुहृत् ॥
data.et: How would you rejoice Like Indra, (that) is my highest desire; for, every friend will wish (his) friend to remain steady in prosperity.

data.v: वर्धिषीष्टाः स्वजातेषु वध्यास्त्वं रिपु-संहतीः । भूयास्त्वं गुणिनां मान्यस्तेषां स्थेया व्यवस्थितौ ॥
data.et: May you rise higher among your own kith and kin ; may you kill hosts of demons; may you become respectable (adorable) to the virtuous and abide by their arrangements (rulings).

data.v: धेयास्त्वं सुहृदां प्रीतिं वन्दिषीष्ठा दिवौकसः । सोमं पेयाश्च हेयाश्च हिंस्रा हानि-करीः क्रियाः ॥
data.et: May you sustain the delight of (your) friends, bow to the gods, drink Soma juice) (and) give up harmful actions.

data.v: अवसेयाश्च कार्याणि धर्मेण पुर-वासिनाम् ।अनुरागं क्रिया राजन् ! सदा सर्व-गतं जने ॥
data.et: May you settle the business of the citizens according to rules (Dharma) and, Oh king, may you always bestow all pervading affection on the people.

data.v: घानिषीष्ट त्वया मन्युर्ग्राहिषीष्ट समुन्नतिः । रक्षोभिर्दर्शिषीष्ठास्त्वं द्रक्षीरन्भवता च ते ॥
data.et: May grief be destroyed; may all-round progress be seized by you ; may you be seen by the demons and they be seen by your Majesty.

data.v: मन्युं वध्या भट-वध-कृतं बाल-वृद्धस्य राजन् ! शास्त्राऽभिज्ञाः सदसि सु-धियः सन्निधिं ते क्रियासुः । संरंसीष्ठाः सुर-मुनि-गते वर्त्मनि प्राज्य-धर्मे संभुत्सीष्ठाः सु-नय-नयनैर्विद्विषामीहितानि।" ॥
data.et: "Oh King, smother the grief of the children and the aged produced by the slaying of a warrior. Let intelligent (men) well-versed in the exigencies of the sciences be by your side in the assembly; may you attain delight in (following the path abounding in righteousness ard traversed by the gods and the sages; (and), by means of the eyes in the form of good policies, may you understand well the motives (intentions) of your enemies."

data.v: समुपेत्य ततः सीतामुक्तवान्पवनाऽऽत्मजः । दिष्ट्या वर्धस्व वैदेहि ! हतस्त्रैलोक्य-कण्टकः ॥
data.et: Then having approached Sita, Maruti said, "Oh Videha Princess, may you prosper by good fortune. The thorn of the three worlds (Ravana) is slain.

data.v: अनुजानीहि हन्यन्तां मयैताः क्षुद्र-मानसाः । रक्षिकास्तव राक्षस्यो गृहाणैतासु मत्सरम् ॥
data.et: "Permit me ; let these meanminded demonessess, your guards, be killed by me ; entertain anger towards these.

data.v: तृण्हानि दुराऽऽचारघोर-रूपाऽऽशय-क्रियाः । हिंस्रा भवतु ते बुद्धिरेतास्कुरु निष्ठुरम् ॥
data.et: I would kill (these guards) whose behaviour is evil and whose forms, intentions and actions are dreadful ; let your intention be harmful to these ; act mercilessly.

data.v: पश्चिमं करवामैतत्प्रियं देवि ! वयं तव" । ततः प्रोक्तवती सीता वानरं करुणाऽऽशया ॥
data.et: "Let us do this final (deed) pleasurable to you." Then Sita, whose heart was compassionate, spoke to the monkey thus:

data.v: "उपशाम्यतु ते बुद्धिः पिण्ड-निर्वेश-कारिषु । लघु-सत्वेषु दोषोऽयं यत्-कृतो-निहतो ऽसकौ ॥
data.et: May your mind calm down towards these insignificant creatures who make (their) living on morsels. The wretch by whom this crime was committed is slain.

data.v: न हि प्रेष्य-वधं घोरं करवान्यस्तु ते मतिः ।एधि कार्य-करस्त्वं मे गत्वा प्रवद राघवम् ॥
data.et: May the intention I shall indulge in the cruel massacre of servants, be not yours. Be inclined to do my work. Having departed, you speak to Rama :

data.v: "दिदृक्षुर्मैथिली राम ! पश्यतु त्वाऽविलम्बितम्"। । तथेति स प्रतिज्ञाय गत्वा राघवमुक्तवान् ॥
data.et: Rama, let the Mithila Princess, desirous of seeing you, see you without delay' .' After promising, ‘‘As you say, and having gone, he said to Rama :

data.v: "उत्सुकाऽऽनीयतां देवी काकुत्स्थ-कुल-नन्दन !" । क्ष्मां लिखित्वा विनिश्वस्य स्वराऽऽलोक्य विभीषणम् ॥
data.et: Oh delighter of the Kakutstha family, let the pining queen be brought (here).” Having scratched the ground, sighed and looked up into the sky, to Vibhisana.

data.v: उक्तवान्राघवः-"सीतामानया ऽलंकृतामिति।" । गत्वा प्रणम्य तेनोक्ता मैथिली मधुरं वचः ॥
data.et: -Rama said, "Fetch Sita, (properly) decorated. " After having gone (to the place where Sita was), Sita was add ressed by him (these) sweet words:

data.v: "जहीहि शोकां वैदेहि ! प्रीतये धेहि मानसम् । रावणे जहिहि द्वेषां जहाहि प्रमदा-वनम् ॥
data.et: "Give up grief, Oh Videha Princess, set your mind on delight; dismiss hatred towards Ravana ; leave the ladies ' grove;

data.v: स्नाह्यनुलिम्प धूपाय निवस्स्वाऽऽविध्य च स्रजम् । रत्नान्याऽऽमुञ्च संदीप्ते हविर्जुहुधि पावके ॥
data.et: ‘Bathe, anoint,fumigate with incense, dress up in (rich) clothes, wear a garland, put on jewellery and offer an oblation in enkindled fire.

data.v: अद्धि त्वं पञ्च-गव्यं च छिन्धि संरोध-जं तमः ।आरोह शिबिकां हैमीं द्विषां जहि मनो-रथान् ॥
data.et: ‘Consume the pentamix-cow-product (panica-gavya) and dispel the gloom arising from imprisonment, Mount a golden palanquin, thwart the desires of the enemies.

data.v: तृणेढु त्वद्-वियोगोत्थां राजन्यानां पतिः शुचम् । भवतादधियुक्ता त्वमत ऊर्ध्वं स्व-वेश्मनि ॥
data.et: May the Lord of the Ksatriyas and the grief arising from your separation. May you henceforward be in your own house, united (with Rama).

data.v: दीक्षस्व सह रामेण त्वरितं तुरगाऽध्वरे । दृश्यस्व पत्या प्रीतेन प्रीत्या प्रेक्षस्व राघवम् ॥
data.et: May you soon be consecrated with Rama in a horse sacrifice; may you be looked at by your delighted husband; ( yourself) pleased, behold Rama.

data.v: अयं नियोगः पत्युस्ते कार्या नाऽत्र विचारणा । भूषया ऽङ्गं प्रमाणं चेद्रामं गन्तुं यतस्व च ॥
data.et: This is the command of your husband; no investi gation need be done herein. If authentic (these words) be to you , adorn (your) body and exert to go to Rama.

data.v: मुदा संयुहि काकुत्स्थं स्वयं चा ऽऽप्नूहि सम्पदम् ।उपेह्यूर्ध्वं मुहूर्तात्त्वं देवि ! राघव-सन्निधिम् ॥
data.et: ‘Unite Rama with joy, and yourself too acquire ecstacy. Oh Queen, you reach the vicinity of Rama within a thrita.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वं मुहूर्तादह्नो ऽङ्ग ! स्वामिनी स्म भव क्षितेः । राज-पत्नी-नियोग-स्थमनुशाधि पुरी-जनम् ॥
data.et: After a muhra of the day, Oh queen, be the mistress of the earth. Ordain the people of the city who abide by the orders of the King's wife.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठस्व मते पत्युर्यतस्वा ऽलङ्कृतौ तथा । प्रतिष्ठस्व च तं द्रष्टुं द्रष्टव्यं त्वं मही-पतिम्।" ॥
data.et: “Stand up by the intention of (your) husband; so also exert for personal decoration and you proceed to see that King who deserves to be seen.'"

data.v: अनुष्ठाय यथाऽऽदिष्टं नियोगं जनकाऽऽत्मजा । ममारूढवती यानं पट्टांऽशुक-वृताऽऽनना ॥
data.et: Having carried out the order as instructed, Janaka's daughter, who had covered her face with a silken garment, mounted the vehicle.

data.v: लज्जाऽनता विसंयोग-दुःख-स्मरण-विह्वला । साऽस्रा गत्वा ऽन्तिकं पत्युर्दीना रुदितवत्यसौ ॥
data.et: Bent down in shyness, pained by the recollection of the grief of separation, full of tears, that poor (pitiable) one wept after reaching the vicinity of her husband.

data.v: प्राप्त-चारित्र्य-सन्देहस्ततस्तामुक्तवान्नृपः ।इच्छामे-"ना ऽऽददे सीते ! त्वामहं गम्यतामतः" ॥
data.et: Then the King, who had attained (felt) a suspicion regarding her behaviour, spoke to her : ‘This is my desire; I should not accept you ; go away from here,

data.v: रावणाऽङ्क-परिश्लिष्टा त्वं हृल्-लेख-करी मम । मतिं बधान सुग्रीवे  राक्षसेन्द्रं गृहाण वा ॥
data.et: Molested on Ravana's lap, you who have left scars on my heart, fix your mind on Sugriva or take to the lord of the demons.

data.v: अशान भरताद्भोगान्लक्ष्मणं प्रवृणीष्व वा । कामाद्वा याहि मुच्यन्तामाशा राम-निबन्धनाः ॥
data.et: Enjoy pleasures from Bharata or choose Laksmana, or go away at your will; let the hopes fixed on Rama be given up.

data.v: क्व च ख्यातो रघोर्वंशः क्व तं पर-गृहोषिता ।अन्यस्मै हृदयं देहि ना ऽनभीष्टे घटामहे ॥
data.et: ‘‘Where (is) the renowned race of Raghu and where (are) {you who stayed in the enemys house ? Give your heart to someone else ; we do not indulge in undesired things.

data.v: यथेष्टं चर वैदेहि ! पन्थानः सन्तु ते शिवाः । कामास्तेऽन्यत्र तायन्तां विशङ्कां त्यज मद्-गताम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘Act as you wish, Oh Videha Princess; may your ways be auspicious ; let your desires develop elsewhere; give up (all) fear from me".

data.v: ततः प्रगदिता वाक्यं मैथिलाऽभिजना नृपम् । "स्त्रीसामान्येन सम्भूता शङ्का मयि विमुच्यताम् ॥
data.et: Then (Sita), whose relatives were from Mithila, addressed this utterance to Rama, May the suspicion arising (as if) from a common woman be given up with reference to me.

data.v: दैवाद्बिभीहि काकुत्स्थ ! जिह्रीहि त्वं तथा जनात् । मिथ्या मामभिसंक्रुध्य- न्न-वशां शत्रुणा हृताम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘Fear fate , so also shy away from the people, Oh Rama, who are, in vain, getting enraged with me who was help less and (hence) kidnapped by the enemy.

data.v: चेतसस्त्वयि वृत्तिर्मे शरीरं रक्षसा हृतम् । विदांकुर्वन्तु सम्यञ्चो देवाः सत्यमिदं वचः ॥
data.et: The activity of my mind rests on you; (only) the body was abducted by the demon; let the equanimous gods, verify this true statement.

data.v: त्वं पुनीहि पुनीहीति पुनन्वायो ! जगत्त्रयम् । चरन्देहेषु भूतानां विद्धि मे बुद्धि-विप्लवम् ॥
data.et: Oh Wind, you who purify the three worlds (saying), ‘do purify, do purify' ( and ) circulate in the bodies of beings, ascertain (if there is any) aberration in my mind.

data.v: खमट द्यामटा ऽटोर्वीमित्यटन्त्यो ऽति-पावनाः । यूयमापो ! विजानीत मनो-वृत्तिं शुभां मम ॥
data.et: ‘Oh extremely purifying waters that wander about (saying), ‘traverse the sky, traverse the heaven, traverse the earth', ascertain my auspicious mental disposition.

data.v: जगन्ति धत्स्व धत्स्वेति दधती त्वं वसुन्धरे ! ।अवेहि मम चारित्रं नक्तं-दिवम-विच्युतम् ॥
data.et: "Oh Earth, you who sustain the worlds, (saying) do support, do support, know my character which has not swerved (fallen) day and night.

data.v: रसान्संहर दीप्यस्व ध्वान्तं जहि नभो भ्रम ।इतीहमानस्तिग्मांऽशो ! वृत्तं ज्ञातुं घटस्व मे ॥
data.et: ‘'Oh Sun, you who exert (saying), ‘withdraw (suck up) the water, shine, destroy darkness, traverse the sky, try to under stand my behaviour.

data.v: स्वर्गे विद्यस्व भुव्याऽऽस्व भुजङ्ग-निलये भव ।एवं वसन्ममा ऽऽकाश ! संबुध्यस्व कृताऽकृतम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘Oh sky, who abide (saying), exist in the heaven, stay on the earth, be in the abode of the snakes, ascertain my commissions and omissions .

data.v: चितां कुरु च सौमित्रे ! व्यसनस्या ऽस्य भेषजम् । रामस्तुष्यतु मे वा ऽद्य पापां प्लुष्णातु वा ऽनलः ॥
data.et: And Oh Laksmana, prepare a burning pyre, the antidote of this censure; let either Rama be satisfied with me today or may the fire burn (me) out, the sinner."

data.v: राघवस्य मतेना ऽथ लक्ष्मणेनाऽऽचितां चिताम् । दृष्ट्वा प्रदक्षिणीकृत्य रामं प्रगदिता वचः ॥
data.et: Then after seeing the burning pyre arranged by Laksmana with the consent of Rama, Sita, having gone round Rama from the right, addressed a declaration to Rama :

data.v: प्रवपाणि वपुर्वह्नौ रासा ऽहं शाङ्किता त्वया । सर्वे विदन्तु शृण्वन्तु भवन्तः स प्लवङ्गमाः ॥
data.et: Oh Rama, suspected by you, I sacrifice my body in the fire. May you all, including the monkeys , understand and listen.

data.v: मां दुष्टां ज्वलित-वपुः प्लुषाण वह्ने ! संरक्ष क्षत-मलिनां सुहृद्यथा वा ।एषा ऽहं क्रतुषु वसोर्यथा ऽऽज्य-धारा त्वां प्राप्ता विधि-वदुदीर्ण-दीप्ति-मालम् ॥
data.et: Oh Fire of a blazing form, burn me out, (if I be) violated (Sullied); otherwise protect (me) like a friend (who is) disproved (to be) impure. Here, like the stream (trickle) of ghee for Vasu, have I, according to the prescribed rites, come to you who have shot out a garland of flames. ”

data.v: समुत्क्षिप्य ततो वह्निर्मैथिलीं राममुक्तवान् । "काकुत्स्थ ! दयितां साध्वीं त्वमाशङ्किष्यथाः कथम् ॥
data.et: Thereafter, having lifted up the Mithila princess, God Fire spoke to Rama (these) words : "Oh Rama, how did you suspect (your) chaste, beloved (wife) ?

data.v: ना भविष्यदियं शुद्धा यद्यपास्यमहं ततः । न चैनां पक्षपातो मे धर्मादन्यत्र राघव ! ॥
data.et: ‘I would certainly not have protected her if she were not pure; I have no partiality towards anything else than Dharma (righteousness).

data.v: अपि तत्र-रिपुः सीतां ना ऽर्थयिष्यत दुर्-मतिः । क्रूरं जात्ववदिष्यच्च जात्वस्तोष्यच्छ्रियं स्वकाम् ॥
data.et: Had the enemy not been evil-minded, he would not once have solicited Sita, spoken wickedly and praised his own riches.

data.v: सङ्कल्पं ना ऽकरिष्यच्च तत्रेयं शुद्ध-मानसा । सत्याऽमर्षमवाप्स्यस्त्वं रामः सीता-निबन्धनम् ॥
data.et: And, this pure-minded one never entertained a desire therein (for him). (I cannot understand how) you, Rama, attained a true wrath upon Sita.

data.v: त्वया ऽद्रक्ष्यत किं ना ऽस्याः शीलं संवसता चिरम् ।अदर्शिष्यन्त वा चेष्टाः कालेन बधुना न किम् ॥
data.et: Living together for long, was her character not observed, or were her activities not watched for a long time by you ?

data.v: यावज्जिवमशोचिष्यो ना ऽहास्यश्चेदिदं तमः । भानुरप्यपतिष्यत्क्ष्मामक्षोभिष्यत चेदियम् ॥
data.et: If you would not discard this illusion, you would repent as long as there is life (in you). If this one were agitated, even the Sun would fall down on the earth.

data.v: समपत्स्यत राजेन्द्र ! स्त्रैणं यद्यत्र चापलम् । लोक-पाला इहा ऽऽयास्यंस्ततो ना ऽमी कलि-द्रुहः ॥
data.et: If rashness, natural to womanhood, had occurred here (in Sita), then the protectors of the worlds who hate sin would not have come here.

data.v: आश्चर्यं यच्च यत्र स्त्री कृच्छ्रे ऽवर्त्स्यन्मते तव । त्रासादस्यां विनष्टायां किं किमालप्स्यथाः फलम् ॥
data.et: "Oh wonder, what and where ? If a woman, on your consent would abide in torment, Oh, what fruit would you acquire, if she be destroyed due to fear ?

data.v: यत्र यच्चा ऽमरिष्यत्स्त्री साध्वसाद्दोष-वर्जिता । तदसूया-रतौ लोके तस्या वाच्या ऽऽस्पदं मृषा ॥
data.et: ‘‘What and where ? If a woman devoid of vice (crime) would die through fear, it would wrongly be an object of censure in (this) world addicted to envy.

data.v: अमंत्स्य भवान्यद्वद्तथैव च पिता तव । ना ऽऽगमिष्यद्विमान-स्थः साक्षाद्दशरथो नृपः ॥
data.et: And if your father had thought just as you (did), (he) King Dasaratha would not have come here in person, seated in a plane.

data.v: ना ऽकल्प्स्यत्सन्निधिं स्थानुः शूली वृषभ-वाहनः ।अन्वभाविष्यता ऽन्येन मैथिली चेत्पतिव्रता ॥
data.et: ‘The trident-bearing Sthanu (Siva) who has a bull for conveyance, would not have effected (his) presence here, if Sia had been enjoyed by someone else.

data.v: आनन्दयिष्यदागम्य कथं त्वामरविन्द-सत् । राजेन्द्र ! विश्व-सूर्धाता चारित्र्ये सीतया क्षते ॥
data.et: 'How would the Creator of the universe, God Brahma, sitting on a lotus, have delighted you, oh King of kings, if Sta's character were sullied ?’’

data.v: प्रणमन्ब्रह्मणा प्रोक्तो राजका ऽधिपतिस्ततः । "ना शोत्स्यन्मैथिली लोके नाऽऽचरिष्यदिदं यदि ॥
data.et: Thereafter the saluting Lord of the circle of Kings was spoken to by Brahma : "If Sita had not performed this, then she would not have been in (the eyes of) the world.

data.v: नाऽमोक्ष्याम वयं शङ्का- मिहाधास्यन्न चेद्भवान् । किं वा चित्रमिदं युक्तं भवान्यदकरिष्यत ॥
data.et: We would not have discarded suspicion, if you had not set here this act (the fire ordeal). Or what is strange in that you did what was proper.

data.v: प्रावर्तिष्यन्त चेष्टाश्चेद्-याथातथ्य-वत्तव ।अनुशास्ये त्वया लोके रामाऽवर्त्स्यंस्तरां ततः ॥
data.et: If your activities had proceeded without accordance to truth, then, Oh Rama they would have been still more (so) among the people to be disciplined by you."

data.v: प्राणमन्तम्ततो राममुक्तवानिति शङ्करः । "किं नारायणमात्मानं ना ऽभोत्स्यत भवानजम् ॥
data.et: Then Sankara spoke thus to Rama who saluting, "What ? Did you not remember yourself (as) the unborn Narayana ?

data.v: को न्यो ऽकर्त्स्यदिह प्राणान्दृप्तानां च सुर-द्विषाम् । को वा विश्वजनीनेषु कर्मसु प्राघटिष्यत ॥
data.et: And who else here would have destroyed the life breaths of the enemies of the gods ? Or, who would have applied (himself) to deeds beneficial to all the people ?

data.v: दैत्य-क्षये महा-राज ! यच्च यत्रा ऽघटिष्यथाः । समाप्तिं जातु तत्रापि किं ना ऽनेष्यस्त्वमीहितम् ॥
data.et: Oh Emperor, in whatever (incarnation) and wherever you exerted in (bringing about the destruction of the demons, why did you not, even once, carry to a finish (your) undertaking therein only?"

data.v: तातं प्रसाद्य कैयेय्या भरताय प्रपीडितम् । सहस्र-चक्षुषं रामो निनंसुः परिदृष्टवान् ॥
data.et: Having pleased his father who had been harassed excessively by Kaikeyi for the sake of Bharata, Rama desirous of bowing down, saw Indra.

data.v: प्रेता वरेण शक्रस्य प्राणन्तः कपयस्ततः । संजाताः फलिना ऽऽनम्र-रोचिष्णु-द्रुम-सद्रवः ॥
data.et: Then, by the boon of Indra, the dead monkeys, who began breathing, (again) became denizens of fruit-bearing trees bent low and resplendent.

data.v: भ्रमर कुला ऽऽकुलोल्बण-सुगन्धि-पुष्प-तरुस्तरुण-मधूक-सम्भव-पिशङ्गित-तुङ्ग-शिखः । शिखर-शिला ऽन्तराल-परिक्wxल्क़्क़्प्त-जला ऽवसरः स-रस-फल-श्रियं स विततान सुवेल-गिरिः ॥
data.et: That Suvela mountain which had flowering trees, intensely fragrant and crowded with swarms of bees, whose lofty summit was rendered golden brown by the fresh flowers of the madhuka trees (and) from the interspaces of the rocks on whose summits down-flowing streams of water were produced, spread out a luxuriance (glory) of juicy fruits.

data.v: संवाद्भिः स-कुसुम-रेणुभिः समीरै- रानम्रैर्बहु-फल-धारिभिर्वना ऽन्तैः । श्च्योतद्भिर्मधु-पटलैश्च वानराणामाप्यानो रिपु-वध-सम्भवः प्रमोदः ॥
data.et: By the blowing breezes full of the pollen of flowers, by the slightly curved outskirts of the forest which bore ample fruits, and by the dripping honeycombs was enhanced the monkeys' rapturous delight arising out of the killing of the enemies.

data.v: आयान्त्यः स्व-फल-भरेण भङ्गुरत्वं भृङ्गाऽऽली-निचय-चिता लतास्तरूणाम् । सा ऽऽमोदाः क्षिति-तल-संस्थिताऽवलोप्या भोक्त्णां ष्रममदयं न नीतवत्यः ॥
data.et: Reaching a breaking point on account of their own fruit-load, the creepers on the trees covered with throngs of rows of bees, full of fragrance, pluckable by one seated on the surface of the ground, did not bring any rise of fatigue to those who enjoyed (them).

data.v: ततो रामो हनूमन्तमुक्तवान्हृष्ट-मानसम् । "अयोध्यां श्वः प्रयातासि कपे ! भरत-पालिताम् ॥
data.et: Then Rama spoke to Hanuman whose mind was delighted :, Oh monkey, tomorrow you will proceed to Ayodhya, governed by Bharata.

data.v: गाधितासे नभो भूयः स्फुटन्-मेघ-घटाऽऽवलि ।ईक्षितासे ऽम्भसां पत्युः पयः शिशिर-शीकरम् ॥
data.et: Once again, you will plunge into the sky with its rows of clouds parted, will see the water of the Lord of waters (Ocean) having cool spray.

data.v: सेवितासे प्लवङ्ग ! त्वं महेन्द्रा ऽद्रेरधित्यकाः । व्युत्क्रान्त-वर्त्मनो भानोः सह-ज्योत्स्ना-कुमुद्वतीः ॥
data.et: "Oh monkey, you will enjoy the tablelands possessed of moonlight and moon-lotus plants of the Mahendra mountain which has transgressed the path of the sun.

data.v: चन्दन-द्रुम-संच्छन्ना निराकृत-हिम-श्रथाः । दर्शितारस्त्वया ताश्च मलयोपत्यकाः शुभाः ॥
data.et: "And by you will be beheld those beautiful lowlands of the Malaya (mountain), that are veiled under sandal trees and have sighted the moon.

data.v: प्रतन्व्यः कोमला विन्ध्ये सहितारः स्यदं न ते । लताः स्तबक-शालिन्यो मधुलेहि-कुलाऽऽकुलाः ॥
data.et: "On the Vindhya (mountain) the very slender and delicate creepers, shining with flower bunches and crowded with throngs of bees, will not bear your speed.

data.v: द्रष्टासि प्रीति-मानारात्सखिभिः सह सेविताम् । स-पक्षपातं किष्किन्धां पूर्व-क्रीडां स्मरन्मुहुः ॥
data.et: Repeatedly remembering (your) former sports, you, who are full of delight, will observe lovingly, from near , Kiskindha.

data.v: त्वया सन्दर्शितारौ ते माल्यवद्-दण्डका-वने ।उपद्रुतश्चिरं द्वन्द्वैर्ययोः क्लिशितवानहम् ॥
data.et: By you will be seen , those two, the Malyavan (mountain) and the Dandaka forest where, overpowered by the pairs (of opposites, viz., pleasure and pain etc.), I suffered pangs for long.

data.v: आप्तारौ भवता रम्यावाश्रमौ हरिणा ऽऽकुलौ । पुण्योदक-द्विजाऽऽकीर्णौ सुतीक्ष्ण-शरभङ्गयोः ॥
data.et: "By you will be reached the two charming hermitages, of Sutikspa and Sarabhaiga--crowded with deer and full of holy water and brahmins.

data.v: अतिक्रान्ता त्वया रम्यं दुःखमत्रेस्तपो-वनम् । पवित्र-चित्रकूटे ऽद्रौ त्वं स्थातासि कुतूहलात् ॥
data.et: "By you, the penancegrove of Atri shall be by-passed sorrowfully, (but) you will, out of curiosity, halt on the sacred Citrakuta mountain."

data.v: ततः परं भरद्वाजो भवता दर्शिता मुनिः । द्रष्टारश्च जनाः पुन्या यामुनाऽम्बुक्षतांऽहसः ॥
data.et: "Thereafter will be seen by you the sage Bharadwaja and you will be perceived (also ) by the holy people whose sins are destroyed by the waters of river Yamuna.

data.v: स्यन्त्वा स्यन्त्वा दिवः शम्भोर्- मूर्ध्नि स्कन्त्वा भुवं गताम् । गाहितासे ऽथ पुण्यस्य गङ्गां मूर्तिमिव द्रुताम् ॥
data.et: "You will then be diving into the Ganges, like a melted image of righteousness that had come down to the earth after flowing and flowing in the heaven and jumped down on the head of Siva.

data.v: तमसाया महा-नील-पाषाण-सदृश-त्विषः । वना ऽन्तात्बहु मन्तासे नागराऽऽक्रीड-शाखिनः ॥
data.et: ‘‘You will very much admire, along river Tamasa, the forest regions whose lustre is similar to huge sapphire rocks and which bear witness to the sports of the citizens.

data.v: नगर-स्त्री-स्तन-न्यस्त-धौत-कुङ्कुम-पिञ्जराम् । विलोक्य सरयूं रम्यां गन्ता ऽयोध्या त्वया पुरी ॥
data.et: After having seen the attractive Sarayu river, yellowish-red with the saffron applied to and then washed away from the breasts of the ladies of the city, the city of Ayodhya will be reached by you.

data.v: आनन्दितारस्त्वां दृष्ट्वा प्रष्टारश्चावयोः शिवम् । मातरः सह मैथिल्या तोष्टा च भरतः परम् ॥
data.et: Having seen you, (my) mothers will rejoice and enquire about the welfare of both of us along with that of the Mithila Princess, and Bharata will exult extremely.

data.v: आख्यातासि हतं शत्रुमभिषिक्तं विभीषणम् । सुग्रीवं चा ऽर्जितं मित्रं सर्वांश्चाऽऽगामुकान्द्रुतम् ॥
data.et: You will report about the slain enemy, coronated Vibhisana and befriended Sugriva -all (of whom are) about to arrive (there) soon.

data.v: गन्तारः परमां प्रीतिं पौराः ष्रुत्वा वचस्तव । ज्ञात्वैतत्सम्मुखीनश्च समेता भरतो ध्रुवम् ॥
data.et: 'on hearing your statement, the citizens will attain great delight and, on knowing this, Bharata will surely come out to meet (welcome) you.

data.v: गते त्वयि पथा ऽनेन वयमप्यंहितास्महे । लब्धाहे ऽहं धृतिं प्राप्ते भूयो भवति सम्मुखे ॥
data.et: "You having gone by this route, we too shall proceed. I shall acquire satisfaction when you will again arrive facing (me)."

data.v: गते तस्मिन्गृहीता ऽर्थे रामः सुग्रीव-राक्षसौ ।उक्तवान्श्वो ऽभिगन्तास्थो युवां सह मया पुरम् ॥
data.et: He, who had comprehended the substance (of the message) having been gone, Rama said to Sugriva and the demon, "Tomorrow you two will go with me to (my) city.

data.v: द्रष्टास्थस्तत्र तिस्रो मे मात्स्तुष्टऽन्तराऽऽत्मनः ।आन्त्यन्तीनं सखि-त्वं च प्राप्तास्थो भरता ऽऽश्रयम् ॥
data.et: ‘‘There, you two will see my three mothers whose inner souls are satisfied and will acquire the far-reaching friendship entertained by Bharata.

data.v: नैवं विरह-दुःखेन वयं व्याघानितास्महे । श्रमो नुभविता नैवं भवद्भ्यां च वियोग-जः ॥
data.et: ‘‘Thus we shall not be struck by the agony of

data.v: एवं युवां मम प्रीत्यै कल्प्तास्थः कपि-राक्षसौ ! । गन्तुं प्रयतितासाथे प्रातः सह मया यदि ॥
data.et: Oh Monkey and Demon, if you will exert in the morning to go along with me, you two will thus prepare for my delight.

data.v: उत्कवन्तौ ततो रामं वचः पौलस्त्य-वानरौ ।अनुग्रहो ऽयं काकुत्स्थ ! गन्तास्वो यत्त्वया सह ॥
data.et: Thereafter Vibhisana and the Monkey (Sugriva) addressed (these) words to Rama, This, Oh Rama, (is) a favour that we two shall go with you.

data.v: अनुमन्तास्वहे नाऽऽवां भवन्तं विरहं त्वया ।अपि प्राप्य सुरेन्द्र-त्वं किं नु प्रत्तं त्वया ऽऽस्पदम् ॥
data.et: We two shall not consent to impending separation from you, even on acquiring the status of the Lord of the gods. What then of a position bestowed by you."

data.v: ततः कथाभिः समतीत्य दोषा- मारुह्य सैन्यैः सह पुष्पकं ते । सम्प्रस्थिता वेग-वशाद-गाधं प्रक्षोभयन्तः सलिलं पयोधेः ॥
data.et: After having passed the night, they, along with army having mounted the Puspaka, took off, agitating the unfathomable waters of the ocean under the impact of (their) speed.

data.v: सेतुं महेन्द्रं मलयं स-विन्ध्यं स-माल्यवन्तं गिरिमृष्यमूकम् । स-दण्डकाऽरण्य-वातीं च पम्पां रामः प्रियायाः कथयन्जगाम ॥
data.et: Rama travelled, explaining to Sita about the bridge (over the sea), the Mahendra (mountain), the Malaya along with the Vindhya, and the Rsyamuka mountain along with the Malyavan, and the Pampa lake together with the Dandaka forest :

data.v: एते ते मुनि-जन-मण्डिता दिगन्ताः शैलोऽयं लुलित-वनः स चित्रकूटः । गङ्गेयं सु-तनु-! विशाल-तीर-रम्या मैथिल्या रघु-तनयो दिशन्ननन्द ॥
data.et: "These (are) the ends of the quarters adorned by the sage-folk; this (is) the Citrakuta mountain whose forests are shaken. Oh beautiful-bodied one, this (is) the Ganges delightful with its vast banks." Pointing (them) out to Sita, Rama rejoiced.

data.v: शिञ्जान-भ्रमर-कुलाऽऽकुलाऽग्र-पुष्पाः शीता-ऽम्भः-प्रविलय-संप्लवा ऽभिलीनाः ।एते ते सु-तनु ! पुरी-जनोपभोग्या दृश्यन्ते नयन-मनोरमा वना ऽन्ताः ॥
data.et: Oh Sita of charming form, here are seen the forest regions wherein the tips of the flowers are swarmed by throngs of humming bees, which are enveloped all over is the surge caused by the complete absorption of cool water, enjoyable for the people of the city (and) attractive to the eyes.

data.v: स्थानं नः पूर्व-जानामियमधिकमसौ प्रेयसी पूरयोध्या दूरादालोक्यते या हुत-विविध-हविः- प्रीणिता ऽशेष-देवा । सो ऽयं देशो रुदन्तं पुर-जनमखिलं यत्र हित्वा प्रयातौ आवां सीते ! वना ऽन्तं सह धृत-धृतिना लक्ष्मणेन क्षपाऽन्ते ॥
data.et: This, the place of our ancestors, this very dear city of Ayodhya wherein all the Gods without a remnant are propitiated with various oblations offered (to them), is seen from afar ; this, Oh Sita, is the region from where having left all the citizen-folk weeping, we two , along with Laksmana who had sustained his courage, went at the end of the night to the sylvan region.

data.v: तूर्याणामथ निःस्वनेन सकलं लोकं समापूरयन्विक्रान्तैः करिणां गिरीन्द्र-सदृशां क्ष्मां कम्पयन्सर्वतः । सा ऽऽनन्दा ऽश्रु-विलोचनः प्रकृतिभिः सार्धं सहा ऽन्तः पुरः सम्प्राप्तो भरतः स-मारुतिरलं नम्रः समं मातृभिः ॥
data.et: Thereafter, pervading the whole world with the loud blare of the trumpet, causing the earth to quake on all sides by the strides of the monkeys, (by Rama) was reached Bharata along with the mothers accompanied by the ladies of the harem, with the subjects and in the company of Maruti, Bharata whose eyes bore tears of joy and who was amply bowed down (in salutation).

data.v: अथ स-सम्भ्रम-पौर-जना ऽऽवृतो भरत-पाणि-धृतोज्ज्वल-चामरः । गुरु-जन-द्विज-बन्द्यभिनन्दितः प्रविशति स्म पुरं रघु-नन्दनः ॥
data.et: Now, surrounded by the bustling citizen-folk (and) congratulated by the elderly persons, brahmins and bards, Rama over whom a chowrie was held in Bharata's hand, entered the city.

data.v: प्रविधाय धृतिं परां जनानां युव-राजं भरतं ततोऽभिषिच्य । जघटे तुरगाऽध्वरेण यष्टुं कृत-सम्भार-विधिः पतिः प्रजानाम् ॥
data.et: Having inspired the highest contentment among the people, then, having crowned Bharata to the Crown-Prince's office, the Lord of the subjects who had made arrangements for the (necessary) materials, busied himself for performing the Horse-sacrifice.

data.v: इदमधिगत-मुक्ति-मार्ग-चित्रं विवदिषतां वदतां च सन्-निबन्धात् । जनयति विजयं सदा जनानां युधि सुसमाहितमैश्वरं यथा ऽस्त्रम् ॥
data.et: Striking by (its) ways of expression and well embellished, (when) studied, this (epic) by means of its excellent composition always produces victory for the discoursing and

data.v: दीप-तुल्यः प्रबन्धो ऽयं शब्द-लक्षण-चक्षुषाम् । हस्ता ऽमर्ष इवा ऽन्धानां भवेद्व्याकरणादृते ॥
data.et: This composition is comparable to a lamp for those who possess the eyes (in the form) of grammar ; without grammar it may be like the touch of the hand of the blind.

data.v: व्याख्या-गम्यमिदं काव्य- मुत्सवः सु-धियामलम् । हता दुर्-मेघसश्चा ऽस्मिन्विद्वत्-प्रिय-तया मया ॥
data.et: Comprehensible with (the help of) a commentary, if this (epic) poem may becomes a festivity for the highly intelligent, (it is) enough. Those of deficient intellect have been disappointed by me in this regard, on account of (my) fondness for the learned.

data.v: काव्यमिदं विहितं मया वलभ्यां श्रीधरसेन-नेरन्द्र-पालितायाम् । कीर्तिरतो भवतान्नृपस्य तस्य प्रेम-करः क्षिति-पो यतः प्रजानाम् ॥
data.et: This (epic) poem was composed by me in Valabhi, governed by Narendra, the son of Sridhara. May fame accrue to the king hereby, for the king is a producer of delight to the subjects.
